story:
Who?

I'm Brent Thomas. I'm a husband and father who works as an elementary school teacher and a camp manager. But I also manage to find time to podcast and write fiction.

I love writing and telling stories. It's how I relax. I don't really feel complete unless part of my time goes into creating worlds. As I got older, I'd almost let this hobby go, until about six years ago when I started using it to de-stress after work. Now, I have fully embraced that writing is part of who I am and that I want to share my writing with others.

In 2015, two very important things happened. Most important was that my wife and I welcomed our first child. But, before that happened I also managed to self-publish my first novel, Deadly Troubadours.

Now, I am putting the finishing touches on its sequel, Sand, Sea and Stone, and want to fund a limited edition print run.

Why?

When I put out my first novel, I originally just used various ebook services and Amazon's Createspace to make a paperback. I like all those services, but I'm based in Japan and (especially the paperbacks) aren't easy to get a hold of. Ordering it there can result in a month or two wait.

I found myself wanting to put out a locally printed copy, but I also new that if I did, it needed to be of superior quality to what is available through Amazon. Living where I am, there is now way I can match the low shipping and handling costs that Amazon provides, but what I can do is create a superior product.

I will use the same printer for Sand, Sea and Stone that I did for Deadly Troubadours. That means a book with high quality paper, a bit more width for more comfortable reading, color accent pages at the front and back for greater aesthetics. One thing that is true about Japan, they can do quality paper products. 

Goal

To sell books. No, really. I'm asking for $4000 USD. If all my contributors simple by a paperback (and the S/H) that is enough to sell 160 books. And, in all honesty it is enough to print about 300. The more I print, the cheaper per item they become. If I manage to print 200, the company estimate is that it would basically cost $12.50 to print. Since I'm charging $15 dollars a book, that gets me around $2.50 for every book sold. If you want to read a more detailed breakdown on pricing, visit this post.

Risks & Challenges

This is my second Indiegogo campaign. The first one was successful and I'm hoping this one will be as well. 

I'll be honest, my biggest worry is time. My wife and I are doing this as a team. But we have a two year old that we adore, and he manages to eat up a lot of our time. My last Indiegogo was for 30 days. This one is scheduled for 60. The reason is that I am almost certain that I won't be able to dedicate as much time to getting this accomplished as I could when he was only a few months old. He sleeps less and needs more play.

Outside of that I am dedicated to getting this print run out. I have funds set aside to do a minimum run of 200 copies. Of course, I would love for contributors to order up those copies so the I don't finish in the red. But this books will be printed and will be distributed.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word through Facebook, twitter, or any other social media you know of. If you have read Deadly Troubadours and didn't leave a review or rating at Goodreads, iTunes, and Amazon, please do so. 

And, I hate to ask for money on top of asking for money, there is also my Patreon site where you can pledge a monthly donation to help me continue writing and podcasting. Even a dollar a month makes a difference.

story:
¿Qué?

El doble es una disparatada oda a los dobles. Y al arte en todas sus manifestaciones. A la cultura y a la contracultura. Y al insondable secreto que reside en los procesos estocásticos.

En un antiguo tratado indio sobre esoterismo se explicaba la existencia de los dobles, más o menos, así: Todos tenemos un doble. Encontrarlo es imposible pues si una persona, que supiera de la existencia de su doble en el otro lado del mundo, se desplazara en dirección al lugar donde el doble habita, este lo haría en sentido contrario. Los dobles están destinados a no encontrarse jamás.  Vale. Es imposible que se encuentren nunca. A pesar de todo, ¿qué ocurriría si se encontraran? De ahí surge El doble, de coquetear con la posibilidad. O quizá de huir por el punto de fuga. Además de otras muchas cuestiones, que oscilan entre una reflexión sobre el África en venta, un emocionado homenaje al dadaísmo, una comprensión de la profundidad de pictórica como arcano a descubrir, una extravagante visión del nacionalismo catalán y del cálculo geográfico de las antípodas, una crítica a los realitys televisivos, un canto a los viejos reporteros de guerra y a los carteros y un análisis del miedo. Del que lo vence y lo busca. Y del que lo aborrece y lo evita.

Las intrahistorias de un buen número de personajes se entretejen y convergen con las de Héctor Espejo, un cartero de Barcelona muy viajado que busca comprender un antiguo secreto en el punto de fuga de una pintura, viajando para ello a un Madagascar en guerra, y Edmond Hinault, reportero de guerra francés, tuerto y cojo, que anhela huir en pos de la tranquilidad de la vida familiar y, mientras, se oculta de un sicario en su antiguo piso de Barcelona. Aunque ninguno sabe de la existencia del otro, ellos son los dos dobles protagonistas, dobles que van dejando rastros de sus reflexiones en cuadernos negros, rojos o grises.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de publicar obras poco convencionales pero de indudable calidad, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para promocionar cada título cuando esta todavía se encuentra en proceso de edición.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a David Morán.

Nacido en Córdoba en 1971 es Licenciado en Derecho y en Periodismo, habiendo cursado estudios de posgrado en Comunicación y Literatura y realizando, entre otros, trabajos como abogado, foto fija, product placement, ayudante de producción, guionista de Saber y Ganar, profesor de español, director de vídeos musicales y ha recorrido medio mundo a la búsqueda de las historias más fascinantes. 

Más de una quincena de premios avalan la carrera de este autor que desconfía de los géneros y cuya última obra publicada es El doble.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«Desaparecido desde entonces, su teléfono celular ha dejado de existir y sus cuentas de correo borradas. Sin embargo, los archivos de Air France revelan que el día 4 de marzo, a las diez de la mañana, figura en la lista del avión AF 609 con destino Barcelona (escalas en Isla Mauricio y París), el embarque de un pasajero que responde al nombre de Ednodio Hamilton, nombre que la Policía Aeroportuaria Malgache ha comprobado falso, siendo la verdadera identidad de tal viajero un francés llamado Edmond Hinault, justo el hombre del que hablamos».

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 880€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Aviso para navegantes: La opción BACK IT es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y David Morán vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

Política de Privacidad

Política de Privacidad

story:
¿Qué?

Vuelta a la vida narra una historia actual, bizarra y valiente, que aspira a novela generacional... y lo cumple con creces.

Lis es una joven que lleva una vida de opulencia y acaba de terminar la universidad. Amigos, pareja, familia, trabajo... Todo está milimétricamente planeado. Aparentemente es muy feliz. Sin embargo, durante una etílica noche decide darle un giro de ciento ochenta grados a su vida renunciando a Madrid y todas sus comodidades.

Comenzará de cero en Barcelona, descubriendo lo que significa valerse por una misma. Pero será un extraño libro, con tapas de cuero y páginas en blanco lo que realmente le abrirá los ojos. La protagonista vivirá entre los excesos y lujuria de la noche, y un mundo regido por el subconsciente y lo inexplicable.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Claudia Yáñez.

Nacida en Salamanca, Claudia ha llevado una vida de continuos cambios y viajes. Cuando aún tenía cinco años su familia se mudó a Mallorca, donde ha vivido hasta abandonar el nido y comenzar sus estudios universitarios en Barcelona. La lectura siempre ha sido una de sus pasiones y su primer intento de concebir una novela fue a los quince años. Desde entonces ha buscado sacar el máximo jugo a su tiempo para encontrar nuevas experiencias y plasmarlas en historias que lleguen a todo el mundo. Una frase que le sirve de guía es: "Si dejas de hacer algo por miedo, estás renunciando a la vida".

Vuelta a la vida es su primera novela, pero no será la última. Siempre que la inspiración e imaginación llamen a su puerta, tendrá una excusa para compaginar su existencia con la literatura. Actualmente es una estudiante de derecho y de ciencias políticas en Barcelona, y se desconoce la próxima ciudad que intente conquistar.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 840€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Vuelta a la vida que saldría pocas semanas después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Claudia Yáñez vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
Why Fund This Book?

Have you ever felt like there’s an emptiness deep in the pit of your stomach and you just can’t make it go away, no matter what you do? I remember feeling it myself when I was growing up, as I struggled with gaining a sense of life meaning and purpose. I still shudder when I remember experiencing the sense of meaninglessness as that void in my stomach. I wish I knew when growing up that you can use science-based strategies to find a sense of meaning and purpose in life.

That’s what pushed me as a professor at Ohio State University to research this topic for many years, and then present it to a broad audience through writing "Find Your Purpose Using Science!" 

This workbook includes:

  • an overview of the latest research about meaning and purpose from a variety of fields, such as psychology and cognitive science
  • research-based exercises and worksheets to guide you through the process of building a personal sense of purpose
  • stories about people who have used these tools to gain a deeper sense of purpose and how it impacted their lives. 

Here is a link to the first couple of chapters, as well as the table of contents to give you an idea of what's included in this e-book.

All contributions in support of the book publication are tax deductible, since they will be going to Intentional Insights, a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization that is helping fund the book’s publication. I am the volunteer President and a Co-Founder of Intentional Insights (InIn), and will donate 50% of the profit from the workbook to Intentional Insights. This workbook is part of our broader offerings that empower people to refine and reach their goals by providing research-based content to help improve thinking, feeling, and behavior patterns.

So help yourself and others use science-based approaches to find your meaning and purpose by funding this workbook! 


Will This Book Really Work?

Can science really answer life’s big questions? Well, a wave of recent research in psychology, medicine, and other fields has explored how we find meaning and purpose. These questions are really important for our everyday life. The science shows that people who lack a rich sense of purpose have significantly worse mental and physical health. Fortunately, you can learn research-based strategies to help yourself find a deeper sense of your own life meaning, improve your own health, and fill any void you may experience in the depth of your own stomach.

This book’s strategies sure worked well for John Johnson. He was a graduate student at OSU, working on his doctoral dissertation. But he felt that deep sense of anxiety that he wasn’t doing what would give his life meaning. He read a draft version of “Find Your Purpose Using Science,” and he told me that this book literally changed his life course. He decided not to complete his doctoral dissertation and instead become a school teacher. I’m thrilled for him, and I included his story in the final version of the book. I’m also somewhat jealous of him, as I really wish I had a book like that to read when I was struggling with my own journey. It would have prevented so much needless suffering for me.

The vast majority of guidance on meaning and purpose comes from religion and cultural heritage. While this guidance works for some, traditional sources of meaning and purpose don’t speak nearly so well to others. People like John, myself, and maybe you too want an evidence-based approach in which we can be truly confident.

You can be confident about this book, since it’s based on the latest research to tell you about tools that have been proven to help you find a personal sense of meaning and purpose. You can also take a look at some early feedback from experts.

With your help, we will release science-based strategies for finding meaning and purpose from the Ivory Tower of complex academic articles to be widely accessible for a broad public.


Book Costs

When I started writing “Find Your Purpose Using Science,” I had no idea of the costs involved in producing and self-publishing an e-book! I certainly learned a lot, from articles such as this one that describe in detail the actual costs of self-publishing. These include development and copy-editing, proofreading, cover and illustrations, formatting and digital conversion, online marketing, printed marketing materials, PR and media publicity, and other fees.

The higher end of these fees runs $35,000 or more, as the article describes. I decided to aim for $4,700 as a way to take the lower but not lowest tier of all of these services. Here is the breakdown of costs:

  • editing and proofreading: $1,080
  • cover design and illustrations: $860
  • formatting and digital conversion: $480
  • ISBN: $125
  • online marketing: $850
  • printed marketing materials: $370
  • PR and media publicity: $730
  • other fees: $205

I will be releasing this digital version of the book on Amazon's Kindle, which offers a Free Kindle App for computers, tablets, and phones, so anyone who has internet access can get the book! If the digital version of the book does well enough to justify the expense, or if the stretch goal below is met, I will also work on putting out this book in hard copy and audiobook formats.


Stretch Goals

- Stretch Goal 1 (Above $4,700 and below $7,000)

A better product and superior experience for you and other readers: higher-quality graphics, editing, and other improvements to make a better book.

- Stretch Goal 2 ($7,000)

I will research and write an extra chapter about science-based strategies for finding meaning and purpose in one's work.

- Stretch Goal 3 ($10,000)

I will make this book available for FREE on Amazon for the first 5 days after its publication. 

- Stretch Goal 4 ($14,000)

I will collaborate with a programmer to develop an online app to accompany the book. This app will be a tool to guide you and others to gain a greater sense of meaning and purpose in life, to be available by the end of 2015.

- Stretch Goal 5 ($20,000)

I will research and write an expanded and revised version of this book that will be published by the end of 2015 in a variety of formats, including e-book, hard copy, and audiobook.


Perks

So what do you get if you fund this e-book?

Perk #1 - $5 - PERSONAL EMAIL

A personal thank you email from the author for your donation along with a commitment to sending you occasional updates about the book and Intentional Insights.

Perk #2 - $10 - FREE BOOK

A free PDF of the book, plus the previous perk.

Perk #3 - $25 - AUTHOR SIGNED BOOK

A free PDF copy of the book electronically signed by the author personally to you, plus all previous perks.

Perk #4 - $50 - THANK YOU VIDEO

The author will publicly thank you in a video posted to the Intentional Insights Youtube Channel, plus all previous perks.

Perk #5 - $75 - SECRET FACEBOOK GROUP

Access to secret Facebook group to discuss the book with the author and other select readers, plus all previous perks.

Perk #6 - $150 - GROUP CALL WITH AUTHOR

An hour and a half-long group conference call with the author to discuss the book, plus all previous perks.

Perk #7 - $250 - PERSONAL CALL WITH AUTHOR

An hour-long personal Skype or phone call with the author to discuss the book, plus all previous perks.

Perk #8 - $500 - ACKNOWLEDGMENT IN THE BOOK

The author will acknowledge you as a contributor in the book, plus all previous perks.

Perk #9 - $1,000 - ADDITIONAL CHAPTER

The author will research and write an extra chapter about science-based strategies for finding meaning and purpose in one's work, plus all previous perks.

Perk #10 - $2,000 - BOOK AVAILABLE FOR FREE

The author will make the book available for free on Amazon for 5 days after its publication to help all gain meaning and purpose using science, plus all previous perks.

Perk #11 - $3,500 - MEANING AND PURPOSE APP

The author will collaborate with a programmer on developing an online app to accompany the book to be available by the end of 2015, plus all previous perks.

Perk #12 - $6,000 - HARD COVER AND AUDIOBOOK

The author will research and write an expanded and revised version of this book that will be published by the end of 2015 in a variety of formats, including e-book, hard copy, and audiobook, plus all previous perks.


Risks & Challenges

I’ve already finished a rough first draft of the book, so that part is done. Now, there are two major challenges:

1) How to make the draft into a quality product that you will enjoy reading and that will be most impactful for helping people gain meaning and purpose using science-based strategies. This involves expenses related to editing, graphics, formatting, etc.

2) How to spread the word about this product to people like John Johnson and everyone else who would benefit from gaining a richer sense of meaning and purpose in life using science-based strategies. This involves expenses related to marketing and PR,

I am confident that, with your help, I can overcome the costs involved. I am highly dedicated to putting in my time and effort to make it happen and help you and others find your purpose using science!  To show my commitment and dedication to delivering this book to you on time, I have already made it available on pre-order from Amazon at this link to ship on July 8. This is a public commitment available for the whole world to see and so my reputation is riding on its delivery, and I will deliver!


Conclusion

Any amount you can contribute is appreciated. I would also appreciate it if you would spread the word about this campaign and the science-based offerings at Intentional Insights to others. Thank you so much!
story_txt:
Why
Fund This Book?
Have you ever felt like there’s an emptiness deep in
the pit of your stomach and you just can’t make it go away, no matter what you
do? I remember feeling it myself when I was growing up, as I struggled with
gaining a sense of life meaning and purpose. I still shudder when I remember
experiencing the sense of meaninglessness as that void in my stomach. I wish I
knew when growing up that you can use science-based strategies to find a sense
of meaning and purpose in life. 
That’s what pushed me as a professor at Ohio State University to research
this topic for many years, and then present it to a broad audience through writing "Find Your Purpose Using Science!" This workbook includes:

an overview of the latest research about meaning and purpose from a variety of fields, such as psychology and cognitive science


research-based exercises and worksheets to guide you through the process of building a personal sense of purpose


stories about people who have used these tools to gain a deeper sense of purpose and how it impacted their lives. 

Here is a link to the first couple of chapters, as well as the table of contents to give you an idea of what's included in this e-book.All contributions in 
support of the book publication are tax deductible, since they will be 
going to Intentional Insights, a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization that 
is helping fund the book’s publication. I am the volunteer President and
 a Co-Founder of Intentional Insights (InIn), and will donate 50% of
the profit from the workbook to Intentional Insights. This workbook is part of 
our broader offerings that empower people to refine and reach their 
goals by providing research-based content to help improve thinking, 
feeling, and behavior patterns.
So help yourself and others use science-based approaches to find your
meaning and purpose by funding this workbook! 
Will
This Book Really Work? 
Can science really answer life’s big questions?
Well, a wave of recent research in psychology, medicine, and other fields has
explored how we find meaning and purpose. These questions are really important
for our everyday life. The science shows that people who lack a rich sense of
purpose have significantly worse mental and physical health. Fortunately, you
can learn research-based strategies to help yourself find a deeper sense of
your own life meaning, improve your own health, and fill any void you may experience
in the depth of your own stomach. 
This book’s strategies sure worked well for John Johnson. He was a graduate student at OSU, working on his doctoral dissertation. But
he felt that deep sense of anxiety that he wasn’t
doing what would give his life meaning. He read a draft version of “Find Your
Purpose Using Science,” and he told me that this book literally changed his life course. He decided not to complete his doctoral dissertation and instead
become a school teacher. I’m thrilled for him, and I included his story in the
final version of the book. I’m also somewhat jealous of him, as I really wish I
had a book like that to read when I was struggling with my own journey. It
would have prevented so much needless suffering for me. 
The vast majority of guidance on meaning and purpose
comes from religion and cultural heritage. While this guidance works for some,
traditional sources of meaning and purpose don’t speak nearly so well to
others. People like John, myself, and maybe you too want an evidence-based approach in which we
can be truly confident. You can be confident about this book, since it’s
based on the latest research to tell you about tools that have been proven to help you find a
personal sense of meaning and purpose. You can also take a look at some early feedback from experts.With your help, we will release science-based strategies for finding meaning and purpose from the Ivory Tower of complex academic articles to be widely accessible for a broad public.

Book
Costs
When I started writing “Find Your Purpose Using
Science,” I had no idea of the costs involved in producing and self-publishing
an e-book! I certainly learned a lot, from articles such as this
one that describe in detail the actual costs of self-publishing. These
include development and copy-editing, proofreading, cover and illustrations, formatting and digital conversion, online marketing, printed marketing materials, PR and media publicity, and other fees. The higher end of these fees runs $35,000 or more, as the article describes. I decided to aim for $4,700 as a way to take the lower but not lowest
tier of all of these services. Here is the breakdown of costs:

editing and proofreading: $1,080


cover design and illustrations: $860


formatting and digital conversion: $480


ISBN: $125


online marketing: $850


printed marketing materials: $370

PR and media publicity: $730

other fees: $205

I will be releasing this digital version of the book on Amazon's Kindle, which offers a Free Kindle App for computers, tablets, and phones, so anyone who has internet access can get the book! If the digital version of the book does well enough to justify the expense, or if the stretch goal below is met, I will also work on putting out this book in hard copy and audiobook formats. Stretch Goals- Stretch Goal 1 (Above $4,700 and below $7,000)A better product and superior experience for you and other readers: higher-quality graphics, editing, and other improvements to make a better book.- Stretch Goal 2 ($7,000)I will research and write an extra chapter about science-based strategies for finding meaning and purpose in one's work.- Stretch Goal 3 ($10,000)I will make this book available for
FREE on Amazon for the first 5 days after its publication.  - Stretch Goal 4 ($14,000)I will collaborate with a programmer to develop an online app to 
accompany the book. This app will be a tool to guide you and others to 
gain a greater sense of meaning and purpose in life, to be available by the end of 2015.- Stretch Goal 5 ($20,000)I will research and write an expanded and revised version of this book 
that will be published by the end of 2015 in a variety of formats, 
including e-book, hard copy, and audiobook.

Perks
So what do you get if you fund this e-book? 
Perk #1 - $5 - PERSONAL EMAILA personal thank you email from the author for your donation along with a commitment to sending you occasional updates about the book and Intentional Insights.
Perk #2 - $10 - FREE BOOK A free PDF of the book, plus the previous perk.
Perk #3 - $25 - AUTHOR SIGNED BOOK A free PDF copy of the book electronically signed by the author personally to you, plus all previous perks.
Perk #4 - $50 - THANK YOU VIDEO The author will publicly thank you in a video posted to the Intentional Insights Youtube Channel, plus all previous perks.
Perk #5 - $75 - SECRET FACEBOOK GROUP Access to secret Facebook group to discuss the book with the author and other select readers, plus all previous perks.
Perk #6 - $150 - GROUP CALL WITH AUTHOR An hour and a half-long group conference call with the author to discuss the book, plus all previous perks.
Perk #7 -  $250 - PERSONAL CALL WITH AUTHOR An hour-long personal Skype or phone call with the author to discuss the book, plus all previous perks.Perk #8 - $500 - ACKNOWLEDGMENT IN THE BOOK The author will acknowledge you as a contributor in the book, plus all previous perks.

accompany the book to be available by the end of 2015, plus all previous perks.Perk #12 - $6,000 - HARD COVER AND AUDIOBOOK The author will research and write an expanded and revised version of this book 
that will be published by the end of 2015 in a variety of formats, 
including e-book, hard copy, and audiobook, plus all previous perks.

Risks

1) How to make the draft into a quality
product that you will enjoy reading and that will be most impactful for helping
people gain meaning and purpose using science-based strategies. This involves
expenses related to editing, graphics, formatting, etc.

2) How to spread the word about this
product to people like John Johnson and everyone else who would benefit
from gaining a richer sense of meaning and purpose in life using science-based
strategies. This involves expenses related to marketing and PR,I
am confident that, with your help, I can overcome the costs involved. I am
highly dedicated to putting in my time and effort to make it happen and help
you and others find your purpose using science!  To show my commitment and dedication to delivering this book to you on time, I have already made it available on pre-order from Amazon at this link to ship on July 8. story:
Story of My Book

The Principles of Good Taste and Ornament is a novel about societal prescriptions assigned to a suburban mother named Ann Moore whose identity is called into question after she survives putting her head in the oven on a summer’s day. The fictional thriller is based on the realities of modernity colliding with regressive tradition.

My name is Jada Henry and I am the author of The Principles of Good Taste and Ornament. I wrote this book because we as a society often conjure up ghouls and goblins to embody the horrors that are right in front of us. I wanted to confront those horrors and the consequences that are attached.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover your own role in enabling these horrors. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for combining thrillers with reality in storytelling. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a social critique.

In this book, you'll learn about:

Microaggressions - Ann enters a book club that is full of complacent women who mask their back-handed compliments in “genuine” concern about Ann’s well-being and recovery.

Gender Roles - Both Ann and Stasia are expected to abide by the household duties of women, despite Dr. Moore having the capability to do these tasks as well but rather having the choice not to because he is a man.

Tokenism- The notion of “the ideal woman” creates friction between Stasia and Ann before they are even old enough to understand what that means.


You will love this book if you enjoy horror novels based in the realities of everyday life.

The Principles of Good Taste and Ornament is a fiction book that speaks to women and those affected by gendered policies and horror junkies who are looking at how thrillers are derived from real life experiences that we all take a part of.

 

Short Summary

The Book - The Principles of Good Taste and Ornament


The book is written in 3 Parts...

Part 1 contains the introduction + Chapters 1-5. - The reader will meet the Moore family and explore their dynamic after the obscure incident that occurred with Mrs. Moore one warm summer evening.

Part 2 contains Chapters 6-14. - The familial disposition begins to turn on its head as horrific antics take over the actions of Ann Moore and the identity between Ann and Stasia begins to cause confusion.

Part 3 contains Chapters 15-20. - The relation between Stasia and Ann slowly begins to unravel as the family comes closer to knowing about Ann’s objectives and motives regarding her strange rebranding.

 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July 2020

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Summer.

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book NOW:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book

Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

And more...

 

About the Author


Jada Henry is a screenwriter and playwright who has produced several stories for the stage such as Encephalon’s Ethics and screenplays such as Earworm. As the former Executive Editor for Little Rock Central High School’s award-winning Newspaper publication The Tiger and a staff writer for Pace University’s Online News Forum The Odyssey, Jada is well-versed in different fields of writing and is expanding her expertise through her first fiction thriller.

I wrote this novel because of my curiosity about the human condition and the harmful systems we hold as traditions. This novel is not a social critique that is preaching about what society is doing wrong, but rather a forum that asks why we obviously and so unashamedly perpetuate the things we do. I’m just as curious as the next person.

When Jada isn’t writing she’s usually watching a slew of films or creating them herself! Her favorite movies to watch are Dazed and Confused and Forrest Gump on any given day, the experience made all the better with a box of thin mints or a glass of cranberry juice. Jada loves to act, paint, write poetry, and take photographs when she’s not working on her novel as she can’t seem to shake the creativity in her body! Her mottos in life are “Let go and Let God” and “Enable yourself!”

For more information you can connect with Jada at
jh93086@pace.edu (EMAIL)
https://www.instagram.com/tuvoisjh/?hl=en (INSTAGRAM)
www.linkedin.com/in/jada-henry (LINKEDIN)
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCos1IaLmZhf8oU... (YOUTUBE)

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #JadaHenry and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Jada Henry

story:
The University of South Florida art history organization Art Research Forum is looking to raise funds in order to publish MFA catalogs for the graduating class of 2017!  Our goal is to raise $5,000 so we can print 500 copies of a professional, high quality 50-page catalog.

The publication of this catalog will offer us the opportunity to collaborate with our sister organization, the Masters of Fine Arts Organization (MFAO), and gain experience interacting with and writing about contemporary artists.  The publication of an MFA catalog is an academic and fine arts initiative that supports the exemplary work created by graduate students at USF. Furthermore, this is a group project where everyone will have a critical role in designing, writing, or editing the catalog. The funds allocated to this project will provide a clear and resounding voice for USF’s graduate students while serving as a tangible reminder that USF is an advocate for the fine arts within the larger area of Tampa Bay, and the international arts community.  Only you can help make this happen!

Over the past two years, we were able to implement successful fundraising initiatives and meet our goal of publishing catalogs for previous classes. The professional confidence gained through the realization of this endeavor has been invaluable. USF’s College of the Arts began a tradition of artistic collaboration and excellence that we hope to build upon this year.

Our team of graduate art historians includes: Jeanie Ambrosio, Marlena Antonucci, James Cartwright, Tracey Cole, Laura Colkitt, Mariana Gomez, Erin Hughes, Amanda Poss, Alexandria Salmieri, and Ashley Williams. (*See examples of their professional accolades below under "Getting to know our writers.") 

Supported also by graduate editor Ashley Muraszewski and undergraduate art historians Sara-Kay West, Richard Ellis, and Kristen Clayton.

Take a look at the exemplary work of our featured artists by viewing their websites containing past and ongoing artistic explorations.

Kate Alboreo – http://www.katealboreo.com/

Ben Buhl – http://benjaminwhitneybuhl.com/

Joshua Dodhia

Brandon Geurts – http://www.brandongeurts.com/

Bahareh Khoshooee – http://www.bahareh-khoshooee.com/

Kate Kinder – http://www.katekinder.com/

Walter Matthews – http://walterericmatthews.com

Hillary Jones McCullough – http://www.hillarymccullough.com/

Scott Owen Pierce – http://scottowenpierce.com/

Vicky Trespando – http://www.vickytrespando.com/

 

*Getting to know our writers:

Our graduate art historians are enthusiastic and active researchers in their respective fields. Their scholarship has been selected for both national and international conferences, including such recent selections as “Contemplating God Through Light: The Mosque Lamp of Karim al-Din within the Cross-Cultural Contexts of Abrahamic Religions,” at the University of Central Michigan (Williams, 2017) and “Safe Conduct Pass (Paiza): Apotropaia and Human Representation in Islamic Art” at Central European University in Budapest (Gomez, 2017). Several historians have pursued their interests across the globe in study abroad programs in Paris, France and bi-annual excursions to the Venice Biennale. 

All proceeds will support the funding of this catalog. Art Research Forum will allocate any remaining funds toward publishing future catalogs and supporting further collaborations between practicing artists and art historians. Your generous donation will help make this catalog an enduring tradition in our community. Thank you!

Their scholarship has been selected for both national and international conferences, including such recent selections as “Contemplating God Through Light: The Mosque Lamp of Karim al-Din within the Cross-Cultural Contexts of Abrahamic Religions,” at the University of Central Michigan (Williams, 2017) and “Safe Conduct Pass (Paiza): Apotropaia and Human Representation in Islamic Art” at Central European University in Budapest (Gomez, 2017). Several historians have pursued their interests across the globe in study abroad programs in Paris, France and bi-annual excursions to the Venice Biennale. 
All proceeds will support the funding of this catalog. Art Research Forum will allocate any remaining funds toward publishing future catalogs and supporting further collaborations between practicing artists and art historians. Your generous donation will help make this catalog an enduring tradition in our community. Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Our first two fundraising campaigns raised £2,000, enough to fund the deposits and campaigns of two of the four prospective parliamentary candidate who’ll be standing for J4MB at the May 2015 general election (the other two candidates were already funded).

We’re now looking for a further £1,000 in the coming 30 days, to fund our fifth candidate (deadline: 31 October). Our goal is to field 30 candidates at the May 2015
general election.

I’m Mike Buchanan, a 55-year-old British writer, publisher, and advocate for the human rights of men and boys. I lead a political party registered in February 2013, ‘Justice for men & boys (and the women who love them)’. We're determined to change the face of British politics, and we’re contributing material to a television documentary producer who’s working on a lengthy documentary about feminism, to be broadcast on a major television channel in early 2014.

The human rights of British men and boys have been assaulted by the actions and
inactions of the state for 30+ years, and we plan to contest the top 30 Conservative marginal seats at the May 2015 general election. I worked as a consultant for the Conservative party (2006-8) but in common with many Conservatives I’ve been dismayed that under David Cameron’s leadership the party has been as anti-male and pro-feminist as its Labour predecessors.

Details on our party:

http://j4mb.org.uk.

Our YouTube channel (mainly BBC television and radio interviews):

http://www.youtube.com/channel/UCKhX1c3ow6BrzdzP3ydpeZQ/videos 

Our public consultation document:

http://j4mb.wordpress.com/our-public-consultation-exercise-2/

 

What We Need & What You Get

We’ve already announced our first two candidates for the 2015 general election. I’ll
be standing in Bedford & Kempston, while Ray Barry (leader of another political party, Equal Parenting Alliance) will be standing for J4MB in Wolverhampton South-West. We have yet to select our third candidate.

We’re looking for funding for more candidates, and need a minimum of £1,000 to
contest each of the remaining 27 seats (£500 deposit, £500 for campaign literature).

In return for a minimum donation of £20.00 I’ll personally review your feedback to
our public consultation document. Your feedback will be considered carefully, and may be reflected in the content of our general election manifesto. I shall be happy to comment on your feedback and have an exchange of emails and/or a phone discussion. 

If we don’t reach our target of £1,000 in 30 days, your donation will be refunded to you in full. Thank you for your support.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to make a financial donation, perhaps you can help in other ways? Feel free to email me at mike@j4mb.org.uk with any ideas. And if you can make others aware of our party and this fundraising campaign, it would be appreciated.

story:
Introduction

The Festival of Writers (FOW) is an annual event held in Rensselaerville, NY which benefits The Rensselaerville Library. For the past two years, an annual haiku project has been organized to raise funds to support The Rensselaerville Library.

In 2013, Tom Gilroy, author of The Haiku Year (Soft Skull) and director of films that include Spring Forward and The Cold Lands, curated the first FOW haiku project. Five writers, who included Gilroy, filmmaker Jim McKay, musician Michael Stipe, writer Patrick So, and poet Shin Yu Pai committed to writing one haiku a day for the entire month of April. The group wrote their poems in handmade books that were collected together with a cassette tape recorded by Stipe and sold at auction to benefit the Library.

X-Ray Book Company, publisher of Tom Waits, Mark Mothersbaugh, and Harold Norse, is now producing a letterpress limited edition of 25 poems from the original project. Designed and printed by Johnny Brewton, the poems will be printed in a trading-card-sized format and collected together unbound and housed inside a chipboard cover with an illustration of the town of Rensselaerville. The editions will be wrapped in baling wire and/or local newspaper.

What We Need & What You Get

Producing the limited edition haiku project object will cost slightly less than $2,000 - however, the purpose of the project is to raise funds for the library. As such, we hope to greatly exceed our fundraising goal! Funding will go to reimbursing the library for materials, design, and printing time needed to produce the project with additional proceeds going to directly benefit the library.

  • A donation of $35 gets you one numbered broadside bundle from the edition.
    *Only 226 copies will be produced.*
  • A donation of $75 gets you one broadside bundle packaged inside a vellum envelope with a signed photograph by project curator Tom Gilroy.
  • A donation of $150 gets you one broadside bundle packaged inside a vellum envelope with a photograph from Tom Gilroy, signed by all of the authors.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign to your network. If you know any special collections librarians that would take an interest in this project or book arts collectors, please forward information to them!

story:
My Backstory

My real name is Chela, but in writing, publishing (and some singing) circles, I go by the pseudonym Kamichi Jackson. Thanks for stopping by my page!

So here's my story: I wrote and self-published my first title--a young reader book called You're Too Much, Reggie Brown--back in 2000. It did modestly well (700 copies the first week, and another 300 hundred at the Baltimore Book Festival and other book signing events shortly thereafter). It was a done deal--I was in love with the process of self-publishing!

Serious health issues took over for a few years, but there came a point recently when I finally accepted that these issues aren't going away...so why not enjoy the things I used to love so much? Like writing and self-publishing, for instance. There's nothing more therapeutic than seeing a line of young readers clutching your book against their chests, waiting eagerly to speak with you and have you sign their personal copy of your book. I smile now just remembering it with my first book...

And so here I am with another title, this time for teen readers. It's called K My Name Is Kendra. It's an important project, I believe, because aside from telling a story that too many young girls of all backgrounds are actually living, it also has the potential to open up an important dialog that could save a girl's spirit--if not her life.

I would love for you to experience this journey with me. Won't you take a few minutes to learn more?

About the Book

From the back cover:

Fifteen-year-old Kendra James hasn't been feeling like herself lately. It isn't anything she can explain. And truth be told, it isn't anything her parents seem to want to hear. So she's left to fend for herself against the cloud of sadness that seems to have settled permanently above her head.

Things take a turn for the better when Kendra's older sister Meisha suddenly comes back into her life after having mysteriously disappeared ten years ago. Unbeknownst to anyone else in the family, the two secretly spend as much time as they can together, and Kendra finally feels free to unburden herself of the issues that have plagued her the past several months. Until the day the girls are discovered together and are forbidden to see each other. Kendra is heartbroken and alone with her sadness once again.

Enter Kendra's uncle--a popular former professional football player who showers Kendra with gifts, money, and even better, the attention she so desperately craves. Once again, Kendra finds herself in a relationship she must keep secret, especially once Uncle C.J. makes a move that changes everything forever and sends Kendra's world into a tailspin from which she's not sure she'll ever recover.

Author's Note:

Shortly after finishing the writing of this book, I did something I hadn't done in years: entered it into a writing/publishing competition! In this case, it was the Amazon Breakthrough Novel Award competition (Young Adult genre), CreateSpace, Penguin Publishing, and Publishers Weekly. Thousands of people entered! After several weeks and stages of competition, I was announced as a semifinalist (yay!) Though I didn't win the final award, I did earn a nice review from Publishers Weekly as part of the competition (the review no longer appears on the Amazon site because the competition has long passed, but a scanned copy appears here). Read some of the judges' reviews here.

The book currently appears on Amazon.com as an out-of-print (limited availability) product because I was never able to come up with the funds to see the project through properly. Hoping that will change with this crowdfunding campaign. :-)

Read excerpts here!

What We Need & What You Get

I've run the numbers again and again, and working on a tight budget utilizing the most affordable resources I could find, here's how it breaks down:

Front/back cover design and interior formatting: $1200

Ebook creation: $350

Video book trailer: $450

Print Run: $6000

This just gets the book published. If I happen to raise more than the $8,000 I'm seeking, then it'll go towards marketing. If I raise less than $8,000, whatever is raised will go toward the cover and interior design and a considerably smaller print run. In that case, the Ebook creation will become an even more important part of getting my words out there!

I've created some small perks for people who want to contribute their hard-earned dollars to my project! They are pretty self-explanatory and you can see the details of each in the boxes to the right.

Other Ways You Can Help

Word-of-mouth is always appreciated! So even if you are not able to contribute, I'd love for you to spread the word about my project via your social media channels. Indiegogo even provides tools to help you share easily. And tell you personal circle of friends as well. If you say I'm an awesome talent, they'll most likely believe it. :-)

Thanks again for visiting my page. I hope you'll join my crowd!

story:
Our mandate is to support Canadian literary scene by publishing fresh new writing, and actively partaking in the field of literary criticism.

1:0

The Impressment Gang 1:0 needs your support to run. We are a brand new not for profit literary magazine run out of Halifax, Nova Scotia. We're sharp and fresh as fine pine needles. It's great to meet you.

This Campaign

aims to fund us for one year of printing to get us on our feet. Our mandate is to publish fresh, bold, and good writing by Canadian writers and participate in the culture of critique and review of Canadian writing.

We support writers! We hope to be able to pay contributors as soon as we can, because we believe in our talent. 

Each issue takes $1500 at least to run properly -- printing, posting, paying contributors, getting the word out. 


Who's on board

Clay Everest is a poet living in Halifax with a Bachelor of Arts in English and Creative Writing under his belt. A small book of his poetry was published by Paisley Chapbook Press in 2012.

Cassie Guinan lives in Halifax NS where she received her Bachelor of Arts in Classics and Creative Writing. A small book of her poems was published by Paisley Chapbook Press in 2013.

Pearl Chan is the publisher of Paisley Chapbook Press and was an editor of Cut the Jargon. She is also a writer of fiction and plays. She would like to acknowledge the support of the Nova Scotia Talent Trust.

Our first issues will feature the writing of Heather Jessup (The Lightning Field, 2011), Carole Langille (The Ophelia Poems, 2012), Jaime Forsythe (Sympathy Loophole, 2012), Sue Goyette (Ocean, 2013), Sheryda Warrener (Hard Feelings, 2010), David Huebert, Andrew Patterson, Geordie Miller, Ryan Allen, and more.


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get your institution to subscribe!
  • Share us on facebook/ email lists/ follow us on twiiter!


Submissions

We will be accepting submissions after issue 1.0. If you are interested in submitting, we highly recommend subscribing so that you become familiar with what we're looking for.

Reviews

We are interested in reviewing Canadian fiction, short fiction, poetry, and plays. If you would like us to consider your work for review, please email review@theimpressmentgang.ca with more information.

New plays in first production are also in our interest. (Especially here in Halifax!)

story:
Hello! welcome to project Radfem Voice. (that’s not the name of the magazine, that’s still to be decided, but that’s what we are calling the project to give radical feminists all over the world a bigger voice and a pedestal to stand on while they are using it!)

Project Radfem voice is a magazine set to be released in January of 2014. run by radical feminists, for radical feminists. we want to focus on the voices of marginalised women all over the world, of all races, body types, classes, everything.

The aim is to be a 40 page Magazine that will compete with the mainstream magazines that exploit and harm women, it will include photos of women, un-photoshopped. Focusing of course on Women of colour, Lesbians and Disabled women. all of whom we all know do NOT get enough representation in the mainstream media! 
we aim to include voices of women from all around the world, asking for email submissions of articles and ideas from a radical feminist perspective.

I am including a list of current recurring page ideas and features below so you can have a look! please feel free to contact me at radfemvoice@gmail.com, to get onto the mailing list, i will be sending out article topics so you can pick one if you want to get writing! or feel free to submit any articles you want, any ideas! anything! please get involved. also please like our facebook page! 

  • Woman of the month feature! to highlight the struggles and lives of women and their stories, to focus on how incredible we are.
  •  Radical feminist Poetry / art section. (submit your own and we will include it!)
  • 4 page current affairs and politics section, focussing on global news stories, wars, elections and general politics
  • 4 page sexual education and discussion section! similar to the dolly sealed sex section, except unsealed and focussing on women’s health issues, abortion rights, contraception and birth control news. embarassing issues etc.
  • Vegan inclusive recipes, not all vegan but there will be at least one every month! not specific to “low fat” but recipes that cater to health conditions.
  • a spread for advertisement for local rallies and political activism! if you have something organised please send us an email and we will include the details in our issues so that other radical feminist women can network and join the cause!
  • Homelessness perspective, local resources, helpful facilities in your area! stories and tips to help you stay alive and sheltered on a low income budget. (also including, if you’ve dealt with homelessness please submit your story!)
  • Opinion spread, If you are from melbourne you might be familiar with the MX’s “have your say column” similar to that but a debate section focusing on issues to do with feminism.
  • reviews on feminist TV, movies etc. 
  • a music section talking about up and coming important female artists

there is a lot more stuff that i’m hoping to include but the ones listed here will be recurring pages! i’m hoping to have other articles spread out through the entire magazine as well.

thank you for taking the time to read all of this information! if you are able to pledge $20 or more you will be sent a copy of the first issue, free of charge! as a thanks for your support. if you aren’t able to pledge any money PLEASE contact me to see how you can get involved! i’m looking for writers, graphic designers, artists, photographers and just all around inspirational women to send me their stories, photos, articles and opinions. Please spread the word so that we can get as many wonderful women involved with this project as possible!!

story:
Our Story


Well, hello there. Thanks for stopping by. Do you want to be part of the success story of a brilliant new sci-fi author? Then please read on...

At Dagda Publishing  we have always  strived to find and nurture fresh, new writing talent. Writing talent that will have something to add to the world of literature for generations to come. And J.S. Collyer is such a writing talent. Her vision for "Zero" is one of the best we have seen in the world of new SF authors in a long time. So, to this end, we want to help her become a recognised, best selling  name in the world of Sci-Fi writing.

Of course, publishing the book is only part of the process, and for all the wonders of free promotion that are available to us, one fact remains - effective marketing and advertising still costs money. Quite a bit of money. And anyone who knows anything about the world of small publishers knows that they don't have the huge budgets of the big publishing houses.

So, to this end, we have started this crowdfunding campaign to get together some money to kickstart the process right off the bat and get J.S. Collyers book into orbit (pun intended). More about the finer points of that in a moment though. Let us quickly introduce you to the world of Zero and the Orbit, and you'll see why we are so passionate about this novel and want it to do so well. Please read on, and check out our perks to see what you get in return for your investment in the future of this author:


***

Kaleb Hugo is everything an officer of the Service should be: loyal, expertly trained, unquestioning. He has done everything ever ordered of him and has done so with a pride that comes from knowing you are fighting for the good of humankind... until the day that he made a decision, as he has had to many times before, in order to ensure the best outcome for the Service, even though it was in direct violation of regulations.

A battle was won, but Hugo was condemned and dishonourably discharged by Service commanders for going against orders and risking himself and his unit to save an inhabited satellite that had been determined as an acceptable loss.

Officially, anyway.

Unofficially, Hugo was re-assigned to captain the crew of the Zero, an eight-man craft that is classified in all Service records as, at best, a privateer ship and at worse a smuggling and borderline criminal enterprise vessel. What very few people in the Service know is that the Zero, and its crew, are contracted by the Service. Their role is to investigate and infiltrate the less savoury and unacknowledged levels of human society. They sell on, buy in, bargain, threaten and report back on everything the political levels the Service don't officially want to know.

The Zero's rag-tag crew look to their commander, Ezekiel Webb, as their leader and middleman between the regimented expectations of the Service and the harsh and unpredictable demands of the underworld of colonial space. He knows he is not captain material but has not managed to serve well under any that have been placed over him. Both Captain and Commander clash, but they will have to adapt and find a compromise if the Zero is to carry out her missions successfully and for the harmony of the crew.

As the Zero is assigned missions by Colonel Luscombe, her crew is pulled deeper into an orbit-wide game of politics, deceit and corruption which will threaten to tear them apart and throw Humanity back into a cycle of war and destruction. To stop this and preserve the fragile peace, Hugo, Webb and the crew will have to overcome personal tragedy, insurmountable odds and every cruel depraved twist of fate that the Orbit can throw at them.

As events escalate out of control, Hugo will have to go against everything he has ever believed in to save his crew and billions of innocent people. The outcome is always uncertain, but for the crew of the Zero, it was always this way. What will transpire will decide not just their fate, but the destiny of the entire Human Race.

***

Pretty neat, huh?


What We Need & What You Get


We are looking for a total of £1,500 to provide full marketing expenses for the novel and give it a real boost in visibility to readers in the initial stages of it's release and going forward. This includes:

  • Targeted online advertising campaigns for 3 months on Goodreads and other websites, in newspapers and magazines, hell, everywhere. We intend to make this book as visible as possible to the public with your help.
  • Book recommendation newsletter services such as Bookbub.com, Bookgorilla.com, Thefussylibrarian.com and other similar sites. These services will help us get the book out to a huge market of people who buy books, and look to these sites to help them make their purchasing decisions.
  • We will also be attending Fantasticon 2014 in Hull in August, and we will be able to make up promotional material  and really hit this great opportunity on launch day. 
  • Posters and flyers in as many small, independent bookstores, coffee shops and other places as we can for the money, and much more.
  • This will take up pretty much all the £1,500 we're asking for, and will give the book a massive boost, which will help it become a bestseller, and a part of our literary landscape for years to come.
  • If we smash the target for this campaign, and send it into orbit  this will give us even more chances to market the book. Hell, with more money, we can even get it into small bookstores - again, these things cost money. The more the better, as they say.


In return for helping us to achieve this marketing goal, you will be able to take advantage of one of our fantastic perks ove there on the right, including thanks by the author, singed or inscribed copies of the book, ebooks, t-shirts, the  flagship bundle, and a very, very special one-off perk of a signed, framed poster of the cover artwork. Just think - if this becomes a bestseller, that'll be worth some cash - plus it'll look fantastic above your fireplace  or in your study whilst you entertain local businessmen and artists. You can stare at it lovingly for years to come.

Also, we decided to make the perks a bit nerdy. As we envision that, like all good sci-fi, the book and the universe created will get some pretty hardcore fans over time, why not start early? Take a look at the images below - you can choose Service, LIL or Zero themed merchandise (we've mocked the logos up onto t-shirts to show you). So, the perks which include merch will be split  into three parts. Choose your side. Service - Honour and tradition. LIL - Revolution and Independence. Or Zero - Freedom from the machinations of a cruel, impersonal world.




    Other Ways You Can Help


    Even if you can't dig deep and help fund this campaign, then you really can do wonders for us by sharing it with all your sci-fi and literary type friends. Getting the word out on Facebook, Twitter, over a coffee down Starbucks, whatever - every little bit helps!

    Thank you for taking the time to look at our campaign, and thank you for being a part of the success story of this fantastic new sci-fi author.

    - RJ Davey
    Owner/Editor-In-Chief/Service Commander
    Dagda Publishing

    -J.S. Collyer
    Author, Zero
story_txt:

Well, hello there. Thanks for stopping by. Do you want to be part of the success story of a brilliant new sci-fi author? Then please read on...At Dagda Publishing  we have always  strived to find and nurture fresh, new writing talent. Writing talent that will have something to add to the world of literature for generations to come. And J.S. Collyer is such a writing talent. Her vision for "Zero" is one of the best we have seen in the world of new SF authors in a long time. Quite a bit of money. story:
The Tommywood Collection by Tom Teicholz gathers in Ebook and paperback format the arts and culture columns I've written over the last decade, many award-winning, covering the landscape of Los Angeles as well as my own personal obsessions, in a manner that has been called "informative and engaging" and "delivered with wit, humor and intelligence."



The columns feature profiles and conversations with icons as disparate as funnyman Mel Brooks, writer Michael Chabon, architect Frank Gehry, French Philosopher Bernard-Henri Levy and legendary Hollywood Producer Robert Evans. There are backstage tours of Disney Hall, visits to schools in South Central and a tour given by the painter R.B. Kitaj before his death as well as columns about Dylan, Randy Newman, Rod Serling, S.J. Perelman, Hungarians in Hollywood and, every so often, a deeply personal column.



I believe in the power of culture, in the power of good books, good conversation and interesting people to improve the quality of our lives.  Writing this column has made my life so much richer. I hope reading it does the same for you.




The cost to publish all six volumes is $7,500 which is what I aim to raise in this campaign. 

This covers: The cost of designing front and back covers and the interior page design for all six volumes in all Ebook formats (kindle, nook and epub) and paperback print-on-demand format, as well as the set-up and registration costs. Any and all sums raised will go to defray the costs of publication
$7500 is my cost for publishing the collection and to do so I'm offering the copies at a substantial discount along with some priceless perks (which I've nonetheless put a price on).

The six volumes are organized chronologically, covering around two years a book between 2003 and 2015. 



  


1, "Greetings from Tommywood" with features among others: Jill Sobule, Lucian Freud, Roman Polanski, Hungarians in Hollywood, Bob Dylan, Mel Brooks, R. B. Kitaj, Maah-jong ,Gunther Grass. Sandor Marai, Budapest in L.A., Frank Gehry, Rod Serling, Randy Newman,  S. J. Perelman, Robert Evans, Bernard-Henri Levy, The Rambam, Isaac Babel, Lenny Bruce, Stefan Zweig, Don Was, Arthur Miller, and Ephraim Kishon.

2. "Son of Tommywood" with, among others:  Woody Allen, Phil Rosenthal & Raymond’s End, Kitty Carlisle Hart, Hungarian Nobel Prize Winners, Missing New Orleans, Simon Wiesenthal, Kosinski & The Painted Bird at 40, Billy Crystal, Albert Brooks, Vassily Grossman, Bill Graham, Wendy Wasserstein,Michael Tolkin, Susanna Hoffs, David Mamet, and Old Jewish Jokes.

3. "Tommywood III: The Column Strikes Back!" with, among others: Mark Rydell, My father (who said he wasn’t a hero), Jonathan Gold, Zsa Zsa Gabor, Julius Schulman, Early Dylan, Harry Bernstein, William Shatner, Post-Zionism, and more New Orleans.

4. "Tommywood Jr., Jr.: The Gospel According to Tommywood" with, among others: Adam Sandler, Hatschek Bela, Philip Roth, Herb Gold, Rabbi David Wolpe, Yoram Kaniuk, Neil Diamond, Art Spiegelman, Holocaust Movies, Sid Grauman, The Annenberg Space for Photography, Jewball, Vidiots, What Survives from the Sixities, Rethinking Kasztner, J.D. Salinger obit, and  Q & A with Mel Brooks.

5. "Fast Furious Tommywood" with, among others: Arshile Gorky, Joshua Bell, Tony Curtis, Winston Churchill, Elizabeth Taylor, Albert Brooks, Wendy Wasserstein, Wallace Berman,  Weegee, the  Klezmatics,Jonathan Foer, Gustav Klimt,  Stanley Kubrick, Arthur Schnitzler, Rita, Lincoln (the First Jewish President) and Jon Robin Baitz.   

6. "Close Encounters of the Tommywood Kind" with, among others: Michael Chabon, Edgar Bronfman, Saul Bellow, Gary Baseman, Helmut Newton, Noa, Etgar Keret, Lou Adler, the Coen Brothers, The Marx Brothers, and Leonard Cohen.     



Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

story:
Important: Before contributing, please see the legal notice regarding why you need to select a perk.

Update: A sample of the magazine is now available! Click the image below to download.

Read a sample of the magazine here!

Who are you? What is this project about?

We are a group of hackers, computer hobbyists, gaming enthusiasts and journalists from Finland. We grew up reading about computers, programming, games and computer culture in magazines. They taught many of us how to do things ourselves instead of only consuming ready-made products. They raised the generation that gave birth to innovations like IRC and Linux and companies like Supercell, Remedy and Housemarque.

One by one, these hacker magazines disappeared from the mainstream and died off – in Finland and everywhere else. We felt sorry that they were gone. The Internet is great, of course, but it will never be permanent like print is. Articles on websites tend to disappear, but we can still read magazines from a hundred years ago.

Three years ago, we decided to make a magazine ourselves. We were fascinated with the idea of making something that we used to love, but writing about the topics of the present day. It turned out that this was a good idea, since a lot of people wanted to join us in making such a magazine. Skrolli and its community were born, and a total of 12 issues have been published since then.

The time has come to present Skrolli to an international audience. If this crowdfunding campaign succeeds, we can print an issue in English. If there is enough interest, we can even start publishing Skrolli in two languages.

Why would you make a print magazine in 2016?

Because we want to make a beautiful object that you can browse at your own pace, store on your shelf and come back to later on. We want to write stories that stand the test of time, stories that are good enough to be permanently written on paper.

Skrolli is printed in a high-quality print shop in Finland on eco-friendly paper. Our magazine is a sustainable premium product.

Who is Skrolli made for?

Skrolli is for anyone interested in the maker culture around computing and gaming. If you want to learn about how computers and operating systems work, hone your programming skills, gain practical insight into the latest technology, or simply read in-depth articles and columns from these fields, then Skrolli is the magazine for you.

Skrolli is made for the community and by the community. Many of our articles are written by fans of the magazine who are also experts in their field. This is a magazine unlike any other.

Please see here for a list of articles that have been published so far in the Finnish version.

This is a tentative cover and may differ from the final product.


Is this another ‘retro’ magazine?

You will find stories about old computers, game systems and other hardware in our magazine, but we are not only here to write about the past. We want to write about interesting topics in the field of computing, regardless of when they took place. Skrolli features programming tutorials for modern systems alongside stories of the very first graphics chips and historical articles about the game industry.

Will all of the content be translated from Finnish?

The first English issue will be a compilation of what, in our opinion, has made Skrolli great. The stories in the tentative cover above were chosen by our community. But if we end up making more issues, we will naturally be looking for contributors who write in English. This content will, in turn, also be used in the Finnish version of Skrolli.

Who will handle the translation?

The translation will be assigned to language professionals who work together with the original authors. A native speaker of English will proofread each article.

I want to write for Skrolli. How can I help?

Fantastic! Drop us a line at info@skrolli.fi and we'll take it from there.

What are the risks involved?

As with any project, there are risks involved with this crowdfunding campaign. We might not be able to deliver the end product on time, or we might run into problems with the printing and shipping. However, we have over three years of experience with this process and have already shipped 12 issues, so any problems are very unlikely.

How are the costs divided?

We need a minimum of $15,000 in order to make a print run. This would roughly be divided as follows:

  • 25% translation, editing and proofreading
  • 15% DTP
  • 30% printing
  • 5% packaging
  • 25% shipping
If we exceed our minimum, the proportion of translation, DTP and printing from the total price will go down. This will allow us to improve the magazine for everyone – we can add pages and even include a poster!

Legal notice

Skrolli ry is registered in Finland. According to the Finnish legislation, we cannot accept contributions that are not made towards a perk. If you want to support us, please do this by purchasing one of the perks.
