story:
Emerging Story of this Project/Movement

  • Support the forward flowing inspiration of Clayton Barker, a 28 year-old, loving, visionary youth leader and budding writer & author, committed to be the change he wishes to see in the world.
  • In the next 4 years, I seek to be a loving, effective, nonviolent and pragmatic stand for co-creating a world free from suffering, in relation to issues of diversity and racism, co-holding a vision of compassionate justice systems on Earth.  It is vulnerable to be this stand, yet it is true aliveness coming through me so I'm willing to keep walking into the unknown and co-create unity in diversity.
  • Currently, as an apprentice peace maker and writer, I am embarking on a year long experiential book research project & global co-creative service learning journey based in Dialogues about Diversity & Transforming Racism, Nonviolent Communication and Restorative Circles.
  • I feel sacred urgency about the suffering that exists on the planet and in my own communities, in relation to violence, painful conflicts, and punishment based justice systems struggling with issues of diversity and racism.  I want to learn how to embody transformational leadership in practical ways by giving voice to our present day reality.
  • I am dissatisfied with 2,000,000 + people living in prison in the USA, almost 90% of them are people of color.  I've got work to do and a hopeful, visionary book to write.
  • I am uncomfortable with the reality that I am 4 times less likely to be arrested than a black male in the US. I've got work to do and a solution oriented book to write.
  • I am pained that First Nations Communities like the Lakota Pine Ridge Reservation have a 90% unemployment rate.  I've got work to do and a constructive book to write.
  • This emerging book is my personal learning journey of integrating wisdom from over 70 life teachers, reflecting on my own breakdowns & breakthroughs, uncovering my own blind spots, interviewing leading (r)evolutionary change agents and integrating reality-based community feedback. 

 

Short Term Impacts in 2011 & Where Will Your Money Go?

It's a joyful privilege to be doing book research for this project, participating in co-learning and co-facilitation and at the same time being a channel for the redistribution and reallocation of money resources towards the visions and missions of these inspiring peace-building organizations!

 

US $5625.00 goes straight to Bay Area Nonviolent Communication and the 2011 N. American NVC Leadership Program for mentoring my learning and book research, help others have access to scholarships, and gives livelihood to NVC trainers and organizers.

 

US $500.00 goes straight to the Joy Living & Learning Center in Auroville, India to build a bamboo/palm hut for NVC volunteers/learners/trainers to stay in when they pass through South India and supports local eco-builders with income and much needed livelihood to feed families!  I will stay there, work on the book and donate it to the future! This will also support me being able to offer The Wake Up with other youth leaders in India from Chennai in Tamil Nadu.

 

US $125.00 goes straight to Institute of NVC in India so I can pay them to co-facilitate and off-set scholarships for others in India who want access to NVC training!

 

US $1900.00 goes straight towards honoring an invitation to travel to the Institute of Nonviolent Communication of India Convention in February 2011 and offer my experience of Nonviolent Communication (NVC) and Restorative Circles (RC) (with out me setting fees or suggesting sliding scales for my contribution).

 

$US 1000.00 goes straight towards honoring an invitation to facilitate at the Panya Permaculture Project & the Metta Experiment in Chiang Mai, Thailand in March & April 2011 with CNVC Certified Trainer Jack Lehman and do living book research while co-creating learning experiences in Nonviolent Communication (NVC) and Restorative Circles (RC) (with out me setting fees or sliding scales for my contribution).

 

US $750.00 goes straight to NVC trainer, Roxy Manning who co-founded the NVC & Diversity Project for her travel and honorarium so we can have the opportunity to co-facilitate a day long dialog of NVC & Diversity & Transforming Racism in July 2011 at the year long NVC based leadership program in Seattle called "A Path of Compassion & Empowerment" hosted by CNVC Trainers Karl Steyaert & Kathleen MacFerran.

 

US $1100.00 goes straight to honoring an invitation to apprentice along side with Kathryn Ssedoga from the Restorative Circles Learning Community and learn about what she and First Nations, Spoken Word & Street Communities are co-creating with Restorative Circles in her home town in Guelph, Ontario, Canada.

 

Travel to NVC Family Camp 2011 on Vashon Island in Washington, USA to offer my heart and presence without me setting fees or requested and suggested sliding scales for my work.

 

The rest of the money we generate for this project "pays forward" these these other co-learning experiences: http://cocreatingconnection.

 

*** Other than the plane flights to India and Thailand, I am committed to taking public transportation, riding trains, walking, riding bicycles, hitch hiking, carpooling, and using Craig's List for ride shares as much as possible to practice living more regeneratively with Earth.

 

7 Easy Ways You Can Help me FUNdraise to Meet This Goal

  1. Invite 20-2000 of your friends or family through your e-mail lists to give $10.00 or $1.00 or $100 to this project! We are committed to reach 50,000 people online by Feb 4th in order to meet the goal! If 11,224 people each give $1.00 or 1,125 people each donate $10 or 125 people each donate $100 we will meet the goal!

  2. Make daily or weekly updates on your Facebook, Twitter, Myspace or LinkedIn accounts and post the link to this page!

  3. Challenge your partner or co-workers to match your donation and guide them how to get here.

  4. Make a 1-2 minute announcement at your next business or community group meeting and invite people to contribute $10 to $1 and then donate the money for them, online

  5. Call 5 or 10 of your friends and tell them why you are so inspired by this project and movement and ask them to contribute $10 or $1 and tell them how to get to the link!

  6. Share this link with people and organizations who you know are already committed to working for peace & nonviolence, do diversity or anti-oppression work, are involved with restorative justice, writing, youth leadership, permaculture, cultural awareness, and intentional community building.
  7. Help me connect, over the phone or in person, with people who might like to have a conversation about making a bigger contribution to this project. Contact me at 201.206.2514 or buildingbridgesnvc@gmail.com if you are interested.

 

A Book for the Global Movement to Transform Suffering with Diversity & Racism Issues

  • I am seeking to synthesize many learning experiences I’ve shared with everyday human beings, renowned authors & the world’s leading Change Agents in diversity, transforming racism, nonviolence, restorative justice, Integral Theory & Evolutionary Spirituality and inquire into a wide range of styles and approaches to look at this conversation in a holistic way and support a global transformation of suffering in relation to diversity & racism.

  • It is a book about looking at the beautiful possibility of the spiritual vision of Oneness & Unity Consciousness on the planet and also being a model of seeking to bridge communication gaps by sharing my own human vulnerability and exploring my own traps and tests in thinking I’ve transcended racism and still learn how to meet life where it is on the ground.  As Lee Mun Wah says, "The cure is in the pain."

  • The book is aimed to lovingly inspire conscious and awakening people seeking spiritual growth & community to mindfully include this conversation in life-serving ways with our works as Change Agents and pragmatically co-create a world that works for all, in everyday life.

  • The emerging book is presently being called:

 

Being in in the Integral Nonviolence Birth Canal: "A White Youth Leader's Life Experiment in Synthesizing & Co-creating Conversations on Diversity & Transforming Racism 

and Co-Holding a Vision of Building Compassionate Justice Systems on Earth."

 

Total Pollination Funds to Awaken this Project by February 4th, 2011: $11,224 
  • The total current 2011 budget for this project is $12,126 and I have already co-manifested and co-generated $902.00 as of 1/3/2011.  Woo hoo!
  • I have a multi-tier FUNdraising strategy that includes: regular fundraising coaching sessions, a letter writing campaign to friends and networks, co-creating NVC workshop FUNdraisers with a # of CNVC Certified Trainers, doing one-on-one empathy coaching calls with clients on a sliding scale basis, launching this Indie Go Go campaign, door to door FUNdraising, tabling at the local community market, making bold requests of individuals that I meet that are inspired by what I am up, online donation button on my website, and limiting belief transformation.

 

What Happens If We EXCEED the FULL GOAL of $11,224Indie Go Go?

  • ALL surplus monies donated will be gifted to the NVC & Diversity Project in July 2011 for the scholarship fund to nurture the possibility that all those who want to have access to the retreat can do so with ease and grace.

  • IndieGoGo gets 4% fee for hosting this project which supports over 15,000 commuity & creativity projects around the globe to live their dreams in the wolrd.

     

What Happens If We Don't Meet the Full Goal of $11,224 on Indie Go Go?

  • Indie Go Go, takes 9% the money that comes in and the Being in the Integral Nonviolence Birth Canal project will keep the rest and share it with the other organizations (read more about how, below).

  • Because I have committments with 5 organizations, I am prioritizing travel FUNding to get to India and Thailand to honor the invitations there to co-create Nonviolent Communication & Restorative Circle learning experiences.

  • I am planning to FUNd the projects based on the sequential time frame in the itinerary of the project.  Because I offer my experience in workshops without any set fees or suggested sliding scales, I live life in the "pay it forward paradigm" and really appreciate community financial co-responsibility to keep giving my gifts in the world. 

  • Please help me to keep my research/learning/contribution dreams alive and thriving by redistributing resources towards Bay NVC, 2011 N.American NVC Leadership Program, NVC Family Camp, Institute of Nonviolent Communication in India, The Joy Living & Learning Center in India,  Kathryn Ssedoga of the Restorative Circles Learning Community, & Roxy Manning of the NVC & Diversity Program!

 

Gratitude for the Interdependent FUNdraising Team that Backs this Project! THANKS!
  • Francois Beusoleil of the NVC & Mentoring Program, the NVC & Abundance Project, and the Building NVC Communities project has donated hours and hours of coaching support for developing an effective and inspiring FUNdraising campaign!
  • Tom Clayton who is part of the Awakening the Dreamer community has donated $250.00, the "Fundraising from the Heart" CD's by Lynne Twist, and many hours of coaching and sharing about the "Soul of Money" & Friendraising.
  • Tara DeNuccio who is part of the NVC and Awakening the Dreamer Community, is a Life Coach in the Strozzi method has offered hours and hours of coaching support for FUNdraising, transforming beliefs, editing, and general encouragement to write this book and give my gifts in the world.
  • Eileen Workman who founded Sacred Economics, has donated $500.00 towards the project!
  • Matthew Blom of NVC Family Camp and Whole Life Prosperity has donated $50.00! Reid & Nancy Barker, my grandparents have donated $100.00 towards the research! Yay!
  • Vickey Peck of the Awakening the Dreamer community has already donated $50.00! Thanks!
  • Ryan Mylynarcyk, the Director of Within Reach Movie has gifted me coaching on this campaign! Thanks!

story:
I have qualified for the National Poetry Slam as a member of the Phoenix NPS Team. Trips don't pay for themselves though, here's where you come in!

I'm awesome...but I'm also a teacher (read: broke).

So, a little bit about myself...

  • Those of you in the poetry community know me as Chesko, the rest of you know me as Kevin Briancesco.
  • I have been slamming competitively since 2005 and have qualified for 4 different National Poetry Slam Teams. In 2010 I took a long break from poetry, but have returned and can't wait to head to Charlotte, NC to represent Phoenix.
  • I am the Co-Director of Forensics for Glendale Community College and devote a large part of my professional life as a teacher to helping others perform competitively at speech and debate tournaments, but now it is my turn to take the stage.

Where will your money go?

Here's what I need:

  • A plane ticket, a hotel room, and food.
  • I probably need around a grand to make this happen, but anything helps. Every dollar you donate will go directly to getting me to Charlotte to represent Phoenix.
  • If I can raise enough money to cover my basic needs, any extra money will go to buying books and CD's from the poets I have the pleasure of competing against at the National Poetry Slam. So not only are you supporting me, but you're supporting arts around the country! The literature I gather will also be used to help the speech team at GCC.

Why should I donate?

  • Because you love me.
  • I am teaching summer school full-time over the summer just to pay my bills, and fundraising for something like this is extremely time-consuming.
  • The more money I make this way, the less money I have to make by selling my body to science.
  • The Phoenix Slam Team promises to bring the funny. Comedic poetry rarely gets the appreciation it deserves, and the Phoenix team will be bringing a majority of funny pieces that will make you laugh (or at least attempt to).
story_txt:
I have qualified for the National Poetry Slam as a member of the Phoenix NPS Team. Trips don't pay for themselves though, here's where you come in!
I'm awesome...but I'm also a teacher (read: broke).
So, a little bit about myself...

Those of you in the poetry community know me as Chesko, the rest of you know me as Kevin Briancesco.
I have been slamming competitively since 2005 and have qualified for 4 different National Poetry Slam Teams. In 2010 I took a long break from poetry, but have returned and can't wait to head to Charlotte, NC to represent Phoenix.
I am the Co-Director of Forensics for Glendale Community College and devote a large part of my professional life as a teacher to helping others perform competitively at speech and debate tournaments, but now it is my turn to take the stage.



Where will your money go?
Here's what I need:

A plane ticket, a hotel room, and food.
I probably need around a grand to make this happen, but anything helps. Every dollar you donate will go directly to getting me to Charlotte to represent Phoenix.
If I can raise enough money to cover my basic needs, any extra money will go to buying books and CD's from the poets I have the pleasure of competing against at the National Poetry Slam. So not only are you supporting me, but you're supporting arts around the country! The literature I gather will also be used to help the speech team at GCC. 



Why should I donate?

Because you love me.
I am teaching summer school full-time over the summer just to pay my bills, and fundraising for something like this is extremely time-consuming.
The more money I make this way, the less money I have to make by selling my body to science.
The Phoenix Slam Team promises to bring the funny. Comedic poetry rarely gets the appreciation it deserves, and the Phoenix team will be bringing a majority of funny pieces that will make you laugh (or at least attempt to).

story:
Strangers is an upcoming collection of short stories, written by Cristian Mihai and Anca Dunavete. The collection will be made available in both e-book and paperback formats.

In order to do this, we need about $1,500. We managed to raise $879 in a previous campaign, and now we're trying to raise the difference.

What We Need & What You Get

The total amount we're trying to raise is $1,500 but the truth is, the actual amount is closer to $1,300 because of PayPal and Indiegogo fees.

And the first (and most important) thing to consider when crowdfunding a book is the cost of the perks. The cost of books, the cost of shipping, and all that.

Just to give you an idea: it costs something like $10 (maybe even a bit more) to order a paperback from Createspace and ship it to wherever the person who wants it lives. The perk costs $20, but we receive something like $17 after PayPal and Indiegogo take their cut.

That’s a $7 profit, and it's less than half.

So let’s say that in the end, we’re left with more than half. Let’s say $800.

That’s just enough to pay for editing, or if we get a good deal, we’re left with something like $200. And, yes, you need your book professionally edited. This is not the internet, this is something you’re asking money for, so it has to be as grammatically correct as possible.

Now comes the tricky part: the money wouldn’t be enough if I wouldn’t be able to design covers and format interiors for e-books and paperbacks. The work I do, that’s at least $500 in the world of freelance graphic designers. At least. Createspace charges more just for a professionally looking cover.

So, yes, we can get a book released, and we also get to use the remaining $200 for marketing and promoting, which means paying for ads on relevant websites such as Goodreads, hosting giveaways and contests. Stuff like that. I don’t think there’s really a need to go crazy when it comes to spending on marketing and promoting a self-published novel.

That’s pretty much why we need the money, what we need it for, and how we want to proceed.

In return for your contributions you'll receive e-books, mentions in the book, signed paperbacks, and prints of the cover artwork. And the oh-so-good feeling of having helped us out.

The Impact

This is kind of like asking us, "Why do you write?"

Well, we write because we want to change something in this world. We write because there are so many thinks we'd like to say and sometimes there's no one to listen. We write because there are some things we would never dare say out loud.

This is what's at stake. We want our voices heard, and only you can make it happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t help us with a contribution, don’t worry. Share, tweet, tell your rich friends about us. You can’t imagine how important (and rather simple) clicking the like button on our campaign’s page is.

story:
The situation between Israelis and the Palestinians is constantly deteriorating.
If this continues, the inevitable future is war, poverty and more death. We believe that the people from both sides can change this very probable future and prevent unnecessary additional loss of lives.

Leading Leaders for Peace is a movement created in order to unite and empower Israelis and Palestinians, whether individuals or organizations, for the creation of a peaceful and non-violent society. We strive to alter the course of history by influencing our leaders through our joined actions.

The first monthly silent walk in the West Bank was a demonstration that we, the people, are ready to live in peace. This pilot event drew over 60 participants. Our vision is to have thousands of Israelis and Palestinians marching together for a peaceful and non-violent society. Our next event is estimated to have 200-500 people participate in the West Bank.

Your support for the upcoming event will help facilitate transportation costs to and from the event, flyers, social media advertisements, refreshments and more, while helping our movement expand.

Here are some links:

International Peace Day Event 09/21/2012:

https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?v=1015122662...

The past event in the West Bank 7/20/2013:

https://www.facebook.com/events/337182966412949/

The international support event 7/20/2013:

https://www.facebook.com/events/485383961549657/

The upcoming event page 8/24/2013:

https://www.facebook.com/events/1393761654174420/

LLfP Facebook Page:

https://www.facebook.com/LeadingLeadersForPeace

story:
Why We Need Your Help

We need your help!  A Veteran's Legacy is a journal designed with prompting questions, space to answer and share stories, pictures and other history that ensures American veterans' stories are told today and to future generations. The journal also aids in helping to heal our nation's veterans by providing a format that is easy to follow and has been effective in aiding the healing process of Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD).    

We have a first run of the journals that are ready to be shipped to combat wounded veterans and are currently being used in programs across the country to help in the healing process of PTSD, etc.  However, we need your help to help us SHIP the remaining journals to veterans free of charge! The vision for this project from the very beginning was to provide this tool for FREE to the veterans as a way for us (and You!) to say THANK YOU for their service.  

Additionally, we have found that the journal needs to be self published to give us greater control over the creativity, accessibility, and marketing of the journal.  Our goal is to self publish the second edition and add additional creative elements which includes a family member section, places for pictures, etc.; but also, the second edition will be available online in a format that can be accessed by the user whether they are sigt impaired or have impaired mobility (arms, hands, etc.).  

Funding this project is the ULTIMATE way to say thank you to our veterans and to get a tool in their hands that will help heal and also share stories so that we can then turn them into living history through various art forms (photography, songs, books, artwork, etc.)

As we have seen with the first run, once a veteran and/or family member is aware of this tool, they then ask, “What can be done with our stories and pictures?” Veterans Legacy is already equipped to capture any story or picture and then turn that into “Living Histories” through art, live events, music, other books and/or film. There are examples of those below.  

These journals are unique.  They are the only tangible tool to capture every veteran’s story and also say “Thank You” in a meaningful way to those who serve.   Please help us self publish more of these journals and deliver to those veterans who need them most.  

CLICK ON THE VIDEO above to hear portions of stories from different generations and from supporters of this project about the benefits of this journal and HOW YOU CAN HELP! Be sure to see the rewards section for some really cool stuff you can earn at different levels! Thank you for doing your part!

What We Need & What You Get

If everyone on our email list was able to donate $10, that would get at least ONE journal into the hands of a combat wounded veteran immediately. PLUS, it would help us with our goal of self-publishing the second edition and building the infrastructure for sight and mobile impairment access. 

Be sure to see the rewards section for some really great rewards!  

When fully funded, half of the funds will be used to ship the remaining inventory to combat wounded veterans for immediate use in healing and therapy programs across the country.  The other half of the funds will be used to build the online infrastructure and the second edition of the journal. Plus, fees for this sight, credit card processing fees, and rewards expenses will also be used when fully funded.  

The Impact

There are millions of veterans today and many of these veterans are suffering from the emotional wounds of war, PTSD, physical impairments, etc. Journaling has been proven to help heal emotional wounds.  This journal is designed with prompting questions and space to capture answers to the questions, space to share stories, and share history.  This jounal can help them heal from these emotional battle scars. Not only is this journal a healing agent, it's also a way to start capturing all the stories that could be lost before they are told.  A Veteran's Legacy has a way to capture those stories and then turn them back out as living history in various art forms.  

We have already been successful in getting thousands of these journals into the hands of veterans who need them the most and have seen and heard countless stories of how valuable this journal is as a healing tool.  Help us get these journals out now in the tens and hundreds of thousands.  

This is a project that you can be sure that your support is an exponential impact in honoring veterans, helping them heal, and creating an appropriate place to remember. 

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP! 

  • Share this site with everyone in your network!

  • Facebook about us and share the link!

  • Twitter about us and share the link!

  • Ask your friends, neighbors, co-workers, etc to help us by honoring the veterans in their lives! 

 

The Story of "A Veteran's Legacy"

The "Spark"

A Veterans Legacy Journal started over 20 years ago when, as a senior art student at the University of Kentucky, I drew a picture of nine soldiers in Vietnam (drawing below). That drawing sparked a life-long love for honoring our country’s veterans in new and creative ways. 

 

 

Over the course of the last two decades I have realized the power of veterans' pictures and stories. It became clear that there is not only an urgency in capturing these experiences before they are lost,  but there is real healing that takes place when those pictures and stories are transformed into other forms (art, music, film and/ or books) and shared.  

Big Doors Swing on Little Hinges

In 2007,  I met two veterans who galvanized this project into what it is today, Gerald Belcher (US Army – Vietnam) and Joe Lane (USMC – WWII).

At a picnic one summer evening, I found myself sitting next to Vietnam veteran Gerald Belcher talking about our mutual interest in art and the military.  He asked me to come to his office the next day to consider drawing a picture from Vietnam that meant more to him “than anything in the world.”

When we met the next day he showed me this picture (picture below is the drawing).

He explained that, while the expression on his face was calm and collected, he was actually in a moment of sheer terror as he and his friend we trapped behind this earthen mound and were receiving heavy enemy fire.  He continued explaining that they didn’t know what to do,  but realized they had a camera and Gerald said, “why don’t we just take a picture of each other in case one of us doesn’t make it out.”

It was at that moment, I realized that each veteran has a story or a picture that no one else will ever know unless they share it.  There needed to be a way take veterans' best pictures/ stories and turn them into a new and creative way of sharing with others.  I thought the answer was producing a handsome coffee-table type book full of veterans best pictures and stories.

THEN I MET JOE LANE! 

Joe Lane and I met at a lunch honoring the remaining Pearl Harbor Survivors in our community later that year.  Joe had served in the Marine Corp during WWII and had seen combat in such places as Guadalcanal, Saipan and Iwo Jima.  He invited me to his home to talk about my project and to share his personal memories and memorabilia.

We spent 4 hours together that first day going through stacks of pictures and talking about the stories of his WWII experience.  It was then I realized, “Who am I to attempt to figure out the most meaningful picture and story from this man’s life?”

The “AH HA Moment”

It was upon leaving Joe’s house that I realized this project was different.    The project was to produce a journal for veterans of any generation to capture their personal experiences.  It was to be designed in a “Question and Answer” type format with a prompting question and plenty of room to answer.  The book should also have ample space for additional comments, pictures, maps, etc.

A Veterans Legacy Journal was born that day!

2010 to Today

The first run of these journals was produced in 2010.  Since then, we have seen amazing results.  Veterans and their families have truly appreciated and treasured the opportunity for a safe place to tell their stories.

 

We have also seen these journals have a tremendous healing effect on the emotional wounds of war.  Research has consistently shown that the positive impact of journaling reduces the damage of Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD).  These journals not only provide a tangible means of saying “Thank You” for serving our county to a veteran, but are also very effective in helping heal (whether that is as an individual, a family or a nation).

These journals have also sparked an amazing stream of stories and pictures flowing back to us to be considered for future art, music, books and films.

And then there was,
“Wedding Day Kiss” and “Ghost”

THIS 3-FOLD STORY DEMONSTRATES THE PROJECT’S POWER AND IMPACT!

As pictures and stories flowed into Veterans Legacy, the picture below with its amazing story found its way to the project.

"Wedding Day Kiss"
Dale & Kenneth Johnson's Wedding Day
July 1944

Part 1 - An Iconic Picture

The picture is of my wife’s grandparents on their wedding day in rural Kentucky in 1944.  The story goes that just a few days after their wedding, he was shipped off for over a year of separation from her to fight in some of the most intense combat in Europe during WWII.  He returned home after the war to raise their family and they remained married until her death for 47 years.

Part 2 – Saving History

In 1991, my wife’s grandmother passed away. She and her grandfather were going through pictures and came across this one.  When she asked about it, he gave her the details but said for her to put it back in the stack with the other old pictures and letters.  When he wasn’t looking, she slipped the picture into her pocket.  Fortunately for all of us she did because after he buried his wife, her grandfather burned all those old pictures, letters and stories to fulfill a promise he made to his wife to keep that part of their lives private.

Part 3 – Transformation to Inspiration

In 2011, I saw this picture and was moved to draw it as an original piece of art to give my wife as a present.  Once the artwork was completed, the image and story began to inspire other veteran couples to share their pictures and love stories with the project.  But who knew there would be something even more amazing to come from this image.

In 2012, a singer-song writer friend shared lyrics from a song he had created a few years prior.  Those lyrics were perfectly written to tell the story of my wife’s grandfather.  That song, "Ghost" recounts a World War II veteran asking the question if this current generation will remember the sacrifices he and the other WWII veterans made.  "Ghost" has been recorded and will soon be available on iTunes but you can receive a free download at various rewards levels.

This is what “A Veterans Legacy” is all about.  Prompting stories to be captured and then turning those stories into new ways to share them with a wide audience.

The Newest Way to Honor Veterans
Veterans Legacy Night (Live and Virtually)

In November 2012, Lexington, Kentucky created and hosted the very first Veterans Legacy Night.  This event packed the house to honor those who serve our country, to hear live interviews with veterans from across the generations, to witness the debut of “Ghost,” and rocked out with Grammy Award Winner John Elefante (former lead singer of Kansas), all the while raising awareness for specific groups assisting our military!

Please take a moment and back this project at any level and share this project with your networks, facebook, twitter, etc.  Help us get the word out and find as many backers as possible! 

Thank you for supporting this important project. And, more importantly, Thank you for expressing your appreciation to the Veterans and currently serving military service members that continue to keep our nation free.

This is what “A Veterans Legacy” is all about.  Prompting stories to be captured and then turning those stories into new ways to share them with a wide audience.
The Newest Way to Honor VeteransVeterans Legacy Night (Live and Virtually)
In November 2012, Lexington, Kentucky created and hosted the very first Veterans Legacy Night.  This event packed the house to honor those who serve our country, to hear live interviews with veterans from across the generations, to witness the debut of “Ghost,” and rocked out with Grammy Award Winner John Elefante (former lead singer of Kansas), all the while raising awareness for specific groups assisting our military!
Please take a moment and back this project at any level and share this project with your networks, facebook, twitter, etc.  Help us get the word out and find as many backers as possible! 
Thank you for supporting this important project. And, more importantly, Thank you for expressing your appreciation to the Veterans and currently serving military service members that continue to keep our nation free.

story:
Short Summary

Can a book do much to restore health to the American political system?

Such things do not happen often, but it is because I see a real chance of accomplishing this that I’ve felt driven to write a new book, WHAT WE’RE UP AGAINST.

That scenario requires that enough like-minded people pitch in to help.

Are you one of those people?

•  Are you outraged by the way the right-wing force is systematically damaging our nation?

•  Are you frustrated by the weakness of the response from the liberal side?

•  Do you sense the profundity of America’s present national crisis?

WHAT WE’RE UP AGAINST tackles this crisis head on, and shows how we can turn this dangerous political dynamic around.

•  It shows how the Republican Party has been taken over by a destructive force that threatens a future where the many are exploited by the few, the lie defeats the truth, and democracy is but a memory. Showing how such forces arise and operate in societies like ours, WHAT WE’RE UP AGAINST explains how a once-great party has become unlike anything ever seen before at center stage of American politics.

•  It also shows how the response from Liberal America has been woefully weak -- wholly inadequate to protect the nation. WHAT WE’RE UP AGAINST shows how a major part of that weakness stems from a dangerous kind of blindness—an inability to perceive and understand what we are up against.

I’ve addressed this book to Liberal America, to correct that blindness and to ignite the necessary fire that will give us strength we need.

WHAT WE’RE UP AGAINST both trumpets a call to battle and provides a strategy for winning.

This crisis is the fruit of things gone awry throughout the American body politic. But it’s a serious mistake to think of it in terms of ‘both sides do it.’ While both sides of our political divide play a role in this crisis, their defects are opposites. The Right insists on fighting over everything even when the national good requires cooperation, while liberals have been reluctant to fight over anything, even when the defense of what's best in America would require them to do battle.

I know that for many in Liberal America, the notion of doing battle – even non-violent battle – is repugnant. But the alternative in America today is much worse. The stakes – for us, for our children and grandchildren, for our imperiled planet – could not be higher.

What We Need & What You Get

My goal for WHAT WE’RE UP AGAINST – improbable, but quite plausible enough to warrant an all-out effort – is to get the message of this book into the national conversation in time to influence the 2016 election process. That requires that the book reach its target audience quickly.

It is the need for speed that induced me, after more than thirty years of being published by reputable commercial houses and university presses, to self-publish WHAT WE’RE UP AGAINST. But self-publishing means we have to create, on our own, the marketing muscle that a big publishing house would have provided. Add to that the ambition for this book – to catalyze a political movement – and the need becomes that much bigger.

Accomplishing this requires spreading the word.  And spreading the word takes money, and it takes people pitching in with their energy and their creativity.

So we need your financial help. And as a sign of appreciation for such a contribution, you will receive an advance copy of WHAT WE’RE UP AGAINST. (Larger contributions get larger rewards, as described in the “Perks” section.)

And we need capable people to lend a hand.

The more help we get, the better our chance of helping turn around the toxic political dynamic of our times.

The Impact

There’s a battle going on in America over the destiny of our nation. It is a battle that must be fought and must be won. In terms of impact on this battle, there’s a good chance that there’s no place you can get more bang for your buck than in supporting the effort to get WHAT WE’RE UP AGAINST out into America.

    Risks & Challenges

    Can we really change the country?The initialchallenge is to get the message of this book into the national conversation in time so that it will have a chance to have a meaningful and beneficial impact on the political climate in which the 2016 elections are held. The challenge might also be stated as to help give America the “Emperor’s New Clothes” moment it so badly needs: to get enough people to see the naked truth that the unprecedented is no longer treated as normal, and the disgraceful is no longer treated as acceptable.

    But the first challenge is to enlist the help of enough good people who see what’s happening to America, and care enough to help. Help, first, in getting the resources required to spread the word about WHAT WE’RE UP AGAINST. And help, second, in building a movement to use this book and its message as a weapon in the political battle on which America’s destiny depends.

    Fortunately, we already have a team of a dozen or so people who believe in this effort deeply enough to contribute their energy and creativity for nothing. Can we succeed in our online marketing strategies to find and reach more liberal Americans who will join forces with us? I believe we can.  And to help us meet that challenge, I am asking for your financial help.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We also need people to involve themselves in this nascent “movement.” Here are a few of the ways you can help: Sending emails to like-minded people in your network to encourage them to check the book out; participating in discussions of strategy; reaching out to contacts in the worlds of politics and communications; handing out brochures for the book at Bernie Sanders rallies; and coming up with your own ways of spreading the word to awaken a deeper and healthier understanding of WHAT WE’RE UP AGAINST and what we need to do to overcome it.

    • Help get the word out and make some noise about this endeavor!
    • Please use the IndieGoGo share tools!  Use Facebook and Twitter to make your friends aware of WHAT WE ARE UP AGAINST.
    • Visit www.whatweareupagainst.org and use the community-building tools on that website.

    About The Author

    Andy Schmookler has the ideal preparation to be able to tackle this challenge:

    • a summa cum laude graduate of Harvard, studying the psychology and sociology of politics and religion;
    • a Ph. D. from the University of California at Berkeley and the Graduate Theological Union in a program specially created to accommodate his original theory of how destructive forces have warped the development of civilization (which was eventually published as the award-winning book The Parable of the Tribes: The Problem of Power in Social Evolution);
    • the author of a half dozen books on the forces that need to be brought under control if humankind is to be able to create a more humane, just, and viable civilization;
    • a call-in talk radio host on a commercial radio station with a conservative audience, and on an NPR station with a liberal audience
    • the Democratic nominee for Congress in 2012 in Virginia’s 6th District, who gave a six-minute campaign speech that ignited excitement among tens of thousands of people across the nation
    • the author of a whole series of op/ed pieces published in newspapers across his very conservative region of Virginia, challenging the good, decent conservatives to recognize the true nature of the political force they are supporting.

story:
A new kind of history...

Chock full of ghost stories, legendary people, strange creatures, UFO accounts,  unsolved mysteries, and all manner of bizarre incidents... this book will offer the first comprehensive collection of folklore drawn from three and a half centuries of local history.  In this form, it represents the culmination of more than a decade of writing on all things weird in the Berkshires and its surroundings.

With your help, I can bring this unconventional chronicle of a fascinating region to life, allowing a unique alternate window into an important part of New England history for residents, visitors, and potential visitors alike.  

Uncovering the Berkshires

  • As an independently produced and published work, These Mysterious Hills can go beyond generic genre limitations to portray the diverse collection of local curiosities.  An additional $2,000 dollars is being sought to help defray costs involved in printing, distributing and promoting this book.             
  • Unique perks available to funders include free book copies, special limited edition merchandise, extensive promotional opportunities, guided tours and rare chances to explore little known haunted sites in the Berkshires.  
  • All funds raised will be used to underwrite costs of making this book available to residents and visitors of the area as well as curiosity seekers the world over.

Benefits the Berkshires

In addition to providing a broader perspective of the history of the region, These Mysterious Hills will help enhance the region's appeal as a destination for para-tourism, one of the fastest growing segments of the travel industry.  Included among the numerous locations brought to life in this book are many of the region's premiere venues for culture, history and natural beauty.

story:
Mentoring Women: We Need More!

Hi!  Thanks for stopping by our profile.  We are Dr. David Borst - retired dean of a college of business, and Dr. Erin Albert - former associate professor of pharmacy practice. We share a passion for mentoring--specifically mentoring women.  We also realize there is a crisis of leadership in the US right now, and not enough women are at the helm in leadership positions in most industries.

Through this '2 books in one' project, we're going to share our own (different) perspectives on mentoring women, through:

  • Sharing our own mentoring experiences.
  • Sharing our own experiences on setting up mentoring programs.
  • Describing how to be a good mentor, and mentee.
  • Our approach and philosophy to mentoring, anti-mentoring, and sponsorship.
  • Helping you and others set up formal mentoring programs.

While there are plenty of books on mentoring, there are few that address "how to" set up a mentoring program, both with the lens of the man and woman--for women, specifically.  We're here to help get more women at the helm through this project!

What You'll Get if You Say Yes to Mentoring Women with this Project:

We need the money for a first print run in order to publish this book in print format.  While we understand ebooks are easier and cheaper to produce, we also love good old fashioned paper books so we can utilize them as guides--and frankly, women need mentors over time, not just at one point in their lives!

We are selling individual copies at this site for presale, of course.  But, we're also selling an opportunity to have us help you start your own corporate mentoring program through our help!  There are a range of levels by which you can support this project.

The Impact

Straight up, Erin's in this to win this.  She wants to see more women at the helm in her fields (law, healthcare, entrepreneurship, and media).  David is in this to help women achieve their leadership goals, through his own experience.  Also, David's here to show other senior-level men that mentoring women is something they MUST do in this era in order to keep companies and our country globally competitive.

Risks & Challenges

There is no downside here.  We WILL publish this book, regardless of our results on this campaign.  But, with your support, we'll have this book-book in the hands of women who need it faster!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can pledge $5, that would be helpful.   If you can't support with dollars, we'd love it if you could support this project through your social capital, such as:

  • Tweeting this campaign
  • Like our Facebook page and follow our publishing journey and resources on mentoring: https://www.facebook.com/SHeSaysGuidetoMentoring/ 
  • Consider becoming a mentor!
  • THANK your mentors!

story:
Short Summary

My Mother Smiled Down From Heaven Today is a collection of poetry written by my mother over her lifetime and is a dedication to her talent in writing.

I realized at an early age while sitting next to her in church one day just how talented she was. I would often see her taking notes during the sermons, so I didn't think anything about it one way or another, but one day I noticed that she didn’t have any scriptures written next to her notes and that all her notes were going down just one side of the paper as opposed to across the page as she usually did them, so I looked to see what she was writing. 

Later, after the service was over, I asked her what she had been writing and she showed me not only that sheet of paper, but others like it as well. She had been writing poems according to the messages the pastor had been giving in his sermons. She had a whole collection of them that she had done. 

The one that I saw that I have chosen to use as the book’s title is “My Mother Smiled Down From Heaven Today”, which was written during the Mother’s Day service, and was dedicated to her mother.

My mother tried getting her collection published several times during her lifetime, but was unsuccessful at doing so. In 2000, she was diagnosed with Stage 3 Inflammatory Breast Cancer and on April 3, 2003 she passed away. 

What's Needed & What You Get

What's needed from you may sound like allot of cash just to promote a book, BUT the perks I am supplying are well worth the perk prices AND my Publisher is busy promoting my book globally, so I want to make sure that the packages are worth it to you, that all of the costs are covered as far as doing this and that the Initial Book Signing, as well as the book tour itself goes off as it should.

The VIP Packages are designed for Businesses, Churches, Organizations, Corporations AND Individuals who want to sponsor my project. With these packages, you will receive many perks and benefits from the VIP Author Introductory Luncheon Reception to various other gifts.

The main thing I would like everyone to keep in mind is that you will not just be contributing towards the promotion of my book; you will also be making it possible for two great organizations that I already contribute to personally, to benefit from this campaign as well by reaping a portion of the profits from the sale of the book.

The Impact

While trying to figure out how to get a publisher interested in not only publishing the book, but also handle the promotional aspect as well, I thought about what I would like to do once the book was “out there”. One day while I was surfing through Facebook, I found a link for a page for Operation Gratitude and I began to send cards and letters as well as other items to them for their care packages for our troops overseas. Later on, I also found a page for Green Beans Coffee Company and their Cup of Joe for a Joe program as well and began sending coffee to our service members. All of this was to show support for our troops and to help put a smile on their face for a while.

I have heard back from quite a few of the recipients of the care packages and the coffee as well, all of which are so very appreciative of the gestures made by the people back home who care to send what they can, and that’s how I came to realize what I would like to do as a result of my mother’s writings being published. I wanted to find a way to be a contributor to two great organizations that I love to give to: Operation Gratitude and Cup of Joe for a Joe.

These two programs are not just about cards and letters or a box of cookies or a cup of coffee. They are much more than this. The proceeds from all purchases of the Cup of Joe for a Joe program through the Green Bans Coffee Company go directly to charities that support the troops, their families, as well as the families of those who gave their lives for our continued freedom.

Operation Gratitude annually sends out 100,000+ care packages filled with snacks, entertainment items, and personal letters of appreciation addressed to individually named U. S. Service Members deployed in hostile regions, to their children left behind and to Veterans, First Responders, Wounded Warriors and their care givers. Their mission is to lift the morale, bring a smile to a Service Member’s face and express to our Armed Forces the appreciation and support of the American people. 

What I have chosen to do is to contribute 50% of the proceeds from the sale of the book to these two great organizations, with 25% going to each of them, to be used to benefit our service men and women during and after their deployments. I feel that my mother would be proud of my decision on this.

Other Ways You Can Help 


Operation Gratitude: www.operationgratitude.com

Cup of Joe for a Joe: www.greenbeanscoffee.com/coj

Thank you for at least taking the time to view my project and I’m looking forward to making this happen, as there’s more to come after this.

Terressa Kennedy

Operation Gratitude annually sends out 100,000+ care
packages filled with snacks, entertainment items, and personal letters of
appreciation addressed to individually named U. S. Service Members deployed in
hostile regions, to their children left behind and to Veterans, First
Responders, Wounded Warriors and their care givers. Their mission is to lift
the morale, bring a smile to a Service Member’s face and express to our Armed
Forces the appreciation and support of the American people. What I have chosen to do is to contribute 50% of the proceeds from the sale of the book to these two great organizations, with 25% going to each of them, to be used to benefit our service men and women during and after their deployments. I feel that my mother would be proud of my decision on this.Other Ways You Can Help Operation Gratitude: www.operationgratitude.com
Cup of Joe for a Joe: www.greenbeanscoffee.com/coj
Thank you for at least taking the time to view my project
and I’m looking forward to making this happen, as there’s more to come after this.
Terressa Kennedy

story:
Okay, Austin Walker has had a bad year. Like... really bad. We don't really need to get into details here, but this dude needs something to go right for him. And since this is our year, the Year of Luigi, we're gonna take this into our own hands and help a dude out and make him feel loved.

What Austin needs right now and the best way we can help him is to help him get a new computer. What he has now is barely working and can (and will probably) go completely kaput at any moment. If you know Austin well enough, you know that he's pretty notorious for having issues with technology, but him putting up with this is seriously not cute anymore. Really, this? http://instagram.com/p/f4LVF6sKB6/# UNACCEPTABLE. New computers are expensive, pretty much unattainable on a TA's salary, but something that's really achievable if we all pull together and give a little bit.

We want Austin to be able to continue working/writing/being hilarious and insightful on gaming streams, don't we? Let's help him out so he can! Need some reminding that Austin's a great guy who deserves this and makes great stuff? Oh man. Check  out his writing on Clockwork Worlds or hear him as a regular on Phil Kollar's stream channel.

If you can't contribute--that's totally cool, no pressure! But help us out by spreading this link around, checking out some of Austin's work, shoot him a tweet to cheer him up! This is just as much about giving Austin an e-hug as it is helping him out with something he needs.

Oh, also, some transparency: I'm the one putting this IndieGoGo together for Austin but the paypal/bank stuff is connected to him and is going straight to him with no need for transferring or concern he isn't getting every dime. I just wanna help a dude out, really! To give credit where it's due this idea stemmed from me(@ali_west) and Sarah (@newtypelady) and came together fully with some workshopping and help from Janine (@bleatingheart) and Phil (@pkollar). We're the ones who threw this together but now we need you help to make it happen!

story:
Story of My Book

I Am Glass is a poetry book that explores what it means to be “human”. From romance to loneliness to questioning, these poems take the reader through the many facets of the human experience and emotions. 

My name is Julia Weidman and I am the author of I Am Glass. I wrote this book because I feel that we, as humans, often repress our emotions instead of pushing ourselves to be vulnerable. This book is my push. This book is glass. It’s fragile and vulnerable, and I’ve put my personal emotions and experiences into writing and conversation. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will feel connected to one of the words, poems, or emotions on its pages. Each poem is an opportunity to self-reflect on your own story and your own perspective, and I hope to inspire you as the reader to share and be open with the people in your life.

In this book, you’ll join in me using language to render distinct aspects of love, expectations, darkness, and bliss through poems like: 

  • “Drifting, Wandering, Waiting,” which explores the solitude and beauty of growing up in the Sonoran Desert.
  • “How Much,” which explores how we try to mold ourselves to fulfill others’ expectations. 
  • “Little Specks of Fire,” which explores the moments of energy and connection that make us feel the most alive.

 

You will enjoy this book if you love honest, raw conversations, if you appreciate moments that foster human connection, or if you are drawn to poetry. 

I Am Glass is for anyone looking to stop the cycle of repressing emotions and for those who have broken it and need to continue developing their life-long practice of sharing, expressing, and being vulnerable. 

 

The Book Structure

I Am Glass is written in 6 Parts:

  • Wine Glass explores the themes of love, romance, and relationships.
  • Glass Mirror explores the themes of self-reflection, introspection, and appearances.
  • Glass Shards explores the themes of regret, darkness, and loneliness.
  • Glass Ceiling explores the themes of self-empowerment, boldness, breaking boundaries and expectations.
  • Hourglass explores the themes of time, pressure, questioning, and mortality.
  • Crystal Glass explores the themes of the best and brightest moments of life.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2020.
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hard cover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish an audiobook.

 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Julia Weidman is a Duke University graduate and Investment Banking Analyst at Lazard. She is an avid dancer, hot sauce fanatic, and dedicated board game enthusiast. 

She believes that we all strive for connection and compassion, but we can get in our way of achieving both by being closed off. She thinks that when we open up about our challenges and our brightest “crystal glass” moments, we recognize our shared experiences in the ups and down of life. The unity, power, and love that this connection fosters is what motivated her to write this book. 

She used to be close-minded in her belief that over-analyzing her mental and emotional state was harmful, and that exploring and dwelling on feelings were distractions that would prevent her from achieving her goals in life. But Julia has found that self-reflection, honesty, and vulnerability have allowed her to build an even greater sense of self and access deeper meaning in all of her relationships than she ever imagined possible. 

For more information you can connect with Julia at juliasweidman@gmail.com and on Facebook, Instagram, or LinkedIn.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #IAmGlass and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Julia Weidman

story:
Short Summary

Every spring, anyone at OC can contribute their short stories, photography, poetry, paintings, and more to Soundings. The result, after it is edited and published by the Soundings staff, is a journal that represents the creative minds of OC.

Every facet of Soundings is a group effort, and that includes the cost of publication. In order to publish and distribute this year's journal at no cost to readers, we rely on the generosity of donations and fundraising efforts. With your help, art lives on at OC for everyone!

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $1,000 to publish Soundings this year.
  • After printing, journals are given away for free at our end of the year Unveiling event. They are then available to anyone at OC who has a love for art, as well as prospective students.
  • In order to ensure costs remain as low as possible, perks based on donation amounts are not available.

The Impact

Soundings...

  • Allows students, staff, and faculty from all departments to share their great works with the world
  • Keeps the arts accessible to all
  • Gives students a solid way to make their mark and participate in the history of their school
  • Helps unite everyone within the OC community through art
  • Provides students with the ability to get firsthand experience in the publication process
  • Hosts Open Mic Nights where students can show-off their talents
  • Upholds a rich, 45-year old tradition of artistic journal publication at OC

Risks & Challenges

  • Not meeting our goals could mean the journal not going to print. In order to ensure this doesn't happen, we have a variety of events to help fundraise throughout the year including bake sales, Christmas Market, and more.
  • One of the biggest challenges we face when publishing the journal is page count. Sometimes, in order to keep costs down, that means a smaller journal. With your help, Soundings can have more room for the pieces and voices of OC!

Other Ways You Can Help

Soundings completely relies on the OC community. If you cannot donate at this time, spread the word about us! Tell friends, family, professors, and anyone you see at OC about the awesome things Soundings does.

You can also help by liking and following our social media! We can be found all around the web at these links:

  • Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/ocsoundings/

  • Twitter: https://twitter.com/OCsoundings

  • Instagram: @ocsoundings

  • Website/Blog: https://soundingsliterary.wordpress.com/

story:
The Story

In Fall 2008 some friends and I made a bet to visit 100 bars in 100 days. It was made partly out of boredom and bravado, but despite the unavoidable inebriation and schenanigans, something pretty cool happened. I really discovered Seattle. I went all over the city, met a gaggle of new friends and created some amazing (albeit hazy) memories in the process. I decided to keep going past 100 days, and visit every bar in Seattle.

Around 2010 I started to get a reputation as a bar guide, and several friends began asking me to write a book for them about the Seattle bar scene. When several requests became dozens, I casually started a Kickstarter to see if people would actually fund such a project. To my surprise, it was!

Since writing that first book, I've listened to people's reviews, created a new website, and started work on larger, more in depth version that was updated with current information to be released by Black Friday, 2013!

What Your Moolah Gets You

All money raised will be used in the design and publication of the book- basically, the more I raise, the cheaper my bulk order will be! Plus the book is adding 50 new bars, an increase of 50%!

$12 Gets you an autorgraphed copy of the book, and a digital copy for your phone or comp!

$24 Gets you two autographed copies, one for yourself and one to give away, just in time for Xmas, 2013! Plus the digital copy.

$35 Gets you the two autographed copies, and a DRENCHED beer coozie! Plus the digital copy.

$50 Gets you all the swag, plus a published interview in the book!

$100 Gets you all the swag, plus a batch of home made cookies every month for six months! Or a lot of free babysitting.

$200 Gets you everything listed above, plus I'll let you write my author biography!

And of course everyone who donates will be in the THANK YOU section of the book!

 

Thanks For Reading!

Creating and writing for DRENCHED has been a true pleasure I love that I am slowly making a living off of writing. People like you are helping make my dream come true- as small and drunken as it is. 

That being said, this is the last time I will be crowd funding a DRENCHED book. My goal is to picked up by a larger publisher in 2014! So thank you for helping make a quality book for everyone in the Emerald City to enjoy!

 

PS- You might notice the pic says "Guide to 100+ Bars" but that is an old photo, I have since decided to increase by 50!

story:
Easy-Cake Oven follows the bumbling trials and tribulations of Sally-Sara Lee, a cake-maker in the gay district of Toronto.  After receiving a mysterious phone call demanding one of her speciality cakes immediately, during World Pride no less, she heads off to the Toronto Island retreat to deliver the cake.  Boy, was she wrong!

The guests were all told it was a Bachelor or Bachelorette party for their wealthy benefactor, an Aaron Spelling type.  They had no clue what they were getting themselves into.  not to give too much away, but it turns into a battle royale between the Staff and the Guests, seeing who can make it until 8:00 am.  Hilarity and plenty of murder ensue.


About Me

As long as I've remembered I've loved mystery novels.  From Encyclopedia Brown and the Bobbsey Twins to Agatha Christie and Sir Arthur Conan Doyle. It has been  my dream to someday write my own.

Nearly 4 years ago, I picked up writing again, after a long sting of fundraising for the Arts.  I had not really having done so since University where I majored in Communications.  I then found myself an Executive Producer of an Award-winning web series.  Who'd thought?

But, this did give me time to write.  Combining my loves of mystery, dark comedy, Canada and baking (I am a whiz, trust me), I came up with the idea of Easy-Cake Oven.

It's only fair that you get a chance to check out my writing style.  I've published a ROUGH draft of the opening at: www.murderousvows.blogspot.com

The money raised will help me finance my dream of becoming a published author on both the Kindle and Kobo platforms, and fingers crossed, with a Publishing House. Should someone donate and not own an e-reader, a bound copy will be sent to them.  Additionally, the beautiful cover shown as designed by Thom Bierdz, best known for his portrayal as Philip Chancellor lll on The Young & The Restless, wasn't exactly cheap.

I ask that you take a look at my perks: I personally think there's some fun ones in there. And, if you could pass along word to your pals, it would be most appreciated.

-Jason.

story:
Everyone has a story. Through participating in the Yale University Writer's Conference this summer, I will fulfill a dream.

Literally, I have dreamt of taking classes at Yale University, and have been accepted into this program.  During this class my book, The Third Floor Chronicles by Shaunda Holloway will be critiqued before it is sent out to a publisher, my writing skills will be enhanced, and I will connect with other writers and top notch professionals.

This opportunity will allow me to engage in dialogue with my peers learning more about my craft, and in some cases, establishing solid ties with members of the literary community.

As an artist/writer I am eager to share my talents with others.

Supporters of my project who offer financial contributions will receive original and signed monotypes.  No two pieces are exactly alike.  I offer a unique print to each contributor who sees the beauty in my dream.

story:
How Tyler and Truffles' Big Flying Adventure Came to Be

Several years ago, my friends Tom and Christy welcomed their second baby boy into the world. Then one night, after oozing over the most recent pictures of Tyler and his constant companion, Truffles the Elephant, I decided to try my hand at writing a children's story featuring the adorable duo. By 3:00 a.m. the next morning, Tyler and Truffle's Big Flying Adventure was born.

After sharing the story with several moms who loved reading it to their kiddos, I decided to hire the amazing Emily Jay to illustrate the story and self-publish through Blurb. 

Due to the high cost of printing full-color hardback books, hosting a pre-order sale is the only way I can get Tyler and Truffles' story into the world at a semi-reasonable price. I hope you love it enough to join me in making this book come alive in the hands and minds of children this Christmas. 

What We Need & What You Get

The purchase price is $25 per book plus $5 shipping. This includes:

  • One hardback, full-color copy of Tyler and Truffle's Big Flying Adventure signed by the author
  • Packaging, postage, and Indiegogo fee coverage
  • Delivery by Christmas Eve or before (Lord willing and without some unforeseen crisis)

Anyone interested in purchasing a copy of the book after the campaign ends will be able to do so through Blurb's Print on Demand Feature, but the price is likely to increase.

Risks & Challenges

Full disclosure...$3000 is roughly the expense of printing 100 books, having them shipped to my home in Michigan, and sending them to your doorstep. 

If more than 100 books are ordered, the production cost might decrease. However, the price of purchasing a book through this campaign will remain the same. Any funds over and above printing and shipping costs will offset the expense of paying an illustrator.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you have no interest in purchasing a book for your child or grandchild, you can still help get Tyler and Truffles' Big Flying Adventure out into the world:

  • You can share the campaign on Facebook.
  • You can purchase a book and donate it to your local library or preschool. 
  • You can pray that we meet our goal and that all goes well with the printing and shipping processes. 
     

Thank you for your support!

Donya

story:
Story of My Book

The year 2020 has exposed broadening inequalities in the land of hope, opportunity, and prosperity. Amid the U.S. economy’s gradual recovery from the 2008 Global Financial Crisis, software engineers in Silicon Valley and white collar workers in urban centers had seen a large expansion in their disposable income. But in the rural and suburban American heartland, farmers and blue collar workers have witnessed the devastating consequences of globalization. Then came a global pandemic and recession that have shuttered small businesses and prompted mass layoffs, crippling millions of formerly middle class U.S. households with unemployment and food insecurity. Meanwhile, inequality and discrimination based on race, gender, and sexual orientation remain far from being resolved.

While America struggles to find its footing, China is poised to emerge as a land of hope, opportunity, and prosperity. If you think of China as a poor, secluded country plagued by famine and political fanaticism, you haven't been paying attention. China’s economy is growing at a remarkable pace. The country's unprecedented growth has fostered a sense of national pride and a belief of the promise of social mobility and prosperity. And yet, even in prosperous times, China's urban-rural economic divide remains stark. While entrepreneurs in Beijing and Shanghai make their way onto the Forbes list, farmers in the countryside barely make it on less than $150 a month. 

I’m Harry He, author of Marching Toward Moderate Prosperity. As a Chinese international student at the Georgetown University School of Foreign Service, I hear my classmates debate whether the American Dream is still possible. That is, the belief that any American, regardless of where they were born or what race or class they were born into, has an equal opportunity to achieve success through hard work, dedication, and passion. Americans haven’t cornered the market on dreaming. 

Among China’s middle class, the Chinese Dream is very much alive. This promise of individual success and achievements combines the ancient wisdom that “education changes destiny,” the bright projection of long-term high-speed economic growth, and the government’s promise that China is marching toward a prosperous society. 

Marching Toward Moderate Prosperity is a tale of China’s miraculous economic development, told through the accounts of members of China’s middle class. In reading this book, you will discover that the story of an economically prosperous China isn’t every Chinese citizen’s story and that the promise of the Chinese Dream is not so easily accessible for many. I hope to inspire and excite you with stories of Chinese citizens grappling with the idea of economic development and the Chinese Dream, such as
  • Disillusioned by the promise that education changes destiny, a young college graduate abandons his dream and settles down for a complacent career.
  • Determined to provide a better education and opportunities for his daughters, an ambitious civil servant and dedicated father struggles to climb the social ladder.
  • Under traditional, familial, and social pressure, a young and capable women decides to prioritize family over her career. 
These three protagonists are examples of what a successful story for a Chinese middle class should look like, but if you follow my story and delve deeper into their narratives, you will identify sources of dissatisfaction, discontent, and disillusionment that does not fit the overall theme of achieving the Chinese dream and marching toward prosperity.

Marching Toward Moderate Prosperity is a nonfiction book that speaks to any who want to look at China and economic development in a new way. You will love this book if you are passionate about a fresh account of China, interested to learn about a different perspective of a story about development, or simply curious about personal stories from the other side of the Pacific.
 

The Book - Marching Toward Moderate Prosperity

The book is written in five parts.

 
Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-2. It sets the stage for the stories by unpeeling the concept of the Chinese dream and familiarizing you with the characters you will meet throughout the rest of the book

Part 2 contains chapters 3-5. Through the lens of class, these chapters dissect economic and social stratification in China. You will gain a better sense where the subjects of this book stand within the Chinese society to better understand their fears, hopes, and dreams that can resonate with your own personal experience. 

Part 3 contains chapters 6-7. Building upon the previous discussion on class, these chapters expose you to the flip side of the same coin. In a sharp turn, advantages become disadvantages and privileges become shackles. 

Part 4 contains chapters 8-10. Gender-related issues predominate these chapters. You will be invited to identify the promise of greater gender equality in the narrative of the Chinese dream as we explore why women have experienced China’s economic boom significantly differently from their male counterparts.

Part 5 contains chapters 11-12. Building toward the conclusion, we’ll weave together the book’s personal stories into a broader framework of economic and social development. A paradox exists between the perception that the Chinese Dream is universally attainable and the reality that it remains elusive and unreachable to many within society. We’ll seek to resolve this paradox together. 

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor who will work with me to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.

The copy editor and proof reader who will polish grammar and spelling prior to publication

The cover designer who‘ll create a high-end design for my book jacket. (The mockup you see currently is a placeholder.)

The layout designer who will build the interior of my book, both the physical copy and ebook formats.

The launch & promotion experts who will lead the effort when I ultimately publish this Spring.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish this Spring.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!
 

 

About the Author

Harry He loves to challenge existing perceptions by presenting the views and stories of people whose voices are traditionally underrepresented. A native of Hefei, China, Harry has lived in the Washington DC area for seven years. Driven by his passion for political and social issues in Asia, Harry is currently working on a senior thesis project exploring China’s neighborhood-level pandemic responses. He has served as a research assistant for many distinguished professors at Georgetown University School of Foreign Service, where he is currently pursuing a major in Asian studies and a minor in government. Harry hopes to continue his studies through a PhD program in political science. 

Outside of work, Harry is an amateur photographer, an avid traveler, and a passionate foodie. He is a nerd for Tolkien and gets unnecessarily competitive when playing board games. He has an extremely cute and intelligent dog named Nana (which is a fun name in English, Mandarin, and Japanese).

For more information, connect with Harry at hfheziyu@gmail.com and at @hfheziyu on Instagram.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #MarchingTowardModerateProsperity and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.
  • Thank you so much for all of your love and support!


Thanks again,
Harry
