story:
Story of My Book

The Lonesome Thread: Reflections of Solitude, Boredom, & Creativity is a book about developing a positive and creative relationship with solitude and boredom.

My name is Bryan Crosson and I am the author of The Lonesome Thread: Reflections of Solitude, Boredom, & Creativity. I wrote this book because I wanted to show people how building a healthy inner-life can enhance their relationship with themselves and others.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover new perspectives on time spent alone and the potential it has to be a force for good. This book tells the story of human solitude and creative endeavor throughout history and around the globe. Ultimately I want this book to serve as a toolkit for connecting with and structuring a healthy inner life.

In this book, you'll see how others have dealt with solitude, loneliness, and isolation and turned it into a force for creative thought and action. It also includes:
  • Methodologies to rediscover your interests and passions
  • Techniques to set and achieve personal goals
  • Practices to become more mindful, present, and driven
If you have a pile of unfinished projects or incomplete goals, this book will show you how to refocus on yourself and get back to them, and how doing so will benefit both you and the people in your life.

The Lonesome Thread is a non-fiction book that speaks to people who desire to be more connected with themselves, particularly in times of loneliness and solitude. This is a great book for anyone looking to breathe some life into their social-distancing routines and use their time more creatively.
 

About The Book

The Lonesome Thread is written in 3 Parts:

  • Time and Space contains stories about leaders, entrepreneurs, and warriors who have withdrawn from society, walked the world alone, and successfully returned transformed.
  • Tools and Reflections includes personal anecdotes that provide tactics and techniques to shape your mindset and rediscover your personal interests and goals. From jumping out of planes over rural Virginia to chasing knife-wielding thieves through the streets of Thailand, this section explains the tools I have found useful throughout my life.
  • Creation and Gratitude contains inspiring stories of people who use their time unplugged from society as a means to recharge and reenergize themselves to be better stewards of the human race. This section shows how by focusing on the things that are personally fulfilling to us we can give back in greater measures to those around us.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Winter

When I pre-sell 130 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 160 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 210 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and portions of the manuscript, with opportunities to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Bryan Crosson grew up in Frederick, Maryland and was commissioned as a Marine Corps officer after graduating from The Citadel in 2010. He served as a military advisor in Sangin District, Helmand Province, Afghanistan as a part of Operation Enduring Freedom. After the military, Bryan completed his MBA at Georgetown University and currently works as a cybersecurity professional in the National Capital Region. 

Bryan lives for creative pursuit and adventure, and in his spare time can be found on a motorcycle, jumping out of an airplane, diving the ocean’s depths, or behind a camera lens.

For more information you can connect with Bryan via email, LinkedIn, or on Instagram.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #LonelyThread and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

All my best,
Bryan

story:
Short Summary

My name is Kyra Ann Dawkins. I was compelled to write The We and the They because I wanted to create a narrative space where one could healthily escape the limits of individuality and experience a story as a member of a new collective.

The We and the They is set in a world crumbling underneath the grip of the Great Famine. There are people who are wandering throughout the wilderness, who ultimately coalesce and meet each other and agree to look out for one another as they find food. This group ultimately ends up calling themselves the We.

As the We are moving through the desert, they encounter a group of people called the They who invite the We to their big farm oasis amidst the wilderness, promising to feed them. The We willingly go with the They and the They do, in fact, feed the We. However, it soon becomes clear that the They intend to abuse the We in different and more insidious ways. Even as the We are eating these elaborate feasts on a beautiful dining table, their legs are tied to the chairs and they are not released until every morsel on their plates is consumed.

Though the “We” perspective is maintained throughout the entire book, readers will have the opportunity to meet six named We characters. All six of them die from things they swallow while the We are still with the They. As the We wrestle with grief and honor their lost ones' memory, they discover that the They invited them to the big farm for an even darker purpose. With all of this in mind, the We decide whether or not they need to escape.

I hope that The We and the They is the kind of book that people will want to read aloud and discuss with one another. This book explores the intersections of collectivity, loss, and different definitions of satisfaction. Throughout the plot, this book engages with questions like:

  • How does a community maintain unity in the midst of scarcity?
  • What does it mean to navigate grief and honor the memories of those who pass away?
  • How does the framing of satisfaction change the ways in which people go about attaining it?

You will enjoy this book if you are fascinated by oral tradition, you like considering questions about community and identity, or you just want a break from curating your “I.”

I want The We and the They to foster communal discussions about identity, grief, and legacy. It has always amazed me how much a narrative can bring people together, and I look forward to becoming closer to all of you, my incredible readers, through this story.
 

What We Need & What You Get

The We and the They will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July, 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book – the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the book’s interior (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book – to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts – for when I ultimately publish this summer.

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personal, handwritten thank-you note for pre-ordering my book.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgements section (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • You will gain early access to the Introduction and other parts of the manuscript, with the opportunity to review them and give me some feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to help select the design for my cover.
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experiences of writing my book and address other pertinent subjects of interest to you.
  • And more...

About the Author

I am currently a senior at Columbia University in the City of New York, studying Medicine, Literature, and Society.

Since I am about to graduate from college, at this stage in my life, I feel this intense pressure to construct my identity in some sort of cohesive way. I think that we all live in a society that demands each of us to curate our “I’s,” whether it be through having the best social media photos or best bullet points on our résumés. Framing oneself as an individual all the time can be confusing, exhausting, and isolating. However, I know that I would not be who I am without the stories I’ve been told and communities that I’m part of. I feel less alone and I am less nervous about who I am becoming when I remember the collectives that are already around me and join new diverse ones.

For more information, you can connect with me by:
Email: kdawkins4444@gmail.com
Facebook: Kyra Ann Dawkins, Writer
LinkedIn: Kyra Ann Dawkins
Twitter: @KyraADawkins4

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, especially in the midst of such challenging times (polarizing US politics, coronavirus, etc.). Please know that I completely understand and will wholeheartedly appreciate any form of support, even if it is a word of encouragement. Here are some other ways you could help:

  • Please share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. When you do this, use #TheWeandtheThey and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please mention my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text message or social media direct messaging.

 

Thank you so much again of all your love and support!

Sincerely,
Kyra Ann Dawkins

story:
Secondary Goal: Angular, React, or Vue?

In 11 days the campaign goal was reached. Thank you for your support!  I've already started to write the Perl Dancer SPA book and I am going to send out the perks in the coming days.

However let's not stop here. Let's get even more support for the book and add more value to the book. Several people suggested to use Angular, React, or Vue instead of jQuery. So here is the deal I offer. If we reach $7000 I'll implement the whole front-end part in one of those frameworks as well. In addition to jQuery. Which one? The people who support the book will decide. I'll ask everyone who supported the campaign which one they prefer and the one with the most votes will win.

 

About the Dancer eBook

Many modern web applications are Single Page Applications (SPA).  They load only one HTML page and from that point on they communicate with the server using AJAX requests.

The most well known example of a SPA is Gmail, but a lot of modern web applications work this way.

Perl Dancer 2 is a modern, light-weight, route-based web framework for Perl 5.

jQuery is the workhorse of the front-end, a JavaScript library that seems to stick around as other libraries come and go.

Bootstrap is probably the most popular HTML/CSS framework for creating web applications.

SPAs are well suited for applications that require authentication and thus don't expect to be indexed by search engines. While the focus of this book is SPAs, a web site can include both a private web application and a set of public pages that need to be indexed by search engines.

This e-book will include a chapter on creating content-heavy public pages that can be used for SEO (Search Engine Optimization).

You will not be required to have an expert knowledge of Perl, but knowing Perl will certainly be to your advantage. For example, you are not expected to know how to install modules. It will be explained.

The eBook will be self-published via Leanpub. You'll get 3 files in pdf, epub, and mobi formats.

The planned release date of the final e-book is February 2018.

    Outline

    The following is the planned content of the book though I may need  to make adjustments.

     
    • Installing Dancer2
    • A simple route returning the HTML page that will house the rest of the application
    • Introduction to Bootstrap, the HTML/CSS framework
    • When to use an SPA and when to avoid it, an SEO perspective
    • Creating content-heavy web pages for SEO
    • Selecting the JavaScript framework: the case for jQuery
    • Simple AJAX requests to get some data from the server to the application
    • Submitting data to the server and getting a response
    • Client side input validation
    • Server side input validation
    • Client side error handling
    • Server side error handling
    • Designing and implementing an API
    • Testing the back end API
    • Pages: client side routing
    • Submitting a form
    • Authentication
    • Session management
    • Application deployment

    About the Author

    I am the author of over 1,000 articles on the Perl Maven site, on the Perl 6 Maven site, and on the Code Maven site. These sites have over 10,000 readers every day. I've been writing Perl since 1995 and teaching Perl training courses for 17 years. This includes a course called Web Application Development using Perl Dancer, where I teach the subject of the planned e-book.

    I am also in the middle of writing a book about Web development in Perl 6 using Bailador, which is a Dancer clone in Perl 6.

    About the Reviewers

    4 people have offered their help to review the book:

    • Alberto Simões core developer of Dancer, organizer of the great YAPCs in Portugal.
    • Sawyer, core developer of Dancer, Perl 5 Pumpkin, Tel Aviv.pm and AmsterdamX.pm.
    • Dave Cross Perl trainer, consultant, Perl hacker, maintainer of blogs.perl.org, and author of Data Munging with Perl.

    • Mohammad S Anwar, the CPAN author with the most daily contributions.

    What I Need & What You Get

    I need at least $20,000 to cover the time I am going to spend on the book. I hope that once the book is published I'll be able to sell many copies of it and will be able to get that covered. I might even earn some extra. However, I don't want to write a book and find out that no one is really interested. So, I am running this crowdfunding campaign to gauge the interest in this book.

    The goal of this campaign is to raise $4,000.

    This is an "all-or-nothing" campaign. If we don't reach the goal, all the contributions will be refunded and the project will be cancelled.

    Risks & Challenges

    I could get run over by a bus or otherwise become unable to do the physical or mental work needed for this e-book. This does not seem very likely to me. Other than that, I don't see any major risk.

    I've been teaching this subject for several years now. I "just" need to convert it into a book.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Getting your direct support is golden, but you can do so much more to help the campaign! You could get a personalized link from  Indiegogo and recommend the campaign to your co-workers, Twitter followers, Facebook friends, etc. Each such share will also compel Indiegogo to further promote the campaign. Unlike in programming where DRY is a considered a desirable value, if you want people to do something you usually have to get them exposed to the idea several times. So don't be DRY. (or shy)

I might even earn some extra. However, I don't want to write a book and find out that no one is really interested. So, I am running this crowdfunding campaign to gauge the interest in this book.
The goal of this campaign is to raise $4,000.
This is an "all-or-nothing" campaign. If we don't reach the goal, all the contributions will be refunded and the project will be cancelled.

Other Ways You Can HelpGetting your direct support is golden, but you can do so much more to help the campaign! You could get a personalized link from  Indiegogo and recommend the campaign to your co-workers, Twitter followers, Facebook friends, etc. Each such share will also compel Indiegogo to further promote the campaign. Unlike in programming where DRY is a considered a desirable value, if you want people to do something you usually have to get them exposed to the idea several times. So don't be DRY. (or shy)

story:
AVAILABLE TO PRE-ORDER!
6-1-20 The book is complete and will be released in early July of 2020. Thank you to all of the backers who believed in this project! The book is now available for pre-order at: store.johnborowski.com and shipping early July.

PROJECT UPDATES

9-4-18 Thank you to all of the contributors who made this findraising campaign a success! The book is currently in production.

Summary

“I’ll kill the first man that bothers me.” These were convicted criminal Carl Panzram’s words to Warden White upon entering Leavenworth Penitentiary in February of 1929. Panzram kept his word and murdered the laundry foreman who was taunting him about his past crimes. A life of torture and suffering led Panzram to hate the entire human race and himself. His only friend ever was Washington DC jail guard Henry Lesser, who Panzram continued writing to while incarcerated at Leavenworth. Eventually, Panzram is placed in solitary across from another famous criminal, Robert Stroud: The Birdman of Alcatraz, whose complete writings on Panzram are included in this book.


Panzram's Leavenworth mugshot.

Since 1970, there has only been one book available on Carl Panzram. This existing book has numerous inaccuracies. After creating his feature documentary film Carl Panzram: The Spirit of Hatred and Vengeance, John Borowski decided to make use of his research material and place it into this book, giving researchers unparalleled access to Panzram’s incarceration at America’s first federal Penitentiary.


One of Panzram's letters to DC jail guard Henry Lesser.

This book is important as it is the first to accurately convey what exactly occurred at Leavenworth and Panzram’s mindset at the prison. Most importantly, an entire chapter is being devoted to Panzram’s last words, a subject that filmmaker Borowski did not have the screen time to explore in the documentary film. This book will be an entirely new experience for anyone familiar with the case of Carl Panzram and a fascinating new read for anyone who is not familiar with Panzram’s case.


Panzram's fingerprints from Leavenworth.

The book will be approximately 400 pages and contain archival writings by The Birdman of Alcatraz: Robert Stroud, Henry Lesser, Dr. Karl Menninger, Charles S. Wharton, Warden Thomas B. White, and many others.

Book Cover Image

The image on the cover of the book is a combined image of Carl Panzram's first mugshot, on the left, from Fort Leavenworth, and his last mugshot, on the right, from Leavenworth Penitentiary. Strangely enough, Leavenworth, Kansas was the location of Panzram's first and last federal incarcerations.

What is Needed & What You Get

The budget for this campaign will be applied to the costs for producing the book including interior and cover layout. This fundraiser is not only an opportunity for everyone to contribute, be listed as a donor, and receive the final book, but also to receive many unique, one of a kind perks related to Carl Panzram’s life and crimes, including some screen-used props seen in the feature documentary film.

About the Writer

John Borowski, Author/Filmmaker

 
johnborowski.com

John Borowski is an award winning indie filmmaker, author, and entrepreneur. His films works: H.H. Holmes: America’s First Serial Killer, Albert Fish: In Sin He Found Salvation, Carl Panzram: The Spirit of Hatred and Vengeance, Serial Killer Culture, and Bloodlines: The Art and Life of Vincent Castiglia, have garnered worldwide acclaim and are distributed internationally on DVD, television, and streaming. The first season of his most recent project, Serial Killer Culture TV, is streaming on Amazon Prime and Season 2 is currently in post-production. Borowski’s books, The Strange Case of Dr. H.H. Holmes, Albert Fish: In His Own Words, The Ed Gein File, and Dahmers Confession, are indispensable material for expert researchers and true crime fans alike.

Joel Goodman, Afterword

At SDSU in May 1979, Goodman met Henry Lesser who left the jail and prison business in the early 1930s.  Along with two professors, he taped an interview entitled, Killer’s Guard. Goodman earned a Master of Science degree in Criminal Justice Administration from SDSU in 1979 and continued with the BOP in these locations:  Community Corrections Office in St. Louis MO, Metropolitan Correctional Center in Tucson AZ, Community Corrections Office in San Diego CA, and spent 19 years at the BOP’s Management and Specialty Training Center in Aurora CO.  After 31 years with the BOP, he retired in 2008.  He does corporate and litigation consulting from his home in Colorado 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, please spread the word about this campaign by sharing on social media and telling others about this important historical book. Another way you can help is by purchasing DVD's and books by filmmaker/author John Borowski and by viewing Borowski's films and TV Show, Serial Killer Culture The Web Series on Amazon Prime.

Thank you for your interest and contribution!

Perks

We have some amazing perks. All Collectibles come with certificates of authenticity, even Manson's hair! 


Panzram's name was misspeled upon entering Leavenworth

All Collectibles come with certificates of authenticity, even Manson's hair! Panzram's name was misspeled upon entering Leavenworth

story:
Welcome to my campaign. I'm a candidate for a Master of Fine Arts in Writing. I've worked towards this goal for almost 30 years in one way or another. I also work full-time as a Legal Document Specialist for Document Technologies, Inc., and I'm an avid ukulele player. My biggest claim to fame is that I managed to raise four kids who turned into decent adults whom I enjoy hanging out with, discovering that I learned more from them about life than they did from me. I grew up in San Francisco and currently reside in Keizer, Oregon. I write stories about growing up in San Francisco in the 1960's and '70's, and about my chaotic life as a single mom who survived. 

My campaign is to raise money to finish my MFA Program and to assist in publishing my book entitled, "How Will I Explain This To My Kids?" Finishing my thesis (my book) and receiving the MFA I've worked so hard for these past three years means everything to me as well as my family.

A year ago, I found out that I ran out of financial aid options for the graduate program, but I did not let that stop me. I have been paying tuition on my own for the program. I continue to work full-time, however, I just do not have enough funds to pay for the rest of my tuition. 

Asking for help is not easy for me, and this is a last-ditch attempt to succeed, not only in finishing the MFA program (which I'm still working towards diligently), but also to publish my book, "How Do I Explain This To My Kids." The book is not just about a stressed out single mom who raises four kids, but about how we made the best of potentially bad situations and how we fell between the cracks, which many people do today. The book is a unique view on the world and how to survive in spite of many obstacles.

I want to show my kids that it is never too late to achieve your goals. Because of this, I'm wiling to do whatever it takes to make this happen. I will finally be able to say I finished the program as well as my thesis (my book).

As a part-time student in the MFA Program, I took two classes a semester. Each class costs $2,100 ($700 per credit, which is average for any accredited graduate program). I only need $1,560 to raech my goal!

The MFA in Writing has helped me build a career as a published author. I know it takes hard work and perseverance, and I'm ready for that. My goal is to eventually transition from my current day job into writing full-time for a living.

If I don't reach my financial goal, I will put all funds towards my tuition and continue paying for the balance due on my own as best I can. Right now, I'm working on my thesis while holding down a full-time job. If I could work a second job, I would, however, that is not possible right now.

Knowledge is power and no one can take that away from you. It's an experience of a lifetime. My belief is that all people deserve the opportunity of education. In today's world, it's more difficult than ever for students and their parents to pay for a good education. Luckily, community colleges still offer lower cost options, but four-year colleges and graduate programs are so expensive that it's almost an unreachable goal for people. 

Although financial aid is available for graduate programs, one can only go so far with student loans without going into deep debt. Good writers who help people cope with life are needed more than ever. The best thing we can do is help each other. 

Those of you who assist in making my dream come true will receive an autographed copy of my book, "How Do I Explain This To My Kids" and my gratitude. I also promise to "pay it forward."

Right now, the only thing standing in my way of finishing the MFA program and my book is paying the rest of my tuition. I am very close to being done. I still have to take one elective over the summer, but the light is already at the end of the tunnel. 

I know that some of you are struggling just to make ends meet. That's okay. I understand more than you know. My book is all about that. Please forward this to anyone you know who might be able to help. Every little bit counts. Check out the Indiegogo share tools.

Thanks for reading this. You rock!

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Tim Almeida, a.k.a. Tim Will Hunting. Yes, I named myself that.
  • I am trying to fund the independent publication of my 1st book, The Custodian Chronicles, based on my experiences inside the public school system as a Custodian, and what I think needs to change in order to improve the chances of survival for future generations. Plus, you will laugh, a lot. 
  • Every writer dreams of bringing their work to life, and by helping me here you are truly contributing to making one of my life dreams come true.  Eternal thanks from a humble and insecure soon-to-be, author.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I am hoping to raise $2000.00. This will cover my costs for a full line edit of the manuscript, inside and outside book design, marketing, printing and also conversion of the book to Kindle format.
  • Any money raised will go towards funding the publishing of the book.
  • In all seriousness, the book has validity to it.  The public school system needs serious help and the only narrative we ever hear comes from either bureaucratic agencies, administrations, school boards, and government.
  • Custodians see things for how they really are, from a birds eye view, and I am presenting that view here, in this work.
  • I don't believe you will be disappointed.

Risks & Challenges

  • There is always risk involved, the major one being that people are not interested enough in the topic(s) I am covering, but I can assure you that the words in this book are valuable to all of us, as they speak out and up in defense of our children and their struggles inside the school setting.  
  • I will re-work the edit on the book if it calls for it, and I will not settle until the content within resonates with as many readers as possible.  Consistency and resiliency, my two strongest assets.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute monetarily, the best way you can help is by simply sharing my campaign and also subscribing to my podcast, "The Custodian Chronicles," as well as following and sharing all my social media platforms.  This truly is the best way to get the word out and helps in such an immense way. Thank you so much!! Me love you long time!

story:
Who I am
To talk about himself is always difficult, but I think that the things to know about a photographer are quite a few ... The best way to know a photographer is ... look at his photos.
Born in 1981, I am passionate about photography since the age of 5 years when I started taking my first photos with my mothers’s old Agfa Agfamatic 126 of 1969.
At 13 years I bought my first SLR camera, a Yashica 108 MP, which I used until 2003, when I moved to digital out of curiosity, convenience and significant cost savings.
The picture usually is and will remain my greatest passion, but what I prefer the most are the travel report and in particular the portraits.
When I visit a place with my trusted cameras atm y neck, I look at everything with different eyes, they are more attentive and critical ... I'm looking for "the shot". I'm like a child who sees for the first time an object or a place, and with the simplicity and ingenuity that characterizes a child I want to know everything and every nuance around him.
July 2, 2012 I inaugurated my first photo exhibition entitled "Nepal Life" at Circolo Eridano in Turin.

On October 2013 I inaugurated my second photographic exhibition , « Berlin Calling », always at the Circolo Eridano of Turin.

On September 2014 I published my first photographic book “Emotions from Ethiopia”. It's a book containing more than 400 photographs done during my travel in Ethiopia between February and March 2014.

My project

Between February and March I travelled three weeks all around Ethiopia. In this way I could discover and appreciate this fantastic country that gave me more than 6000 photographs. From them

I chose the best to publish my first book called “Emotions from Ethiopia”.

After turning the pages of my book that has been just printed I desired to be involved in a new adventure. This time in a much more specific project: to go to Eritrea for a photographic service about the only railway of the country between Asmara and Massaua. On my return I will publish a book.

I'll take a series of shots in order to describe in the best way this train that cross very beautiful and charming places. I'll take this train to testify the trip of the inhabitants of these lands. I'll go in search of portraits and people “in situation” (the photographs I like the best).

I became convinced to come again into the play with a new project when I met my idol concerning photographs: Steve McCurry. He examined my book, he found it interesting and well done and he wrote a dedication to me on the first page (as you can see in the photo).

In the photo appear Steve McCurry, my book “Emotions from Ethiopia” and I.

How do I intend to use the amount?

I'll use the amount to cover the travel expenses (flight ticket, local guide, car rent, hotel, etc.). I'll cover also the expenses for the realization and printing of the copies I'll give to people who bought 10 quotas, photograph print and shipment of all objects to people who contributed to the realization of my project.

1 quota  → A photograph of your choice sent by email.
3 quotas  → A photo of your choice printed on 20x30 shipped to your home address.
5 quotas  → Three photos of your choice printed on 20x30 shipped to your home address.
7 quotas  → One typical object brought from Eritrea and shipped to your home address.

10 quotas → the book shipped to your home address.

If I exceed the amount requested ?

If I collect all the money necessary for my project, the surplus will be devolved to un orphanage I visited when I was in Ethiopia: the OMO CHILD of Jinka. This orphanage has been created by Lale Labuko. An article concerning it appeared in National Geographic of December 2013. Steve McCurry too talk about this institution in his website ( http://stevemccurry.wordpress.com/2012/10/02/to-save-a-child-3/ ).

For further information this is their site:

http://omochild.org/

My photo of children of Omo Child orphanage. 


Obviously I'll send by mail the receipt of the donation to the Omo Child orphanage to all people who contributed to my project.

If the amount isn't reached?

If unfortunately the amount isn't reached, I can't leave for Eritrea and do my photographic project, but people who trusted in me will be rewarded in this way:

1 quota → A photograph of your choice sent by email.
3 quotas → A photo of your choice printed on 20x30 shipped to your home address.
5 quotas  → Three photos of your choice printed on 20x30 shipped to your home address.
7 quotas  → Five photos of your choice printed on 20x30 shipped to your home address.

10 quotas  → the book “Emotions from Ethiopia” shipped to your home address.

Informations

For any further information:

Email: simone.migliaro@gmail.com

Web Site: www.simonemigliaro.it

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/SimoneMigliaroPhotographer

Linkedin: http://www.linkedin.com/pub/simone-migliaro/3b/706/610

Chi sono
Parlare di se stessi è sempre difficile, ma credo che le cose da sapere di un fotografo siano ben poche… Il miglior modo di conoscere un fotografo è… guardare le sue fotografie.
Classe 1981, sono appassionato di fotografia dall’età di 5 anni quando ho iniziato a scattare le mie prime fotografie con una vecchia Agfa Agfamatic 126 del 1969 di mia madre.
A 13 anni ho acquistato la mia prima reflex, una Yashica 108 MP, che ho utilizzato fino al 2003, quando sono approdato al digitale per curiosità, comodità e notevole risparmio economico.
La fotografia in genere è e rimarrà la mia più grande passione, ma la cosa che più preferisco sono i reportage di viaggio ed in particolare i ritratti.
Quando visito un posto con al collo una delle mie fidate macchine fotografiche guardo tutto con occhi diversi, sono più attento e critico… Sono in cerca “dello scatto”. Sono come un bambino che vede per la prima volta un oggetto o un luogo e con la semplicità e l’ingenuità che contraddistingue un bambino voglio scoprire tutto e ogni sfumatura di questo tutto.
Il 2 luglio 2012 ho inaugurato la mia prima mostra fotografica dal titolo “Nepal Life” presso il Circolo Eridano di Torino.

Ad ottobre 2013 ho inaugurato la mia seconda mostra fotografica dal titolo “Berlin Calling” sempre presso il Circolo Eridano di Torino.

A settembre 2014 ho pubblicato il mio primo libro fotografico dal titolo “Emotions from Ethiopia”. È un libro che contiene più di 400 fotografie che ho scattato in occasione del mio viaggio in Etiopia tra febbraio e marzo 2014.

Il progetto
Tra febbraio e marzo 2014 sono stato 3 settimane in Etiopia ed ho potuto scoprire ed assaporare questo paese fantastico che mi ha regalato più di 6000 fotografie dalle quali ho cercato di estrarre le migliori per pubblicare il mio primo libro dal titolo “Emotions from Ethiopia”.

Poco dopo aver sfogliato il mio libro appena stampato mi è venuta voglia di rimettermi di nuovo in gioco con una nuova avventura. Questa volta con un progetto molto più specifico e cioè andare in Eritrea a fare un servizio fotografico sull'unica linea ferroviaria del paese tra Asmara e Massaua per poi pubblicare un libro al mio ritorno.

Farò una serie di scatti per cercare di descrivere al meglio questo treno che attraversa zone molto belle ed affascinanti. Prenderò il treno per testimoniare il viaggio dei locali e nella ricerca di ritratti e figure ambientate (sono le mie foto preferite).

La spinta a rimettermi in gioco con un altro progetto è nata anche dopo che ho avuto la fortuna di incontrare il mio idolo, fotograficamente parlando, Steve McCurry. Il quale ha sfogliato il mio libro e mi ha lasciato una bella dedica all'interno (come potete vedere dalla foto).


Nella fotografia siamo io, McCurry ed il mio libro “Emotions from Ethiopia”.

Per cosa userò le quote?

Le quote mi serviranno per coprire le spese del viaggio e cioè biglietto aereo, guida locale, affitto auto, hotel, ecc.

Con le quote coprirò anche le spese di realizzazione e stampa delle copie del libro da dare a chi ha comprato 10 quote, la stampa delle fotografie e la spedizione di tutti gli oggetti a chi ha contribuito alla realizzazione di questo mio progetto.

Quote

1 quota  → Una fotografia a scelta spedita via mail.
3 quote → Una fotografia a scelta stampata in formato 20x30 spedita a casa
5 quote → Tre fotografie a scelta stampate in formato 20x30 e spedite a casa
7 quote → Un manufatto tipico portato dall'Eritrea spedito a casa

10 quote → Il libro spedito a casa

Se viene superata la cifra richiesta?

Nel caso in cui riesca a raccogliere i soldi necessari per il mio progetto, tutti i soldi che raccoglierò oltre tale cifra li devolverò ad un orfanotrofio che ho visitato quando ero in Etiopia. Si tratta dell'OMO CHILD di Jinka.

Questo orfanotrofio è stato aperto da Lale Labuko. Ne parlano sul National Geographic di dicembre 2013, ne parla Steve McCurry sul suo sito ( http://stevemccurry.wordpress.com/2012/10/02/to-save-a-child-3/ ).

Per maggiori informazioni questo è il loro sito:

http://omochild.org/

Una foto che ho scattato all'orfanotrofio Omo Child.


Ovviamente manderò via mail la ricevuta a tutte le persone che hanno contribuito al mio progetto dell'avvenuta donazione all'Omo Child.

Se non viene raggiunta la cifra richiesta?

Se purtroppo la cifra da me richiesta non verrà raggiunta, non potrò partire per l'Eritrea e fare il mio progetto fotografico, ma chi avrà creduto ugualmente in me è giusto che sia ricompensato ed ho pensato di farlo in questo modo:

1 quota → Una fotografia a scelta spedita via mail.
3 quote → Una fotografia a scelta stampata in formato 20x30 spedita a casa
5 quote → Tre fotografie a scelta stampate in formato 20x30 e spedite a casa
7 quote → Cinque fotografie a scelta stampate in formato 20x30 e spedite a casa

10 quote → Il libro “Emotions from Ethiopia” spedito a casa

Informazioni

Per qualsiasi informazione:

E-mail: simone.migliaro@gmail.com

Sito internet: www.simonemigliaro.it

Pagina Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/SimoneMigliaroPhotographer

Profilo Linkedin: http://www.linkedin.com/pub/simone-migliaro/3b/706/610

Qui suis-je
Parler de soi est toujours difficile, mais je pense que les choses qu’il faut connaître au sujet d’un photographe sont très peu nombreuses... La meilleure façon de connaître un photographe est ... regarder ses photos.
Né en 1981, je suis passionné de photographie depuis l'âge de 5 ans quand j'ai commencé à prendre mes premières photos avec un vieux Agfa Agfamatic 126 de 1969 de ma mère.
À 13 ans, j'ai acheté mon premier appareil reflex, un Yashica 108 MP, que j'ai utilisé jusqu'en 2003, quand j'ai opté pour le numérique par curiosité, commodité et pour réaliser d'importantes économies.
La photo en général est et restera ma plus grande passion, mais ce que je préfère sont les reportages de voyage, en particulier les portraits.
Lorsque je visite un endroit avec l’une de mes caméras au cou je vois tout avec des yeux différents, mon regard est plus attentif et critique… Je suis à la recherche de la photo. Je suis comme un enfant qui voit pour la première fois un objet ou un lieu, et avec la simplicité et la naïveté qui le caractérise, je veux tout savoir et capter toutes les nuances.
Le 2 juillet 2012 j’ai inauguré ma première exposition photo intitulée “Nepal Life” auprès du Circolo Eridano de Turin.

En octobre 2013 j'ai inauguré ma deuxième exposition de photos, « Berlin Calling », toujours auprès du Circolo Eridano de Turin.

En septembre 2014 j'ai publié mon premier livre photographique, “Emotions from Ethiopia”. Il s'agit d'un livre contenant plus de 400 photos que j'ai faites en occasion de mon voyage en Ethiopie entre février et mars 2014.

Mon projet

Entre février et mars 2014 j'ai été trois semaines en Ethiopie . En cette occasion j'ai pu découvrir et savourer ce pays fantastique qui m'a fait cadeau de plus de 6000 photographies desquelles j'ai essayé d'extraire les meilleures afin de publier mon premier livre intitulé “Emotions from Ethiopia”.

Peu après avoir feuilleté mon livre qui venait de sortir j'ai eu envie de me remettre en jeu avec une nouvelle aventure. Cette fois avc un projet beaucoup plus spécifique à savoir aller en Erythrée pour faire un reportage photographique sur l'unique ligne de chemin de fer du pays entre Asmara et Massaouah pour publier ensuite un livre à mon retour.

Je compte faire une série de photos pour essayer de décrire le mieux possible ce train qui traverse des zones très belles et riches en charme. Je prendrai ce train pour témoigner du voyage des habitants de ces lieux . J'irai à la recherche de portraits et de personnes mises en situation (ce sont mes photos préférées).

Ce qui m'a poussé à me remettre en jeu par un autre projet a été mon heureuse rencontre avec mon photographe idole, Steve McCurry. Il a examiné mon livre et à la fin il m'a fait une dédicace à l'intérieur (comme on peut voir dans la photo).

Dans la photo paraissent Steve McCurry, moi et mon livre “Emotions from Ethiopia”.

Comment utiliserai-je les cotisations?

Les cotisations serviront à couvrir les frais du voyage à savoir le ticket d'avion, le guide local, l'hotel où je descendrai et tout ce qui sera nécessaire.

Elles serviront aussi à couvrir les frais de réalisation et d'impression des copies du livre que recevront tous ceux qui ont acheté 10 quotes-parts, l'impression des photos et l'envoi de tous les objets à ceux qui ont contribué à la réalisation de mon projet.

Quotas

1 quota  → Une photographie de votre choix par courriel.
3 quotas → Une photo de votre choix imprimée (format 20x30) et envoyée chez vous par la poste.
5 quotas → Trois photos de votre choix imprimées (format 20x30) et envoyées chez vous par la poste.
7 quotas → Un objet typique emporté d'Erythrée et envoyé à domicile.

10 quotas→ Photobook envoyé chez vous par la poste.

Si le chiffre demandé est dépassé?

Au cas où je réussirais à recueillir tout l'argent nécessaire pour mon projet, le surplus je le donnerai à un orphelinat que j'ai visité pendant mon voyage en Ethiopie. Il s'agit de l'OMO CHILD de Jinka. Il a été ouvert par Lale Labuko. On en parle dans un article paru dans National Geographic de décembre 2013. Steve McCurry aussi en parle dans son site (http://stevemccurry.wordpress.com/2012/10/02/to-save-a-child-3/ ).

Pour avoir plus de renseignements aller au site:

http://omochild.org/

Une de mes photos aux enfants de l'orphelinat Omo Child.


Naturellement j'enverrai via mail le récépissé de la donation à Omo Child à tous ceux qui ont contribué à mon projet.

Si on n'atteint pas le chiffre que j'ai demandé?

Si malheureusement le chiffre que j'ai demandé n'est pas atteint je ne pourrai pas partir en Erythrée et achever mon projet photographique, mais il est juste que qui a cru en moi soit recompensé. J'ai pensé le faire en cette manière:

1 quote → Une photo au choix envoyée via mail

3 quotes → Une photo au choix imprimée format 20x30 envoyée à domicile

5 quotes → Trois photos au choix imprimées format 20x30 envoyées à domicile

7 quotes → Cinq photos au choix imprimées format 20x30 envoyées à domicile

10 quotes → Livre “Emotions from Ethiopia” envoyé à domicile.

Informations

Pour plus d’informations:

Courriel: simone.migliaro@gmail.com

Sito internet: www.simonemigliaro.it

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/SimoneMigliaroPhotographer

Linkedin: http://www.linkedin.com/pub/simone-migliaro/3b/706/610

September 2014 I published my first photographic book “Emotions
from Ethiopia”. It's a book containing more than 400 photographs
done during my travel in Ethiopia between February and March 2014.


My
project

Between
February and March I travelled three weeks all around Ethiopia. In
this way I could discover and appreciate this fantastic country that
gave me more than 6000 photographs. From them 


I
chose the best to publish my first book called “Emotions from
Ethiopia”.

After
turning the pages of my book that has been just printed I desired to
be involved in a new adventure. This time in a much more specific
project: to go to Eritrea for a photographic
service about the only railway of the country between Asmara and
Massaua. On my return I will publish a book.

I'll
take a series of shots in order to describe in the best way this
train that cross very beautiful and charming places. I'll take this
train to testify the trip of the inhabitants of these lands. I'll go
in search of portraits and people “in situation”  (the
photographs I like the best). 


I
became convinced to come again into the play with a new project when
I met my idol concerning photographs: Steve McCurry. He examined my
book, he found it interesting and well done and he wrote a dedication
to me on the first page (as you can see in the photo).
In
the photo appear Steve McCurry, my book “Emotions from Ethiopia”
and I.



How
do I intend to use the amount?

I'll
use the amount to cover the travel expenses (flight ticket, local
guide, car rent, hotel, etc.). I'll cover also the expenses for the
realization and printing of the copies I'll give to people who bought
10 quotas,
photograph print and shipment of all objects to people who
contributed to the realization of my project.


1
quota  → A photograph of your choice sent by email.3
quotas  → A photo of your choice printed on 20x30 shipped to
your home address.5 quotas  → Three photos of your
choice printed on 20x30 shipped to your home address.7 quotas  → One
typical object brought from Eritrea and shipped to your home address.

10
quotas → the book shipped to your home address. 




If
I exceed the amount requested ?

If
I collect all the money necessary for my project, the surplus will be
devolved to un orphanage I visited when I was in Ethiopia: the OMO
CHILD of Jinka. This orphanage has been created by Lale Labuko. An
article concerning it appeared in National Geographic of December
2013. Steve McCurry too talk about this institution in his website (
http://stevemccurry.wordpress.com/2012/10/02/to-save-a-child-3/
).

For
further information this is their site:

http://omochild.org/My photo of children of Omo Child orphanage. Obviously
I'll send by mail the receipt of the donation to the Omo Child
orphanage to all people who contributed to my project.



If
the amount  isn't reached?

If
unfortunately the amount isn't reached, I can't leave for Eritrea and
do my photographic project, but people who trusted in me will be
rewarded in this way:


1
quota → A photograph of your choice sent by email.3
quotas → A photo of your choice printed on 20x30 shipped to
your home address.5 quotas  → Three photos of your
choice printed on 20x30 shipped to your home address.7 quotas  → Five photos of your choice printed on 20x30 shipped to
your home address.

10
quotas  → the book “Emotions from Ethiopia” shipped to
your home address. 




InformationsFor
any further information:Email: simone.migliaro@gmail.comWeb
Site: www.simonemigliaro.itFacebook: https://www.facebook.com/SimoneMigliaroPhotographerLinkedin: http://www.linkedin.com/pub/simone-migliaro/3b/706/610





Chi
sonoParlare
di se stessi è sempre difficile, ma credo che le cose da sapere di
un fotografo siano ben poche… Il miglior modo di conoscere un
fotografo è… guardare le sue fotografie.Classe
1981, sono appassionato di fotografia dall’età di 5 anni quando ho
iniziato a scattare le mie prime fotografie con una vecchia Agfa
Agfamatic 126 del 1969 di mia madre.A
13 anni ho acquistato la mia prima reflex, una Yashica 108 MP, che ho
utilizzato fino al 2003, quando sono approdato al digitale per
curiosità, comodità e notevole risparmio economico.La
fotografia in genere è e rimarrà la mia più grande passione, ma la
cosa che più preferisco sono i reportage di viaggio ed in
particolare i ritratti.Quando
visito un posto con al collo una delle mie fidate macchine
fotografiche guardo tutto con occhi diversi, sono più attento e
critico… Sono in cerca “dello scatto”. Sono come un bambino che
vede per la prima volta un oggetto o un luogo e con la semplicità e
l’ingenuità che contraddistingue un bambino voglio scoprire tutto
e ogni sfumatura di questo tutto.Il
2 luglio 2012 ho inaugurato la mia prima mostra fotografica dal
titolo “Nepal Life” presso il Circolo Eridano di Torino.

Ad
ottobre 2013 ho inaugurato la mia seconda mostra fotografica dal
titolo “Berlin Calling” sempre presso il Circolo Eridano di
Torino. 


A
settembre 2014 ho pubblicato il mio primo libro fotografico dal
titolo “Emotions from Ethiopia”. È un libro che contiene più di
400 fotografie che ho scattato in occasione del mio viaggio in
Etiopia tra febbraio e marzo 2014.



Il
progettoTra
febbraio e marzo 2014 sono stato 3 settimane in Etiopia ed ho potuto
scoprire ed assaporare questo paese fantastico che mi ha regalato più
di 6000 fotografie dalle quali ho cercato di estrarre le migliori per
pubblicare il mio primo libro dal titolo “Emotions from Ethiopia”.

Poco
dopo aver sfogliato il mio libro appena stampato mi è venuta voglia
di rimettermi di nuovo in gioco con una nuova avventura. Questa volta
con un progetto molto più specifico e cioè andare in Eritrea a fare
un servizio fotografico sull'unica linea ferroviaria del paese tra
Asmara e Massaua per poi pubblicare un libro al mio ritorno.

Farò
una serie di scatti per cercare di descrivere al meglio questo treno
che attraversa zone molto belle ed affascinanti. Prenderò il treno
per testimoniare il viaggio dei locali e nella ricerca di ritratti e
figure ambientate (sono le mie foto preferite).

La
spinta a rimettermi in gioco con un altro progetto è nata anche dopo
che ho avuto la fortuna di incontrare il mio idolo, fotograficamente
parlando, Steve McCurry. Il quale ha sfogliato il mio libro e mi ha
lasciato una bella dedica all'interno (come potete vedere dalla
foto). 


Nella
fotografia siamo io, McCurry ed il mio libro “Emotions from
Ethiopia”. 



Per
cosa userò le quote?

Le
quote mi serviranno per coprire le spese del viaggio e cioè
biglietto aereo, guida locale, affitto auto, hotel, ecc.

Con
le quote coprirò anche le spese di realizzazione e stampa delle
copie del libro da dare a chi ha comprato 10 quote, la stampa delle
fotografie e la spedizione di tutti gli oggetti a chi ha contribuito
alla realizzazione di questo mio progetto. 



Quote1
quota  → Una fotografia a scelta spedita via mail.3
quote → Una fotografia a scelta stampata in formato 20x30
spedita a casa5
quote → Tre fotografie a scelta stampate in formato 20x30 e
spedite a casa7
quote → Un manufatto tipico portato dall'Eritrea spedito a
casa

10
quote → Il libro spedito a casa



Se
viene superata la cifra richiesta?

Nel
caso in cui riesca a raccogliere i soldi necessari per il mio
progetto, tutti i soldi che raccoglierò oltre tale cifra li
devolverò ad un orfanotrofio che ho visitato quando ero in Etiopia.
Si tratta dell'OMO CHILD di Jinka. 


Questo
orfanotrofio è stato aperto da Lale Labuko. Ne parlano sul National
Geographic di dicembre 2013, ne parla Steve McCurry sul suo sito (
http://stevemccurry.wordpress.com/2012/10/02/to-save-a-child-3/
).

Per
maggiori informazioni questo è il loro sito:


http://omochild.org/Una foto che ho scattato all'orfanotrofio Omo Child.


Ovviamente
manderò via mail la ricevuta a tutte le persone che hanno
contribuito al mio progetto dell'avvenuta donazione all'Omo Child.


Se
non viene raggiunta la cifra richiesta?

Se
purtroppo la cifra da me richiesta non verrà raggiunta, non potrò
partire per l'Eritrea e fare il mio progetto fotografico, ma chi avrà
creduto ugualmente in me è giusto che sia ricompensato ed ho pensato
di farlo in questo modo: 



1
quota → Una fotografia a scelta spedita via mail.3
quote → Una fotografia a scelta stampata in formato 20x30
spedita a casa5
quote → Tre fotografie a scelta stampate in formato 20x30 e
spedite a casa7
quote → Cinque  fotografie a scelta stampate in formato
20x30 e spedite a casa

10
quote → Il libro “Emotions from Ethiopia” spedito a
casa



InformazioniPer
qualsiasi informazione:E-mail:
simone.migliaro@gmail.comSito
internet: www.simonemigliaro.itPagina
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/SimoneMigliaroPhotographerProfilo
Linkedin: http://www.linkedin.com/pub/simone-migliaro/3b/706/610




Qui
suis-jeParler
de soi est toujours difficile, mais je pense que les choses qu’il
faut connaître au sujet d’un photographe sont très peu
nombreuses... La meilleure façon de connaître un photographe est
... regarder ses photos.Né en 1981, je suis passionné de
photographie depuis l'âge de 5 ans quand j'ai commencé à prendre
mes premières photos avec un vieux Agfa Agfamatic 126 de 1969 de ma
mère.À 13 ans, j'ai acheté mon premier appareil reflex, un
Yashica 108 MP, que j'ai utilisé jusqu'en 2003, quand j'ai opté
pour le numérique par curiosité, commodité et pour réaliser
d'importantes économies.La photo en général est et restera ma
plus grande passion, mais ce que je préfère sont les reportages de
voyage, en particulier les portraits.Lorsque je visite un endroit
avec l’une de mes caméras au cou je vois tout avec des yeux
différents, mon regard est plus attentif et critique… Je suis à
la recherche de la photo. Je suis comme un enfant qui voit pour la
première fois un objet ou un lieu, et avec la simplicité et la
naïveté qui le caractérise, je veux tout savoir et capter toutes
les nuances.Le 2 juillet 2012 j’ai inauguré ma première
exposition photo intitulée “Nepal Life” auprès du Circolo
Eridano de Turin.

En
octobre 2013 j'ai inauguré ma deuxième exposition de photos,
« Berlin Calling », toujours auprès du Circolo Eridano
de Turin.

En
septembre 2014 j'ai publié mon premier livre photographique,
“Emotions from Ethiopia”. Il s'agit d'un livre contenant plus de
400 photos que j'ai faites en occasion de mon voyage en Ethiopie
entre février et mars 2014.


Mon
projet

Entre
février et mars 2014 j'ai été trois semaines en Ethiopie . En
cette occasion j'ai pu découvrir et savourer  ce pays fantastique
qui m'a fait cadeau de plus de 6000 photographies desquelles j'ai
essayé d'extraire les meilleures afin de publier mon premier livre
intitulé “Emotions from Ethiopia”.

Peu
après avoir feuilleté mon livre qui venait de sortir j'ai eu envie
de me remettre en jeu avec une nouvelle aventure. Cette fois avc un
projet  beaucoup plus spécifique à savoir aller en Erythrée pour
faire un reportage photographique  sur l'unique ligne de chemin de
fer du pays entre Asmara et Massaouah pour publier ensuite un livre à
mon retour.

Je
compte faire une série de photos pour essayer de décrire le mieux
possible ce train qui traverse  des zones très belles et riches en
charme. Je prendrai ce train  pour témoigner du voyage  des
habitants de ces lieux . J'irai à la recherche  de portraits et de
personnes mises en situation (ce sont mes photos préférées).

Ce
qui m'a poussé à me remettre en jeu  par un autre projet a été
mon heureuse rencontre avec mon photographe idole, Steve McCurry. Il
a examiné mon livre et à la fin il m'a fait une dédicace à
l'intérieur (comme on peut voir dans la photo).Dans
la photo paraissent Steve McCurry, moi et mon livre “Emotions from
Ethiopia”.


Comment
utiliserai-je les cotisations?

Les
cotisations serviront à couvrir les frais  du voyage à savoir le
ticket d'avion, le guide local, l'hotel où je descendrai et tout ce
qui sera nécessaire.

Elles
serviront aussi à couvrir les frais de réalisation et d'impression
des copies du livre que recevront tous ceux qui ont acheté 10
quotes-parts, l'impression des photos et l'envoi de tous les objets à
ceux qui ont contribué à la réalisation de mon projet.



Quotas1
quota  → Une photographie de votre choix par courriel.3
quotas → Une photo de votre choix imprimée (format 20x30)
et envoyée chez vous par la poste.5 quotas → Trois
photos de votre choix imprimées (format 20x30) et envoyées chez
vous par la poste.7 quotas → Un objet typique emporté
d'Erythrée et envoyé à domicile.10
quotas→ Photobook envoyé chez vous par la poste.



Si
le chiffre demandé est dépassé?

Au
cas où je réussirais à recueillir tout l'argent nécessaire pour
mon projet, le surplus je le donnerai à un orphelinat que j'ai
visité pendant mon voyage en Ethiopie. Il s'agit de l'OMO CHILD de
Jinka. Il a été ouvert par Lale Labuko. On en parle dans un article
paru dans National Geographic de décembre 2013. Steve McCurry aussi
en parle dans son site
(http://stevemccurry.wordpress.com/2012/10/02/to-save-a-child-3/
).

Pour
avoir plus de renseignements aller au site:

http://omochild.org/Une de mes photos aux enfants de l'orphelinat Omo Child.


Naturellement
j'enverrai via mail le récépissé de la donation à Omo Child à
tous ceux qui ont contribué à mon projet.


Si
on n'atteint pas le chiffre que j'ai demandé?

Si
malheureusement le chiffre que j'ai demandé n'est pas atteint je ne
pourrai pas partir en Erythrée et achever mon projet photographique,
mais il est juste que qui a cru en moi soit recompensé. J'ai pensé
le faire en cette manière:

1
quote → Une photo au choix envoyée via mail

3
quotes → Une photo au choix imprimée format 20x30 envoyée à
domicile

5
quotes → Trois photos au choix imprimées format 20x30
envoyées à domicile

7
quotes → Cinq photos au choix imprimées format 20x30
envoyées à domicile

10
quotes → Livre “Emotions from Ethiopia” envoyé à
domicile.



InformationsPour
plus d’informations:Courriel:
simone.migliaro@gmail.comSito
internet: www.simonemigliaro.itFacebook: https://www.facebook.com/SimoneMigliaroPhotographerLinkedin: http://www.linkedin.com/pub/simone-migliaro/3b/706/610

story:
A Tale Of Curses and Growth

The art of VolkenFox and writing of Mickey Bamboo will be joined together in this  illustrated story of Andrew, an affluent wolf whose narcissism and wealth has gotten him everything he always wanted, until his family sees that he has gone too far. Now that he is lined up to be the figurehead of the family business, his relatives change reality itself into order to keep him from ruining everything they had spent their lives building. Now left with his reality changing him from a spoiled socialite to a massive mutt-child who is more obsessed with his own geeky desires than pursuing anything beyond his own selfish interests, Andrew is faced with the growing realization that his new identity is taking over completely.

What We Need & What You Get

We believe with at least $500, we can bring you a solid illustrated story featuring male transformation and weight gain which includes the additional themes that the community chose when we first proposed this idea. Using $500, we will be able to bring you a story of at least 10,000 words and 5 illustrations or more. Stretch goals are also included, so as we receive additional funds beyond the initial goal, we will continue to "fatten" the word count, "swell" the amount of illustrations, and "expand" the breadth of how far Andrew’s transformations shall go.

Contributors of five dollars or more will receive an advanced copy of the illustrated story upon completion. Approximately one month later, we will release the e-book for sale to the general public.

Stretch Goals

Our stretch goals include the following:

  • $800 - The story will be at least 20,000 words and 8 illustrations, and a second character’s transformation will be included in the story.  

  • $1,000 - The story will expand further to be at least 25, 000 words and 10 illustrations.

Further stretch goals will be added should we fulfill the current list.

Challenges

Considering how many words and illustrations we will be providing, this project will be a large undertaking. While we feel we can handle this workload, as Volkenfox has already posted multiple E-Books already and Mickey has numerous stories completed and available to read online, timeliness will still be the biggest factor we need to consider. If we just fall short of our goal, we will try to bring you an abridged version of our story nonetheless.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone can afford to contribute, and that's all right! You can still help us out by spreading the word to your friends.

story:
Announcing a Stretch Goal

We hit our target of $5000! Any additional funds raised between now and the close of the campaign at midnight tonight will go entirely to fund the authors (over and above the monies we've already raised for their author's fees). So keep giving. It'll directly support folks who write you this sexy stuff.


Short Summary

At the Erotic Reading Circle, held at San Francisco's Center for Sex and Culture, writers have gathered every week since 2006 to share stories of desire and longing in a supportive and fun community setting. In this space, writing that tangles with the joys and complexities of sex is celebrated rather than dismissed as "easy" or worthy of less respect than other genres or topics.  We believe that there should be more erotic writing in the world, not less, so that readers have access to a wider, more realistic, more human array of erotic expression -- and to this end, we asked Erotic Reading Circle participants to share with us contributions to a new anthology, entitled Sex Still Spoken Here (in honor of the first Erotic Reading Circle anthology, Sex Spoken Here, published in 1997 by Down There Press). And now we need your help to get Sex Still Spoken Here into the hands of readers!

  • The book includes writing from 27 writers, a conversation among the editors about the history of the Erotic Reading Circle and the use of sex-positive writing spaces for new and developed erotic writers, and a how-to guide for those who want to bring an Erotic Reading Circle to their own communities!
  • Contributors include Sinclair Sexsmith, horehound stillpoint, Seeley Quest, Simone Corday, Jeff Jacobson, Avery Cassell, Dorothy Freed, Scott Bentley, C.J. Schneider, Anáin Bjorquist, Christine Solano, Lilycat, Jack Fritscher, Norman Armstrong, Holly Zwalf and more!
  • Editors are Dr. Carol Queen (Erotic Reading Circle co-facilitator and founder of the Center for Sex and Culture in San Francisco), Jen Cross (Erotic Reading Circle co-facilitator and founder of Writing Ourselves Whole in Oakland) and Amy Butcher (Erotic Reading Circle participant and author of Paws for Consideration).

What We Need & What You Get

  • Our goal is to raise $5000 for printing costs and author fees
  • Your donations will get you, first and foremost, the undying appreciation and adoration from SSSH's editors and authors! We will tweet or facebook your name for the world to see! You will be supporting the power of erotic expression and community! You could also receive copies of the anthology (e-book or print), or bread that's been handmade lovingly by our editor Jen Cross, or even your own private erotic reading in your own home!
  • If we *don't* make the full $5000, we will pay the authors first!
  • How does it breakdown? The money donated will go in this order: 1/3 to the authors, 1/3 to production, 1/3 to support the fledgling publishing venture Center for Sex & Culture Press. See more details here:


The Impact

  • When you donate, you support this mission and help us get these writers' words in front of readers who need them!
  • Every month, the Center for Sex and Culture's Erotic Reading Circle is packed with gorgeously dirty words, generous community, and writing that deepens our understanding of the word "erotic." 
  • You'll give others the courage and know-how to start their own Erotic Reading Circles in their home towns by using the bonus section of the book that describes how to run an Erotic Reading Circle.

Risks & Challenges

  • We are a small team of volunteers -- yet another reason that we are so grateful for your support and help in increasing the reach of this campaign!
  • We might encounter misunderstanding or backlash against this project's erotic content -- should that happen here on indiegogo, we will be in touch with all contributors and supporters to let you know where the campaign has moved!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us to spread the word about the Erotic Reading Circle's Anthology and this campaign!

  • Honestly: Every dollar helps -- if you've got a buck to spare, we would love to adore you publicly on social media!
  • Tweet or Facebook the campaign link to your friends and communities!
  • And don't forget that you can use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Know that we are already thanking you from the bottoms of our writerly hearts!

story:
saltfront is a journal for a radically new type of ecological storytelling. We are a group of artists from the Environmental Humanities Department at the University of Utah searching for the newest and most vibrant eco-lyrical expressions, the new ways to tell stories of what it means to be human amidst the monumental ecological transformations taking place on this planet.

We want to tell many kinds of stories, the stories of deserts and salt lakes and religious pioneers and inner city vegetable gardens, cat and dog stories, garbage and compost stories. We want to tell the stories of people in cities and on farms, of people who wander through disrupted landscapes and wonder where this all ends up.  

With this small amount we can fund a non-profit organization and offer our first issue containing the latest ideas and stories and new ways of imagining ourselves as not just gas-guzzlers and moon-goers, but as earth-bound primates, still weird and wonderful creatures capable of surprise.

saltfront is a journal for a radically new type of ecological storytelling. We are a group of artists from the Environmental Humanities Department at the University of Utah searching for the newest and most vibrant eco-lyrical expressions, the new ways to tell stories of what it means to be human amidst the monumental ecological transformations taking place on this planet.
We want to tell many kinds of stories, the stories of deserts and salt lakes and religious pioneers and inner city vegetable gardens, cat and dog stories, garbage and compost stories. We want to tell the stories of people in cities and on farms, of people who wander through disrupted landscapes and wonder where this all ends up.  
With this small amount we can fund a non-profit organization and offer our first issue containing the latest ideas and stories and new ways of imagining ourselves as not just gas-guzzlers and moon-goers, but as earth-bound primates, still weird and wonderful creatures capable of surprise.

story:
Mit navn er Mads Aggerholm. Jeg er 47 år, og har arbejdet som programmør i de fleste af dem.

Hele mit liv har jeg læst masser af science-fiction (og også andre bøger) og i 26 år har jeg haft ideen til en science-fiction historie til at ligge og ulme i hovedet.

Nu har jeg endelig fået den skrevet. Og den er god, venner!

Så nu skal den udgives!

Men science-fiction er noget som forlagene helst ikke vil røre med en tres meter lang ildtang – med mindre det er skrevet af gamle, velkonsoliderede forfattere. Det selskab tilhører jeg endnu ikke...!

Men den tog tid at skrive, og den skal altså trykkes!

Derfor vil jeg prøve sådan et af de her selvudgiver-forlag, men da mine midler er begrænsede forsøger jeg at rejse pengene ad den her vej. Det er belønninger til bidragsyderne (nærmere herom på ’Select a Perk’ rammen her ved siden af).

Beløbet som er målet er det minimumsbeløb der skal til når man skal have sin bog udgivet på den her måde, men hvis der kommer mere ind end dette beløb, så bliver der trykt så mange eksemplarer som der er råd til.

Nu en lille synopsis:

Rumkrydseren Gateway er på vej til en jordlignende planet, som jordens folk har givet arbejdstitlen ’New Earth One’. I begyndelsen troede man det var en ubeboet verden (ud over eventuelt dyreliv) som jordens milliarder af mennesker kunne overtage. Man begynder derfor at planlægge en ekspedition, som skal afgøre om denne planet egner sig til kolonisation. Men under studiet af kloden er man blevet klar over, at der findes intelligent liv og endda en moderne civilisation.

Formålet med ekspeditionen ændres fra at være ren overtagelse, til at skulle skabe kontakt med de indfødte og indlede et handelssamarbejde.

Jack Lee er en lettere fordrukken psykolog og antropolog på ekspeditionen, og han sættes til at analysere de sociale og samfundsmæssige forhold i dette samfund.

Hvad Jack finder, er en nærmest paradisisk verden befolket af unge, sunde og smukke mennesker, og et samfund hvor kriminalitet, grådighed og egoisme ikke eksisterer.

Men efterhånden som Jacks undersøgelser afdækker mere og mere af systemets virkemåde, opdager han at sandheden er en helt anden: Nogen forsøger tydeligvis at slå hele planetens befolkning ihjel, gennem et fantastisk svindelnummer der indtil videre har kørt i århundreder.

Men hvorfor?

Jack og hans ven, IT-eksperten Boris, kommer på en opgave som ikke er af de helt små.

Det er en spændende bog, som jeg selv har haft lyst til at læse igen siden jeg skrev den.

For yderligere at vække interessen følger her et uddrag: Første del af Kapitel seks, hvor ekspeditionen gør klar til første møde med planetens indfødte og deres civilisation: Uddrag, Føste del af sjette kapitel

God læselyst!

Og byd ind, folkens! Lad os få den her i luften!

Venlig hilsen

Mads Aggerholm

story:
I have finished putting my book together and have the first proof! Now I am working on cleaning it up and printing the first run. Any and all money raised will go towards the first printing of my book.

You can see more of my photos on my instagram account.

[EDIT] Due to the success of this campaign I've been able to print more books at a steeper discount. As a result I've decided to donate 10% of all sales to Mohawk Hudson Humane Society.

Thank you!!!!!

story:
Support A Luminous Rebel - Learn how to Free Your Self

For 3 years I have traveled the inner and outer world. I am an explorer of consciousness. My story is about finding out who I am and learning how to live life, fully, totally! 

It is about going from fear to love. From the head to the heart. This is a total transformation.

It is about following your dreams, no matter how crazy or scary they are. Facing and overcoming fears. Knowing depression and ecstasy, letting go and becoming truly free.

I am living my life, exactly like the boy Santiago did in Paulo Coelho´s "The Alchemist" I have learned the language of the world. And I am convinced I can teach it to you too, by telling my story  =)


Support A Vision - How to Harmonize the Structures of Society

On my adventure I had a vision on how we can change. We are in desperate need of that. We all know that. Look around you, we live in a fear based society. We are currently functioning under systems that claim to be democratic, but in fact it is not. We all know it, politicians lie, and they corrupt. Bankers lie, they are corrupt. The best business is the one with the highest profits, it does not matter whether that includes environmental destruction or human exploitation. 

In fact human exploitation is the norm!

Our societies are so un-equal, it hurts. It does not matter if you look at the world, you look at a country or a city. Everywhere there is inequality. Don't misunderstand me - I am not for total equality, but I am for equal opportunity. That is what my vision is about. It is about harmonizing the structures of society, so that everyone gets an equal opportunity to learn and to be a productive - a creative part of society.

The vision is divided into 11 sub visions, each representing a section of society. The first vision is about the general decision making  in society. I propose to move from a representative democracy to a direct democracy. Using the internet as the base platform.

The other visions give a complete guideline on how we can manage food production, education, healthcare, money systems and how we are going to share our resources. Not compete for them. Not in the same way we are used to at least. 

This is not communism, it is not socialism, it is not dictatorial, it is not utopia either. It is not a money free, resource based economy. It is not the Venus project. It is just something new, something you have not seen before. It is a vision I have been given, so that we can evolve into the new era of humanity.

I will present the vision and give the steps, to actually achieve this new world. It include an online platform, where the best vision will be democratically selected as a template, or a guideline. The system will be based not on competition, but on cooperation. And it will be bottom up, so local rules and regulations will be more powerful than state, country, region or global regulations. This will ensure diversity and cultural preservation.  


What will the book include?

The book will include my story. My views on the society I grew up in and how my world view changed dramatically, while I was fighting for freedom and democracy in Afghanistan. I came across information that I could not deny. I had to figure out what to do, when for ideological reasons I could no longer work in the army.

It led me on a journey to find some truth, and currently I have been traveling for almost 3 years. I know now that I am on the path of enlightenment of awakening. I am not yet fully awake. I am like you.. But I have seen some truth and my journey is continuing.

When I was in a deep depression in 2009 I suddenly had 3 days, where ideas on how to harmonize society just came rushing through my mind. I could write it in a short book by it self, but for you to fully understand it, and understand me I have decided that it is better to present my story and my vision in one book.


Where the money is going...

  • Living cost 4000$
  • Traveling cost 1000$
  • Text editing 1000$
  • Layout 1000$


Donations / Perks:

10$ - You get the E-book

  • You will receive the e-book, as soon as I finish writing and editing. 

25$ - E-book + Learn to listen to your intuition video

  • On my journey I really wanted to get to know my intuition. I could not figure it out - One day a girl walked straight up to me, she asked, as the very first thing - Would you like to know how to listen to your intuition. That was exactly what i wanted. I've been living my life according to this ever since. And I will let you in on the secret with this perk.

50$ - E-book + Intuition + The real book

  • You will receive e-book, the intuition video and the physical book as soon as it is published. Delivered right at your doorstep.

100$ - E-book + Intuition + Book + Healing 

  • You will receive all the above and a healing. I have been working with healing for almost 3 years. I am certified in Reconnective Healing and I work with light healing also. We will connect on skype and then I will give you a distance healing. 
  • If you are close to where I am, we can meet and I can give you the healing there.


I have no money!

You can help by posting this link on your Facebook profile. That would be great too! 

With love and gratitude

Jeppe Gabriel

story:
Short Summary

I'm moving to New York in early August. I have money coming in to cover the costs in the form of a stipend and pay for a freelance gig, but both sources of income have pushed back to mid to late September. I won't be able to take out loans, so I'm writing stuff on commission.

What I Need & What You Get

Pay me money and I'll write you:

  • $2/Joke
  • $10/4-page sketch
  • $15/Sonnet or 6-page sketch
  • $25/long form poem or comedic essay
  • $30/Short play
  • $60/Regular essay. Don't snitch.
  • $100/Sketch show or one act play
  • $400/Two act play
You can specify what exactly you want/topic of piece. If you don't, I'll write whatever I like. 

You will own copyrights but I maintain byline.

The Impact

I'll love you forever <3

Other Ways You Can Help

You can just donate if you want to but I'm trying to sell shit, not beg money off of people.
