story:
Defiant, nocturnal, moody–though River sounds like a typical teenager, she’s anything but. River is a werewolf.

The life of an alpha female wolf was irrevocably changed the night she was attacked and bitten, and awoke confused, alone, and human. Three years later, thrust into a world where she doesn’t belong and living in foster care, River barely tolerates humanity and still doesn’t know who bit her or why.

But River isn’t as alone as she previously thought; someone’s been watching her, someone who holds the answers she’s been seeking. And though the human who changed her seems to be a step ahead of her at every turn, River is determined to beat his game and return to her pack and mate.

And as if being stuck in a world she hates, with a life she never asked for, and faced with a destiny she doesn’t want wasn’t bad enough, River still must find a way to survive every human’s greatest challenge: high school.


In 2006, a little book by a young writer (me!) with a small press was released. Simply called River, it was a unique take on werewolves, centering around a wolf who was bitten and turned into a human girl. Readers and reviewers connected with the protagonist's abrasive nature and utter contempt for humanity, and it later won the 2007 Best Fantasy Eppie Award (tied with Dragon's Gold by Piers Anthony and Robert E. Margroff). 

River has been out of print for a year, and now I'd like your help to bring her back again...with a bit of a facelift. 

She's received some rewrites, maintaining the existing, character-driven story you remember but updating it a bit (when written in 2003, I had NO IDEA video rental stores would no longer be a thing in less than a decade). Some nifty perks are lined up if you can contribute.


Put simply, this book isn't happening without the fans. Here's where the money's going:

  • Proofreading: because the book has been almost entirely rewritten, typo demons have undoubtedly started to multiply. Extra sets of eyes are needed to go over everything, and proofers deserve to be paid for their time. 
  • Stock Images: stock's not cheap. At least not the good stuff. Relaunching this book means doing it right, and having the right cover art.
  • Printer Set-Up Fees: going with a good quality printer and good distribution means both the interior and exterior will cost more than a few pennies to upload.
  • Rewards and Shipping: the cost of those add up, so a portion of the money raised will go toward getting people their perks.
  • Fees, Fees, and More Fees: campaigns aren't run here for nothing, and PayPal takes a chunk of change too, so some money has to go to those dudes.

If there's money left over after paying people and shipping prizes, but not as far as the stretch goals, it'll possibly go towards some online ads, funds for self-pubbing future projects (or releasing my other books in print), and/or vet bills for my critters as they pop up a lot around my house. Basically, don't expect me to be rolling around in wads of cash--I don't have time for that.


  • $5: my undying thanks (literally, in the book) and devotion
  • $10: book thanks plus a (hopefully early) digital copy of the book
  • $20: thanks, digital copy, and a River-signed postcard
  • $25: thanks, e-copy, postcard, and a digital copy of any book from my backlist
  • $35: thanks, e-copy, postcard, ebook, and a wolfy charm necklace
  • $50: thanks, e-copy, postcard, ebook, necklace, and a print copy of River
  • $75: thanks, postcard, ebook, necklace, print copy, and my full digital backlist
  • $100: thanks, postcard, necklace, print copy, e-backlist, and a River poster
  • $150: thanks, postcard, necklace, print copy, e-backlist, poster, and a print ARC of my next novel
  • $200: thanks, postcard, necklace, print copy, e-backlist, poster, print ARC, and a River tote bag
  • $300: thanks, postcard, necklace, *2* print copies, e-backlist, poster, print ARC, tote bag, and a signed exclusive River hardcover
  • $500: thanks, postcard, necklace, 2 print copies, e-backlist, poster, print ARC, tote bag, River hardcover, and you name a character in either River or my next book (you also get a hard copy of the book)
  • $750: thanks, postcard, necklace, 2 print copies, e-backlist, poster, print ARC, tote bag, River hardcover, name a character, and knitted handwarmers (you pick the design and colour)
  • $1000: thanks, postcard, necklace, *3* print copies, e-backlist, poster, print ARC, tote bag, River hardcover, knitted handwarmers, name a character (plus hard copy), and a short story set in the Demons of Oblivion 'verse written just for you AND a special acknowledgement in River.
  • also, you will bring honor to your ancestors
  • apparently I'm not allowed to offer to kill someone for you--it's "illegal" or something like that--but know that I totally would if it were possible

All contributors, regardless of what level the contribute at, will get a sneak peak at the cover art before everyone else.


Remember how I said this book isn't happening without the fans? That's not an exaggeration. I firmly believe in paying people for their work, but I absolutely cannot afford this on my own.  If funding isn't met, I can't pay people or afford the rewards, so you get a refund and there is no book. It's that simple.

If funding *is* met, then the book comes out. No question. Rewrites are nearly complete and I have people lined up to work on it. River Wolfe will rise again in August, with swag delivered over the coming months. 


So $1000 will cover some proofing, stock, set up fees, campaign fees, and buying/mailing perks. But what if we go over that? (No, I am not laughing--you hear nothing.)

Well, in that event, things get bigger. 

At $1250...I've lined up a book blogger to help give River a proper release--she'll set up a blog tour.

At $1500...notice the perk that mentions a limited edition hardcover? I was going to have those privately printed, but if we hit this goal, I'll ensure there is also an official hardcover release in the fall and I'll aim to add some extra goodies to it (no, I'm not telling what they are).

Now, for the big one. 

River  actually had a sequel, called Wolfe (2009; also out of print). I have not even looked at the book and don't plan to unless the re-release of River sells OR...if this campaign can convince me to.  

If we hit $2000...I will start working on Wolfe  and look at releasing it in ebook next year, and everyone at the $20 level and above will receive an early ebook copy. Everyone who gets a thank you in River will also get a thanks in Wolfe.

NEW: Also at $2K, evil writer and knitter Dina James will knit a spectacular custom...something (a fancy scarf, I think--maybe even with a hat)...and everyone who has contributed to the Resurrecting River campaign will be entered in a draw for it. One winner will be drawn. Approximate value will likely be $100 - $200.  Guaranteed evil in every stitch.

If we hit $2500...I will absolutely guarantee Wolfe will release next year in *print* AND I will include the perks listed below:

  • everyone at the $100 level will also get a print Wolfe copy
  • everyone at the $250 level will also get a Wolfe poster
  • everyone at the $350 level will also get a Wolfe tote bag 
  • everyone at the $500 level will also get a Wolfe hardcover

AHAHAHAHA. No, really, it could happen, right?

Now how about something wildly impossible, well beyond that? 

If it goes, say, ridiculously outrageous...we're talking absurd money, like double the above...I will do the thing I swore I'd never do, and write the third book in the River Wolfe series. For real and for true.

Years and years ago I'd planned an anthology of shorts set in the world to tie up loose ends, but that was scrapped when I became exhausted with how heavily pirated the series was. That's not what this would be: instead make the book an all new adventure. River Wolfe, ten years later as an adult human--a full length novel to finish this as a trilogy. And I'll give ALL campaign contributors a digital copy (and some might possibly get print if I can swing it). It would take a whole lot of convincing to bring me back to this world, though.

So. Yeah. I am not wildly optimistic about any of this, but never say never. You give, I give back.


Don't just take my word for it. Here are some reviewers who dug the book.

"...beyond the frequent action that kept me riveted, RIVER is a story about learning to accept oneself, about forgiveness for past mistakes, and about the love of friends and family–or of a wolf for her pack. This book is a permanent addition to my keeper shelf, and will be revisited many times in the years to come." –Elaine Corvidae, author of WOLFKIN; WINTER’S ORPHANS

"Fans looking for a unique twist on the werewolf theme need look no further than RIVER as Skyla Dawn Cameron is definitely an author to keep an eye on!" –Deborah Wiley, COURTESY OF CK2S KWIPS AND KRITIQUES

"This is a terrific book, filled with unique and well-drawn characters, realistic dialogue, and a great deal of humor..." - Marc Vun Kannon for ParaNormalRomance Reviews

"With her impressive debut novel, author Skyla Dawn Cameron accomplishes what few others have by bringing much needed and refreshing innovation to the werewolf story. RIVER is not only a fascinating twist on the wolf-bites-man plot, but a novel in which the werewolf is a bright, witty and humorous young female. This is an entertaining read for anyone who likes fiction, but for fans of the fantasy/paranormal genre–RIVER is a must-have for your book shelf!" –Lori Johnson, author of PEOPLE OF THE BEAR

"RIVER, the debut novel from Skyla Dawn Cameron, provides a fresh and unique take on the werewolf legend." –Judy Bagshaw, author of KISS ME, NATE

"River is a powerful and new take on your typical young adult paranormal story and I absolutely loved it!" - Polly at Bitten by Books

"...while it is not your average romance novel, it is a story about love. Not just the happily-ever-after fairy tale kind, the real kind, the sort of love that takes two people and cements them together in relationships that are like lighthouses on rocky shores." - Long and Short Reviews on WOLFE (sequel to RIVER)


If you can't contribute some moola, I totally understand. Spreading the word would help a lot--tweet, link, pin, etc. 

And I'm not going to say you SHOULD carve the campaign URL into the bodies of your enemies, but just putting it out there as an option.
story_txt:
Defiant, nocturnal, moody–though River sounds like a typical teenager, she’s anything but. River is a werewolf.The life of an alpha female wolf was irrevocably changed the night she was attacked and bitten, and awoke confused, alone, and human. Three years later, thrust into a world where she doesn’t belong and living in foster care, River barely tolerates humanity and still doesn’t know who bit her or why.But River isn’t as alone as she previously thought; someone’s been watching her, someone who holds the answers she’s been seeking. And though the human who changed her seems to be a step ahead of her at every turn, River is determined to beat his game and return to her pack and mate.And as if being stuck in a world she hates, with a life she never asked for, and faced with a destiny she doesn’t want wasn’t bad enough, River still must find a way to survive every human’s greatest challenge: high school.In 2006, a little book by a young writer (me!) with a small press was released. Simply called River, it was a unique take on werewolves, centering around a wolf who was bitten and turned into a human girl. Readers and reviewers connected with the protagonist's abrasive nature and utter contempt for humanity, and it later won the 2007 Best Fantasy Eppie Award (tied with Dragon's Gold by Piers Anthony and Robert E. Margroff). River has been out of print for a year, and now I'd like your help to bring her back again...with a bit of a facelift. She's received some rewrites, maintaining the existing, character-driven story you remember but updating it a bit (when written in 2003, I had NO IDEA video rental stores would no longer be a thing in less than a decade). Some nifty perks are lined up if you can contribute.Put simply, this book isn't happening without the fans. Here's where the money's going:
Proofreading: because the book has been almost entirely rewritten, typo demons have undoubtedly started to multiply. Extra sets of eyes are needed to go over everything, and proofers deserve to be paid for their time. 
Stock Images: stock's not cheap. At least not the good stuff. Relaunching this book means doing it right, and having the right cover art.
Printer Set-Up Fees: going with a good quality printer and good distribution means both the interior and exterior will cost more than a few pennies to upload.
Rewards and Shipping: the cost of those add up, so a portion of the money raised will go toward getting people their perks.
Fees, Fees, and More Fees: campaigns aren't run here for nothing, and PayPal takes a chunk of change too, so some money has to go to those dudes.
If there's money left over after paying people and shipping prizes, but not as far as the stretch goals, it'll possibly go towards some online ads, funds for self-pubbing future projects (or releasing my other books in print), and/or vet bills for my critters as they pop up a lot around my house. Basically, don't expect me to be rolling around in wads of cash--I don't have time for that.
$5: my undying thanks (literally, in the book) and devotion

$10: book thanks plus a (hopefully early) digital copy of the book
$20: thanks, digital copy, and a River-signed postcard
$25: thanks, e-copy, postcard, and a digital copy of any book from my backlist
$35: thanks, e-copy, postcard, ebook, and a wolfy charm necklace
$50: thanks, e-copy, postcard, ebook, necklace, and a print copy of River
$75: thanks, postcard, ebook, necklace, print copy, and my full digital backlist
$100: thanks, postcard, necklace, print copy, e-backlist, and a River poster
$150: thanks, postcard, necklace, print copy, e-backlist, poster, and a print ARC of my next novel
$200: thanks, postcard, necklace, print copy, e-backlist, poster, print ARC, and a River tote bag
$300: thanks, postcard, necklace, *2* print copies, e-backlist, poster, print ARC, tote bag, and a signed exclusive River hardcover
$500: thanks, postcard, necklace, 2 print copies, e-backlist, poster, print ARC, tote bag, River hardcover, and you name a character in either River or my next book (you also get a hard copy of the book)
$750: thanks, postcard, necklace, 2 print copies, e-backlist, poster, print ARC, tote bag, River hardcover, name a character, and knitted handwarmers (you pick the design and colour)

$1000: thanks, postcard, necklace, *3* print copies, e-backlist, poster, print ARC, tote bag, River hardcover, knitted handwarmers, name a character (plus hard copy), and a short story set in the Demons of Oblivion 'verse written just for you AND a special acknowledgement in River.

also, you will bring honor to your ancestors


apparently I'm not allowed to offer to kill someone for you--it's "illegal" or something like that--but know that I totally would if it were possible

All contributors, regardless of what level the contribute at, will get a sneak peak at the cover art before everyone else.Remember how I said this book isn't happening without the fans? That's not an exaggeration. I firmly believe in paying people for their work, but I absolutely cannot afford this on my own.  If funding isn't met, I can't pay people or afford the rewards, so you get a refund and there is no book. It's that simple.If funding *is* met, then the book comes out. No question. Rewrites are nearly complete and I have people lined up to work on it. River Wolfe will rise again in August, with swag delivered over the coming months. So $1000 will cover some proofing, stock, set up fees, campaign fees, and buying/mailing perks. But what if we go over that? (No, I am not laughing--you hear nothing.)Well, in that event, things get bigger. At $1250...I've lined up a book blogger to help give River a proper release--she'll set up a blog tour.At $1500...notice the perk that mentions a limited edition hardcover? I was going to have those privately printed, but if we hit this goal, I'll ensure there is also an official hardcover release in the fall and I'll aim to add some extra goodies to it (no, I'm not telling what they are).Now, for the big one. River  actually had a sequel, called Wolfe (2009; also out of print). I have not even looked at the book and don't plan to unless the re-release of River sells OR...if this campaign can convince me to.  If we hit $2000...I will start working on Wolfe  and look at releasing it in ebook next year, and everyone at the $20 level and above will receive an early ebook copy. Everyone who gets a thank you in River will also get a thanks in Wolfe.NEW: Also at $2K, evil writer and knitter Dina James will knit a spectacular custom...something (a fancy scarf, I think--maybe even with a hat)...and everyone who has contributed to the Resurrecting River campaign will be entered in a draw for it. One winner will be drawn. Approximate value will likely be $100 - $200.  Guaranteed evil in every stitch.If we hit $2500...I will absolutely guarantee Wolfe will release next year in *print* AND I will include the perks listed below:
everyone at the $100 level will also get a print Wolfe copy

everyone at the $250 level will also get a Wolfe poster

everyone at the $350 level will also get a Wolfe tote bag 
everyone at the $500 level will also get a Wolfe hardcover
AHAHAHAHA. No, really, it could happen, right?Now how about something wildly impossible, well beyond that? If it goes, say, ridiculously outrageous...we're talking absurd money, like double the above...I will do the thing I swore I'd never do, and write the third book in the River Wolfe series. For real and for true.Years and years ago I'd planned an anthology of shorts set in the world to tie up loose ends, but that was scrapped when I became exhausted with how heavily pirated the series was. That's not what this would be: instead make the book an all new adventure. River Wolfe, ten years later as an adult human--a full length novel to finish this as a trilogy. And I'll give ALL campaign contributors a digital copy (and some might possibly get print if I can swing it). It would take a whole lot of convincing to bring me back to this world, though.So. Yeah. I am not wildly optimistic about any of this, but never say never. You give, I give back.Don't just take my word for it. Here are some reviewers who dug the book."...beyond the frequent action that kept me riveted, RIVER is a story about learning to accept oneself, about forgiveness for past mistakes, and about the love of friends and family–or of a wolf for her pack. This book is a permanent addition to my keeper shelf, and will be revisited many times in the years to come." –Elaine Corvidae, author of WOLFKIN; WINTER’S ORPHANS"Fans looking for a unique twist on the werewolf theme need look no further than RIVER as Skyla Dawn Cameron is definitely an author to keep an eye on!" –Deborah Wiley, COURTESY OF CK2S KWIPS AND KRITIQUES"This is a terrific book, filled with unique and well-drawn characters, realistic dialogue, and a great deal of humor..." - Marc Vun Kannon for ParaNormalRomance Reviews"With her impressive debut novel, author Skyla Dawn Cameron accomplishes what few others have by bringing much needed and refreshing innovation to the werewolf story. RIVER is not only a fascinating twist on the wolf-bites-man plot, but a novel in which the werewolf is a bright, witty and humorous young female. This is an entertaining read for anyone who likes fiction, but for fans of the fantasy/paranormal genre–RIVER is a must-have for your book shelf!" –Lori Johnson, author of PEOPLE OF THE BEAR"RIVER, the debut novel from Skyla Dawn Cameron, provides a fresh and unique take on the werewolf legend." –Judy Bagshaw, author of KISS ME, NATE"River is a powerful and new take on your typical young adult paranormal story and I absolutely loved it!" - Polly at Bitten by Books"...while it is not your average romance novel, it is a story about love. Not just the happily-ever-after fairy tale kind, the real kind, the sort of love that takes two people and cements them together in relationships that are like lighthouses on rocky shores." - Long and Short Reviews on WOLFE (sequel to RIVER)If you can't contribute some moola, I totally understand. Spreading the word would help a lot--tweet, link, pin, etc. And I'm not going to say you SHOULD carve the campaign URL into the bodies of your enemies, but just putting it out there as an option.

story:
WHAT'S THIS ALL ABOUT, TQ?...

TQ: You're here!  So glad you stopped by.
You: You sent me a link; I couldn't resist.  
TQ: I'll get right to it.  As you might know, last year I did a 1-year fast from shopping, which is quite the feat for a fashion designer.  The fast renewed my perspective on fashion and altered my life in greater ways than I could have predicted.  I'm launching a lifetstyle blog on which I'll be writing about fashion, but mostly about life, from my new & rare vantage point. 
To bolster my blog launch, I'm embarking on a lengendary 3-week road trip with my buddy Colin. Colin has been one of my most-loyal friends for the past five years, and he needs a co-pilot as he moves back to Boston.  This won't be an ordinary point A to point B road trip; we'll be making videos, seeing old friends and seeking out adventure all along the way.  I'll be documenting the entire expedition on my blog, and you can follow us.  Do you want to help make this happen?
You: This sounds weird.  Why would I fund YOUR road trip?  
TQ: I admit, this could sound a little weird.  This money does fund a road trip, but you would actually be supporting the fulfillment of a GREATER DREAM.  The road trip will springboard me into a new season of writing and creating that will eventually help me market a book about my shopping fast.  The fast changed my life, and I believe my story can inspire others.
Let me break it down: 

Can't you see?  It's all CONNECTED! 
You:  So the world will be a better place, but what's in it for ME?
TQ:  I'M GLAD YOU ASKED THAT, you little troll.  You should read the sidebar for a full explanation of the perks.  (Do it now!)
Below are two perks: Heart Pillow & LOVE Pillow. The names are self-explanatory.You:  Which is which?
TQ:  I'll let you figure that out when you get them in the mail.  
You:  Those are pretty dope perks, Trishawna.
TQ:  Thanks!  What's cool, is the perks you pick actually influence the trip and in-turn inform the blog.  You are a co-creator.  This is going to be an amazing journey, and I hope you'll be a part of it.
You:  I'll totally follow you!  I'll be in a green station wagon.  You'll see me in your rearview...
TQ:  Uhh...maybe just stick to following the blog, www.thegoldrushblog.com. You can also back me by sending this campaign to your friends & family!  Thanks for taking time to drop in!  You da best!  I mean it.

Oh, and Let's not forget the credits...
Campaign photo by the generous & wonderful Yvonne Goll
Video by my brain twin Aubrey Swan Dive 
Music in video by the ledendary Phil Collins & 2013's newest sensation Lorde

story:
Brussels Chronicle

I want to bring a daily newsite to life that showcases Brussels for what it is , an extremely livable city.

  • I'm Alia Papageorgiou the Founding Editor of The Brussels Chronicle who has been in journalism for the last eight years and has lost count of how many people have told me they wish they still had something like The Bulletin weekly in Brussels, but better.
  • So I've decided to launch a call for help in order to produce this and then build from there.
  • I won't be able to do this without your help! So thanks for letting me know if this is something that you also feel is missing from our city.

What We Need & What You Get

In more detail:

  • I have put 15,000 Euro as a round figure as I know the writing costs for the rest of the year will be met by this sum. This is strictly going to the production of content, by great writers, on Brussels in Brussels, with a proofreader in Bristol!  
  • We'll bring you great stories, ideas, collaborative works and a Brussels in depth weekly, with some literary references and writings to curl up with on a Sunday.
  • If the goal isn't completely reached whatever funds are raised will still go to the production of the first issue of Brussels Magazine, a weekend glossy planned for your weekend pleasure from January 2015. 

Impact

Your contribution will go towards bringing a more holistic view of Brussels alive, I see all different facets of the city , EU, military, lobby, civil servant, bus driver, migrant woman, journalist, art curator, director, creator, vendor,  but never one complete picture, this is our chance for a real profile.

  • This project will contribute to the English speaking and anglophone seeking community, as well as that all future editions and profits will use 15% of their profits to go towards new media training for aspiring journalists in Brussels (but that's getting ahead of ourselves).
  • Following experiences in Brussels with European political newspaper New Europe, copy editing The Word magazine and events like the Personal Democracy Forum and Twestival this will bring together all that expertise and take it one step further with your help.
  • I want to put a great, detailed and thoughtful news site and as soon as I can, magazine in your hands about the things that matter to you and the place you live. 

Other Ways You Can Help

No worries if funding or online payments aren't your thing.

  • Feel free to spread the word and make some noise about The Brussels Chronicle and Brussels Magazine.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Many thanks in advance :)

story:
"Make a messay."

--Rebecca McClanahan, author of The Tribal Knot, The Riddle Song and Other Rememberings,  Word Painting, Deep Light, and more. 

ABOUT WELCOME TABLE PRESS

"The world is everywhere whispering essays." --Alexander Smith

We are an all-volunteer, independent nonprofit press devoted to publishing & celebrating the essay, in all its forms. CLICK HERE TO LEARN MORE.

The essay is a chameleon, at once formal and scholarly, lyrical and narrative, personal and political, educational and secretive, humorous and curmudgeonly, loud and quiet. It is endangered and dangerous, adaptable and perishable. Your contributions will help us put bold and provocative literature into the hands of readers, writers, students, and teachers. 

ALL OF THE CONTRIBUTIONS WE RECEIVE COME FROM INDIVIDUALS WHO BELIEVE IN INDEPENDENT PUBLISHING.

HOW YOU CAN HELP SUPPORT OUR WORK

All contributions collected from this Indiegogo campaign will be directed toward the printing and distribution of our second print book, ESSAYING THE ESSAY, edited by David Lazar.

ESSAYING THE ESSAY is a must-have compendium of essays on the essay, showcasing diverse meditations on the form  by a wide range of writers throughout history, including Michel de Montaigne, Samuel Johnson, Virginia Woolf, Cynthia Ozick, Phillip Lopate, Robert Atwan, Lia Purpura, and John D'Agata.

Your support will help build our self-sufficiency (pre-press, printing, and advertising are expensive; the larger the print run, the lower the cost per title; distributing books costs money too).

The more funding we secure, the greater the possibility for us to offer:

  • Discounts for students, teachers, and writers.
  • Letterpress-printed, limited-edition versions of our titles, whose sales will help futher support our publishing and educational activities.
  • Publishing internships to more students.

Our first Indiegogo campaign, Everywhere Whispering Essays, funded the printing and distribution of our first print title, You. An Anthology of Essays Devoted to the Second Person, edited by Kim Dana Kupperman, with Heather G. Simons and James M. Chesbro.


YOU. AN ANTHOLOGY is a first-of-its-kind collection, featuring essays that explore failure, planetary movement, and love, among a variety of topics. The up close and personal candor of these autobiographical, lyric, personal, and segmented narratives is tempered by the distance, intimacy, humor, and unsentimental tenderness that the second-person point of view affords both writer and reader.


OUR TRACK RECORD

Welcome Table Press has published (and distributed at no cost) ten electronic and six limited-edition, print issues of its periodical pamphlet series, OCCASIONAL PAPERS ON PRACTICE & FORM, featuring spoken essays derived from talks delivered at symposia, conferences, and other gatherings where friends of the essay might be found. Currently in production are six additional issues.

Two  co-sponsored by   Fordham University's Creative Writing Program and featuring Robert Atwan, Vivian Gornick, Phillip Lopate, Jerald Walker, Brian Doyle, Lia Purpura, Barbara Hurd, Robin Hemley, Idiots' Books, editors from national periodicals, and many other writers and teachers of the essay.

                 Click HERE to download FREE PDFs of these important essays. 

Welcome Table Press is home to FOOD FOR THOUGHT, a hand-sewn, miniature/limited-edition periodical whose two volumes were published between 2002-2006 and featured lyric essays, poetry, and recipes for local, seasonal dishes. The twelve issues of FOOD FOR THOUGHT are preserved at SUNY Buffalo's Special Collections library.

We plan to re-create FOOD FOR THOUGHT NOTES as a series of video essays.

Because we are dedicated to spreading the word about the essay, our press has hosted and co-sponsored several low-cost or free educational events, including:

  • Two symposia on the essay, co-sponsored by      
  • Fordham University's Creative Writing Program andfeaturing Robert Atwan, Vivian Gornick, Phillip Lopate, Jerald Walker, Brian Doyle, Lia Purpura, Barbara Hurd, Robin Hemley, Idiots' Books, editors from national periodicals, and many other writers and teachers of the essay.
  • Internships for creative-writing students: we have been working with editorial interns for several years 
  • and are currently working with the Fairfield University's low-residency MFA Program to provide internships in its publishing concentration.
  • A book arts workshop in a rural community.
  • Fundraiser readings by the literary touring group Three Genres in the Rain, which benefitted organizations devoted to the reading and writing.

YOUR CONTRIBUTION IS TAX DEDUCTIBLE. Welcome Table Press was incorporated as a nonprofit organization in 2008 and granted 501(c)(3) status in 2009.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

We know that not everyone can contribute to this fundraising campaign. But here's what you can do:

  • Whisper essays everywhere and then make noise about this Indiegogo campaign, via e-mail, social media, on your website or blog, in your community, classes, and at your office.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools.
  • Buy one of our publications.
  • Consider partnering with us to co-sponsor an event.

MOST IMPORTANTLY: Please purchase our titles--priced well below the cost of producing the physical books-- through our distributor, Itasca Books (and spread the word).

To order the YOU Anthology ($20 cover price + 4.50 S&H minimum), please click HERE.

Welcome Table Press derives more income per book if you order through ITASCA BOOKS instead of through other distributors or chain bookstores. We’d also love it if you worked with independent and/or college bookstores near you to order our books. If you need a quantity of books for a class, workshop, or other reason please e-mail welcometablepress@gmail.com, let us know what you need, and we will work with you.

Currently in production are six additional issues.
Two  co-sponsored by   Fordham University's Creative Writing Program and featuring Robert Atwan, Vivian Gornick, Phillip Lopate, Jerald Walker, Brian Doyle, Lia Purpura, Barbara Hurd, Robin Hemley, Idiots' Books, editors from national periodicals, and many other writers and teachers of the essay.                 Click HERE to download FREE PDFs of these important essays. 

Welcome Table Press is home to FOOD FOR THOUGHT, a hand-sewn, miniature/limited-edition periodical whose two volumes were published between 2002-2006 and featured lyric essays, poetry, and recipes for local, seasonal dishes. The twelve issues of FOOD FOR THOUGHT are preserved at SUNY Buffalo's Special Collections library.
We plan to re-create FOOD FOR THOUGHT NOTES as a series of video essays.
Because we are dedicated to spreading the word about the essay, our press has hosted and co-sponsored several low-cost or free educational events, including:
Two symposia on the essay, co-sponsored by      
Fordham University's Creative Writing Program andfeaturing Robert Atwan, Vivian Gornick, Phillip Lopate, Jerald Walker, Brian Doyle, Lia Purpura, Barbara Hurd, Robin Hemley, Idiots' Books, editors from national periodicals, and many other writers and teachers of the essay.

Internships for creative-writing students: we have been working with editorial interns for several years 
and are currently working with the Fairfield University's low-residency MFA Program to provide internships in its publishing concentration.

A book arts workshop in a rural community.

Fundraiser readings by the literary touring group Three Genres in the Rain, which benefitted organizations devoted to the reading and writing.
YOUR CONTRIBUTION IS TAX DEDUCTIBLE. Welcome Table Press was incorporated as a nonprofit organization in 2008 and granted 501(c)(3) status in 2009.



OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:
We know that not everyone can contribute to this fundraising campaign. But here's what you can do:


Whisper essays everywhere and then make noise about this Indiegogo campaign, via e-mail, social media, on your website or blog, in your community, classes, and at your office.
Use the Indiegogo share tools.


Buy one of our publications.
Consider partnering with us to co-sponsor an event.


MOST IMPORTANTLY: Please purchase our titles--priced well below the cost of producing the physical books-- through our distributor, Itasca Books (and spread the word).
To order the YOU Anthology ($20 cover price + 4.50 S&H minimum), please click HERE.
Welcome Table Press derives more income per book if you order through ITASCA BOOKS instead of through other distributors or chain bookstores. We’d also love it if you worked with independent and/or college bookstores near you to order our books. If you need a quantity of books for a class, workshop, or other reason please e-mail welcometablepress@gmail.com, let us know what you need, and we will work with you.

story:
Die Crowdfunding-Kampagne / The crowdfunding campaign

Entstanden ist die Kampagne mit dem starken Wunsch danach, Bücher lesen zu können, die einmal nicht aus der Perspektive geschrieben wurde, die seit Jahrhunderten die literarische Welt dominiert. Es entgeht uns so vieles, weil wir unsere Strukturen bisher nicht für die Werke von Autor*innen of Colour geöffnet haben.
Sharon Dodua Otoos Werke sind nicht nur literarisch besonders und überzeugend. Auch bei der Frage, was Autor*innen of Colour in Deutschland Kritisches zu sagen haben und warum im Literaturbetrieb ganz wesentlich nur "weiße" Autor*innen von "weißen" Leser*innen gefeiert werden, wurde ihre Novelle die dinge, die ich denke, während ich höflich lächle selbst im großen Feuilleton hervorgehoben und wahrgenommen (Wenn Weißbrote wie wir erzählen, Dietmar Dath, FAZ). Abgesehen davon, dass Dath feststellt, dass man mit ihrem Werk ein "exzellentes Literaturkolleg darüber, was eine Novelle ist, organisieren könnte", ist eines noch wichtiger: Es geht um eine Debatte, die "sich als Literaturdebatte allein gar nicht führen lässt", sondern eine Debatte, die sich auch "auf die Zustände in den Städten, an den Schulen, in den Parlamenten" beziehen müsste.

Um großartige Buchprojekte wie Sharon Dodua Otoos neueste Novelle Synchronicity zu unterstützen, gründet sich nun gerade ein Unterstützer*innen-Kreis. Im Rahmen dessen wollen wir Projekte unterstützen, die ohne finanzielle Zuschüsse von außen nur schwer realisierbar wären. Der Unterstützer*innen-Kreis supportet insbesondere rassismuskritische Bücher mit dem Ansatz des Empowerments. 
Weder bei diesem Projekt noch beim Crowdfunding wird es aufhören: Es sollen Büchertische organisiert, weitere Kampagnen gestartet, Solipartys gemacht, auf Zuschussmöglichkeiten geachtet und Zuschüsse eingeworben werden. Außerdem sollen Vorbestellungen gesammelt und Lesungen organisiert werden. Buchprojekte können auch selbst initiiert und Manuskripte geprüft und eingereicht werden.
Wenn ihr Lust habt, bei der Entstehung des Unterstützer*innenkreises dabei zu sein und mitzuhelfen Projekte wie dieses zu unterstützen, meldet euch einfach unter ukreis@edition-assemblage.de.

The campaign was started with a strong wish for books which have not been written from a perspective that has dominated the literary realm for centuries.

Because our structures are until today still not accessible to writers of colour, many excellent pieces of literature are missing from our bookshelves. 
Sharon Dodua Otoo's works are not only special in a literary way.When it comes to what marginalisedthe critical contributions of authors of Colour and why, in literature in Germany, only white authors are celebrated by white readers, her novella the things i am thinking while smiling politely was acknowledged and highlighted even by the feuilleton  (Wenn Weißbrote wie wir erzählen, Dietmar Dath, FAZ). Apart from Dath's statement, that you could easily use her work for an excellent lecture on what a novella is, one statement is maybe even more important: The discussion about the marginalisation of People of Colour in literature is a discussion which cannot be seperated from a broader discussion that we have to lead in our towns, schools and parliaments as well.


To support great projects like Synchronicity, the latest novella by Sharon Dodua Otoo, a group of supporters has recently gathered and wants to help funding projects that could only be realised with great difficulty without support from the outside. In particular, we support books that promote empowerment and are critical of racism. People of Colour certainly are a part of German society and literature, but are very not recognised as such.
But we won't stop at this project or at crowdfunding: We would like to organise stalls, campaigns, parties in solidarity with the projects and organise grants. Furthermore, preorders will be taken, readings will be organised and we could even start own book projects or review manuscripts.
If you are up for supporting and/or joining us you can write an e-mail to ukreis@edition-assemblage.de.

Das Buch

Nachdem bereits die deutsche Übersetzung 2014 so erfolgreich veröffentlicht werden konnte, möchten wir jetzt – rechtzeitig zur Adventzeit – Synchronicity im englischsprachigen Original herausgeben. Die 24 Kapitel sind wie ein Adventskalender angelegt, den wir auch für euch als Perk (Anreiz, das Projekt zu unterstützen) im Angebot haben, was vielleicht eine gute Geschenkidee ist.

After successfully publishing the German translation in 2014, we would now like to publish Synchronicity in English. These 24 chapters were originally written as an advent calender and the book will be published just in time. By the way, it will also be available to you as an advent calender (daily e-mails for 24 days) and might be a great idea for a gift.

Inhalt

Cee merkt allmählich, dass sie Tag für Tag ihre Farben verliert. Natürlich ist sie erstmal verunsichert – obwohl sie genau weiß, dass ihre Vorfrauen das auch schon durchgemacht und überlebt haben. Trotzdem. Nun wird sie wieder einmal lernen müssen, mit einem Verlust umzugehen – und das schon wieder so kurz vor Weihnachten …

mehr dazu auf http://www.edition-assemblage.de/synchronicity-the-original-story/

Content

Cee slowly realises that she is losing her colours day by day. Of course, this worries her at first – although she already knows that her foremothers also went through it and survived. Still. Now she has to once again learn how to deal with loss – and just like last time, it‘s happening just before Christmas…

for more information visit http://www.edition-assemblage.de/synchronicity-the-original-story/


Rezensionen / Reviews

‘Synchronicity’ erzählt einfühlsam, ehrlich und selbst_ironisch von der Kraft menschlicher Beziehungen, wenn unsere Wahrnehmung in verschiedenen Grautönen zu verschwinden droht. Alle 24 Anekdoten sind eine buchstäblich sinnliche Erfahrung, die eigene Ängste herausfordern und Lust auf Veränderung machen.

In a sensitive, honest and (self-) depreciating way, “Synchronicity“ tells the story of the power of human relationships when our perception threatens to disappear into various shades of grey. Each of the 24 anecdotes is literally a sensuous experience: challenging the reader to confront their own fears while also sparking a desire for change.
Nadine Lantzsch
Author and Blogger at Medienelite und Mädchenmannschaft


Das Werk von Otoo liest sich schnell und sanft zugleich. Als würde man einen Schmetterling in den Händen halten. Genau so ging es mir, als ich die Hauptperson in Synchronicity also mit all‘ ihren Erlebnissen in den Händen hielt. Als würde sie ausbrechen wollen, aus dem, wo sie auch immer mehr reinzurutschen und zu verschwinden drohte. Oder sind und waren es doch andere, die sie immer farbloser wenn nicht unsichtbar machten. In der Welt, in welchem der Farbverlust zum Alltag zu werden wusste…

Reading this work by Otoo is at once swift and gentle: as if you were holding a butterfly cupped between your hands. This describes exactly how I felt as I held the main character of “Synchronicity“, with all her experiences, in my hands. It was as if she wanted to break out, to escape from everything which she was in danger of sliding and disappearing into. Or was it actually the others who make and made her increasingly colourless or even completely invisible? In a world in which the loss of colour was becoming a simple fact of life.
Gülseher S. in denkerinnen

mehr Rezensionen auf: http://www.edition-assemblage.de/synchronicity-the-original-story/


Die Autorin / The Author

Sharon Dodua Otoo ist Schwarze Britin – Mutter, Aktivistin, Autorin und Herausgeberin der englischsprachigen Buchreihe Witnessed. Ihre erste Novelle, the things i am thinking while smiling politely, erschien 2012 (edition assemblage) und wurde 2013 in der deutschen Übersetzung die dinge, die ich denke während ich höflich lächle publiziert. Das Buch Synchronicity erschien auf Deutsch im August 2014 und wird nun mit eurer Unterstützung auf Englisch Ende 2015 erscheinen. Ihre neueste Publikation ist Winter Shorts, eine Sammlung von Kurzgeschichten herausgeben mit Clementine Burnley. Sharon Dodua Otoo lebt, lacht und arbeitet in Berlin.

Sharon is a Black British mother, activist, author and editor of the book series Witnessed.
Sharon's first novella the things i am thinking while smiling politely was published in February 2012 (edition assemblage). The German language translation die dinge, die ich denke, während ich höflich lächle, appeared in October 2013. The novella Synchronicity (in German) appeared in August 2014 and will be, with your help, published in English in Winter 2015. Her most recent publication is Winter Shorts, a collection of short stories edited with Clementine Burnley. She lives, laughs and works in Berlin.


Finanzierungskram / Financial Stuff

Um die Kosten des Drucks zu reduzieren, haben wir uns schon dazu entschlossen, das Buch in Klammerheftung zu veröffentlichen. Das reduziert die Kosten um 2/3 und wir können Synchronicity voll in Farbe drucken. Die Illustrationen von Sita Ngoumou, die ihr auch als Poster hier bestellen könnt, hätten wir einfach nicht rauslassen können, geschweige denn sie ihrer Farben zu berauben.

Die Kosten des Drucks, der Auslieferung, für die Plattform hier und die anderen Sachen, die ihr hier erweben könnt um das Projekt zu unterstützen, werden sich auf ca. 2500 Euro belaufen. Damit können wir sicherstellen, dass wir eine Auflage von 2500 Stück drucken können. Alles, was darüber hinaus gehen sollte, wird in andere Projekte von Sharon, wie zum Beispiel die Witnessed-Reihe fließen und helfen, diese Projekte finanziell zu unterstützen. Um euch eine Vorstellung machen zu können, wie sich die Kosten ca. zusammensetzen, haben wir eine kleine Auflistung gemacht:

  • Rund 1000 Euro für den Druck
  • Weitere 1000 Euro benötigen wir für den Vertrieb
  • Weitere 500 Euro für Marketing- und Pressearbeit

To reduce the expenses for the book we decided to print the book as a stapled booklet. This way we reduce the costs by 2/3 and are able to print Synchronicity in colour. The illustrations by Sita Ngoumou, which you can order here as posters, could just not be omitted, and neither could we rob them of their colour.

With the money from this platform we can make sure that we can print 2500 copies. Everything above those 2500 Euros will be used to finance other projects by Sharon, such as the Witnessed-Series, and will help to fund these great books. To give you an insight in the costs of such a project, here's a short list:

  • About 1000 euro for printing
  • Another 1000 euro are needed for sales and distribution
  • Another 500 euro for marketing and press


Zeitplan / Timetable

Wir werden, wenn die Summe bis Mitte November zusammengekommen ist, eben dann in Druck gehen. Die Bücher so wie die Poster werden im Dezember vor Weihnachten verschickt, den Adventskalender bekommt ihr natürlich täglich im Dezember (bis Weihnachten).

We will, given we will have reached the goal till mid of November, then print the booklet. The booklets as well as the posters will be dispatched in December (before christmas) and the advent calender will be send to you on a daily basis (until christmas).

Fragen und Anfragen

Solltet ihr Fragen zu der Kampagne, dem Buch, der Autorin, uns, dem Verlag oder sonst etwas haben, schreibt uns einfach über indiegogo.com oder an ukreis@edition-assemblage.de eine Mail.

Should you have any questions regarding the campaign, the book, the author, us, the publishers or anything else please write to us either here on indiegogo.com or to ukreis@edition-assemblage.de.

story:
Our 2020 Issue will be available in late June!

 

Our Story

Hanging Lantern Review is a literary journal created, curated, and published by High School students at SLO Classical Academy in San Luis Obispo, California. We started in 2013 to provide student artists in our area a beautiful, quality publication in which to publish their poetry, fiction, non-fiction, art, and photography. We are the only annual print journal in our county publishing exclusively middle school and high school work. The journal, along with our quarterly Bifrost Reading Series, website, and annual reading and release party, provide a rich literary community experience on the Central Coast for young writers and the fans of their work. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $800 for this year's print run, so we are pre-selling copies of our literary journal. While we usually host a release party with journals available to pickup, due to the COVID-19 shutdown our release party is postponed for 2020. We will instead be shipping all journals to you in June! 

Your Impact

As we are a student-run, self-funded high school club, we run entirely off of journal sales. Each year, the previous year's sales funds the next year's print run. In order to keep getting student writing out into the world, we need to cover the cost of our print run. Your contributions also go to technology and software for our student designers, event fees, and shipping. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Subscribe! Already a long time fan of HLR? Consider a three year subscription to the journal and save 2 dollars per issue. 
  • Make a small donation of any amount.
  • Share our with student writers -- we'd love to share our work, and see their submissions in the coming years!

Our Story
Hanging Lantern Review is a literary journal created, curated, and published by High School students at SLO Classical Academy in San Luis Obispo, California. We started in 2013 to provide student artists in our area a beautiful, quality publication in which to publish their poetry, fiction, non-fiction, art, and photography. We are the only annual print journal in our county publishing exclusively middle school and high school work. The journal, along with our quarterly Bifrost Reading Series, website, and annual reading and release party, provide a rich literary community experience on the Central Coast for young writers and the fans of their work. 

What We Need & What You Get
We need to raise $800 for this year's print run, so we are pre-selling copies of our literary journal. While we usually host a release party with journals available to pickup, due to the COVID-19 shutdown our release party is postponed for 2020. We will instead be shipping all journals to you in June! 

Your Impact
As we are a student-run, self-funded high school club, we run entirely off of journal sales. Each year, the previous year's sales funds the next year's print run. In order to keep getting student writing out into the world, we need to cover the cost of our print run. Your contributions also go to technology and software for our student designers, event fees, and shipping. 
Other Ways You Can Help

Subscribe! Already a long time fan of HLR? Consider a three year subscription to the journal and save 2 dollars per issue. 
Make a small donation of any amount.
Share our with student writers -- we'd love to share our work, and see their submissions in the coming years!

story:
Story of My Book

My name is C.E Lagerbom and I am the author of The Crystal Veil. I wrote this book because it’s been my dream to become a published author since I was a kid.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that family is not always simple. Blood is not everything, we meet people in our lives that we decide to keep very close to us. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to think differently, have an open and honest conversation with yourself about what you believe in. Escape from our stressful everyday lives, and learn alongside Isaac about the importance of family and making choices.

In a near dystopian future where mankind is addicted to VR technology, Isaac arrives from the past to find himself incarcerated. Charged with crimes he does not recognize, he must escape and continue his quest to figure out how he arrived here and find his missing father - if he is even still alive. Isaac quickly adapts to the new technology of a completely foreign world while being hunted by interested parties, but shocking discoveries of what has become of his home planet rock him to his very foundation. On a new path, he decides to use his newfound skills to investigate the mysteries he encounters further.

You will love this book if you want to run amok on a fun sci-fi adventure!

The Crystal Veil speaks to people who are openly searching for religion, and to those who are fascinated by the concept of mortality and how we decide who is our family in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that The Crystal Veil inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • What can we expect in the next 100 years in terms of deeptech advancements?
  • How religion has shaped our world and how will it continue to do so?
  • Our moral responsibilities as a species “If we can invent it....should we?”

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. Discussing the future, theology, technology and family will change us all for the better.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this spring.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author

C.E Lagerbom is an aspiring content creator actively engaged in livestreams on Twitch, and editing and writing in their free time.

C.E wrote this book because they believe wholeheartedly that storytelling is one of humanity’s greatest gifts. It’s something they really enjoy doing and they hope to continue doing it in the future. They have seen firsthand how books and movies can create a real and meaningful connection for people and bring real emotion, and hopes one day to make someone feel that same kind of spark inside with their work.

Some of their favorite games to play are in the world-building genre such as Minecraft or adventure-based games like Dungeons & Dragons.

For more information, you can connect with C.E [Twitch.tv/RealityUnited and Instagram: @c.e.lagerbom_author].
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #crystalveil and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
C.E Lagerbom

story:
The Story of My Book

Fast Forward to Hope is about my journey from fear to hope as I struggled to face various challenges, particularly related to my advanced breast cancer diagnosis. Bolstered by my strength of fighting cancer, I found the license to fully discover and accept my personhood, and consider my life choices in this hard-fought new context. This book is an homage to the journey of life. It is a tribute to the struggle of finding your own power, and cultivating your life’s trajectory.
---
My name is Indira Kaur Ahluwalia, and I am the author of Fast Forward to Hope. I wrote this book because I have been enriched by my experiences of fighting the odds, and have learned how to live. My humble aspiration is that my experiences provide you with insights to fast forward through your own challenges on your way to finding hope and courage.

In reading this book, I trust that you will discover that you have the capacity within yourself to take on life with all of its provocations, the ability to make choices to shape your path, and that, indeed, you are enough. As I share my passion for life and the might of self-awareness, I invite you to use this book to help you face your own fears and doubts, and to get ahead of them so that you can choose the outcomes you desire. I hope that the insights I have gained can become your tools for persevering.

I was diagnosed with advanced breast cancer with extensive bone metastasis in 2007, and I remain in treatment to keep the cancer under control. I had to learn to acknowledge my fears and get comfortable with my mortality as much as my vulnerability to build hope and strength. This book explores life in the shadow of death, and shares the process of going from surviving to living well. Whatever the odds, we can choose to find our courage to build on the smallest hope, to will ourselves to live our lives on its merits, on our own terms, and live it as well as possible.

This book is a nonfiction memoir that speaks to people fighting cancer, or whatever it is that is overpowering them. It is for those who want to look at challenges and struggles in a new light. I also wrote this for medical professionals, big Pharma executives, scientists, and researchers for them to experience cancer and other medical issues from the patient’s perspective.

Fast Forward to Hope will be of value to you if you are looking to understand the realities of living with a cancer diagnosis, and finding your way through the odds to live with gratitude. Regardless of what your odds are, you will be able to explore your own truth as you walk with me through mine. I have curated the lessons I have learned since my diagnosis to keep hope strong, and it is my humble desire that you find one or two of them useful and applicable in your life.

The Book - Fast Forward to Hope

This book is divided into three parts.

In Part One, I share the story about my life with cancer (the “what”). In Part Two, I explore what enables me to continue to persevere even as I remain in treatment (the “how”). Ultimately, in Part Three, I try to understand why this journey was necessary for me, and how I have molded my life based on what I have learned (the “why”).

Truth be told, I wrote the last part first. I needed to understand for myself what I have gained from my challenges. In retrospect, I realized that I had unknowingly been an active participant in my recovery and healing. And that I have gained tremendously from being able to apply the lessons learned from dealing with cancer across all aspects of my life.

Fortified with this conscious understanding, I was then able to re-live the experience of getting cancer in Part One of the book. I found myself writing more to the process of getting diagnosed than the mechanics of the treatment. Writing the “what” part was hard in some places as I tried to write from the authenticity of the experience from my current place of stability. As I wrote, I walked through the realities of how I slowly found my feet, started to build courage, and take charge to stay one step ahead of the challenges.

In Part Two, I took a breath. I devoted this part to give respect to three major enablers that have carried me forward - science, humanity, and faith. I took on the business of science as well as paid heed to alternative therapies. In addressing humanity, I shared some difficulties, but mostly focused on the kindness of strangers and the genuine care I received from people across all parts of my life who held me in their love. With faith, I tried to articulate the light I followed as it radiated from my North Star.

Ultimately, I found my tools intuitively one at a time, and now - with Fast Forward to Hope - I have a tool kit I can share.

What I Need & What You'll Get

Fast Forward to Hope will be published with New Degree Press. We are now ready to launch a beta community for the book and start the pre-sales campaign! I invite you to invest in me, and support me in building the space for hope especially in these times.

 We have created the pre-order tiers to offer options for you to join the Author Community, and help me cover the costs of publishing this book. Money raised through the pre-sales will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, e-book formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch and promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish the book in the spring of 2021.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book ($5,000), I will publish a paperback and e-book.

When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book ($6,000), I will also publish a hardcopy edition.

When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book ($8,000), I will publish an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now including:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

About the Author

Indira Kaur Ahluwalia is an activist and entrepreneur turned advisor and coach, and now also an author.

Indira has worked in federal government contracting, particularly international development, to build equity, accountability and sustainability. Through her professional and personal endeavors, Indira has worked to strengthen equality, and social justice. Her paradigm is based on building the strength and achievements of all individuals, and the accessibility and efficiency of institutions to create mutual benefit, effectiveness, and success.

As Indira fulfilled her life’s passions and professional obligations, she was diagnosed with Stage IV advanced breast cancer with bone metastasis in May 2007. She is truly aware and grateful for the gift of her hard-fought life. Indira is dedicated to sharing what she has learned through her battles to enable others to face and walk beyond their own issues.

Indira is a practicing Sikh with Indian heritage who has lived in the Washington DC area since she was 15. A single mother to her teenage children, she loves the laughter of children, her mamma’s goat curry, and sitting at the beach’s edge watching the rising sun!

For more information, you can connect with Indira Kaur Ahluwalia at IndiraMyTruths@gmail.com and at https://www.facebook.com/indirakaur.ahluwalia and https://www.linkedin.com/in/indira-ahluwalia/.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing the signed copies into each pre-order tier for backers in the US.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help.

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #FastForwardtoHope and tag me (@IndiraKaurAhluwalia) as well as my publisher (@NewDegreePress), so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with your friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love, encouragement and support!

With my gratitude.
Indira Kaur Ahluwalia

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Poetic Matrix Press.

PO Box 1051 Lake Isabella, CA 93240

 www.poeticmatrix.com.

Poetic Matrix Press:

Poetic Matrix Press will publish Home Plate Was the Heart. This press has published in excess of 40 writers, including the work of Francisco X Alarcon, Brandon Cesmat, Shadab Zeest Hashimi, Tomas Gayton, Lyn Lifshin among many other poets. You can find out more about Poetic Matrix Press at its website at www.poeticmatrix.com.

We are offering for a contibution of $25 dollars a copy of the book, Home Plate Was the Heart.

For a contibution of $30 dollars the contributor will receive a signed copy of the book, Home Plate Was the Heart.

For a contibution of $ 40 dollars the contributor will receive a signed copy of the book, Home Plate Was the Heart along with Joe’s first book of poetry, The Lost Pilgramage Poems.

For a contibution of $ 50 dollars the contributor will receive a signed copy of the book, Home Plate Was the Heart along with Joe’s first book, The Lost Pilgramage Poems and his second book, Landscape of a Woman and a Hummingbird.

For a contibution of $75 dollars the contributor will receive a signed copy of the book, Home Plate Was the Heart along with his first book,The Lost Pilgramage Poems, his second book, Landscape of a Woman and a Hummingbird, and an anthology of Poetic Matrix Poets, So Many Voices.

Our goal is to achieve a total of $2,00.00. The funding from this project will be applied only to publishing and distribution.

We are working to select a cover that expresses the theme of the title story: Home Plate Was the Heart. We’ll keep you posted on our progress.

Joe’s Writing:

Joe writes narrative prose poems as well as flash fiction. The inspiration for his work comes from his memories of family and friends. Beginning with a particular memory, he created a story or prose poem around it. You can check out his work at www.poeticmatrix.com.

Sandra Alocosser has written about his work: Not unlike Orpheus, Joseph Milosch sings a song of earth, a song of work in a lyric voice that will lure readers to the vivid narratives of a good man’s life.

Oriana Ivy has written: His poems show the beauty of earth and human love without the slightest sentimentality…. His work is a feast of bracing, supple imagery that’s the opposite of anemic and academic.

William Luvaas has written about this manuscript: Joseph Milosch deftly accomplishes the poetic economy and emotional epiphany that writers of flash fiction regularly strive for but only rarely achieve. 

The Title:

We chose the title Home Plate Was the Heart and Other Stories because the work is about Joe's family immigration history and their initiation into the American culture. These stories came out of the memories of winter nights in the living room of his Polish grandparents’ house. His great-uncles and grandparents entertained themselves by telling stories of their lives during the Great Depression and the two world wars. These stories and prose poems are the base of his stories of growing up in their time and in the new time that he lived through.

Risks and Challenges:

The primary purpose for your contribution is to support Small Press publishers like Poetic Matrix Press and to be a part of the production of this book: Home Plate Was the Heart and Other Stories. Independent film producers have become the heart of the film industry; small press publishers have become the heart of the publishing world. They give voices to a vast number of writers. We have a six-week goal of $2,000.00, and your contribution is appreciated.

Credits:

Sandra Alocossar is a poet teaching at San Diego State University. She has published two books of poetry. Her book Except by Nature was chosen for the National Poetry Series, and her book A Fish to Feed All Hunger won the Associated Writing Program’s Award Series.

Oriana Ivy is a widely published poet and translator.

William Luvass honors include an NEA Fellowship in Fiction, Ist place in Glimmer Train’s Fiction Open Contest, and is Fiction Networks National Fiction Competition winner. He's  published three novels.

story:
We are The Infertility Doulas; bringing our own real-life stories, years of infertility experience, and the contributions of others we have met along the way who have similar stories to help guide your path. We are here to support women, men, and couples and have written this book so you do not feel alone. This 248-page softcover book contains stories and information on your body, your life, and alternative paths to parenthood. It truly is a friendly guide for when it is hard to get pregnant and brings a heartfelt voice to infertility awareness. 

We know that our family, friends, and fellow warriors in the fertility community will help us reach our goal of changing the stigma of the infertility world and bring this book to life! Without your help, this passion project may not become a reality. 

About the Authors
Tia Chapinski is a wife, stepmom, dog mom, and a newbie to the writing world who aspires to change the world of infertility. A certified medical assistant for fifteen years, she is currently a volunteer for Mentor North, a community-based mentoring organization. She lives in Duluth, Minnesota, with her husband, Jamie, stepdaughter, Karsyn, and their three dogs, Dubnyk, Aspen, and Alaska.

Daniella (Jaros) Virijevic is an advocate for women and infertility, a coffee lover, a sucker for a good British series, a wearer of comfy clothes, and someone you can lean on in good times and in bad. She obtained a bachelor’s degree in management from Mesa State College in Grand Junction, Colorado, and an MBA in IT Leadership and Master of Arts in Change Leadership from the College of Saint Scholastica in Duluth, Minnesota. She lives in Saint Paul, Minnesota, with her husband, Djordje, and two Shih Tzus, Jack and Teddi.

Where is the money going?
The money funded by this crowdfunding campaign, which we are using as a way for you to pre-order our book, will contribute to our printing costs. We currently have a goal of $10,000 and hope to reach that or beyond so we can contribute to the continuation of advocacy for the fertility community. We have created and designed a beautiful book that includes fertility facts, journaling pages, personal stories, and years of our own struggles. We have spent three years on this project to help others with the difficult journey of family building, as well as those who have been alongside those who have or are going through the journey. 
 
Also, we plan to build this into a brand with speaking engagements, coaching & consulting services, and a podcast.
 
Why is this book important?
This book is important because we want to help break down the stigma around infertility. The world of infertility is real and talked about more today, but still a taboo subject. We want to empower and encourage public understanding of infertility and family building and this book is a way to do that.

This project is also valuable because the book will be used as a tool for a much bigger outcome. We want to start coaching and consulting services to be there for individuals and couples who are struggling to conceive. You can hire a doula for pregnancy and birth, but have you ever been offered a doula for fertility support? This is our first venture; we want to be successful and change the loneliness of infertility.

Risks & Challenges
This has not been an easy journey, but we are here because of it.

We met in a fertility support group through RESOLVE, The National Infertility Association, that Daniella started in Duluth, Minnesota. We have put our vulnerability out there to the world and sharing our most private, deepest emotional moments on our own fertility journeys to write this book to help others. We have also asked friends, family, and specialists to give us their knowledge, advice, and own personal stories to make this book as raw and real as possible. We have invested a great deal of money for this personal risk. We dedicated hours of time while working professional jobs. We are honored and grateful for everyone who has taken this risk with us, which includes our husbands, contributors, and our publisher. We want to be a success story. We want to make a difference.
 
Other Ways You Can Help
We understand if you are unable to contribute, but that does not mean you cannot help by getting the word out and making some noise about our campaign! There will be multiple tools available to you for sharing. Speak up!
 
Our Publisher
Wise Ink Creative Publishing - Minneapolis, MN

Wise Ink is a creative publishing agency for game-changers. We love publishing books. We have helped more than four hundred authors bring their ideas from manuscript to print and we learned a few things.

We learned that authors need more. Authors need a strong platform, strategic marketing, top-notch editing, award-winning book design, and a creative team dedicated to helping you succeed beyond the book.
Wise Ink was created to help you—the author with a big picture and the passion to prove it—change the world.
