story:
Join the R-evolution!

We believe it is time for women to revolutionize the way they live, love and lead. And we have an inspiring vision and a guiding pathway to do just that!

Why does this matter? For five decades women have been strenuously adapting to a "hypermasculine" world built on the needs and values of the past.  That world was not able to see or activate all of our most potent, creative and joy-bringing potential. 

The primary way of being for women today is the result of this adaptation. And it has left many of us exhausted, unhealthy, and doubting ourselves. We long for something more fulfilling, more in tune with our nature, more able to make a difference in the world.

Further, the boundaries between our personal and professional lives are dissolving.  In a rapidly globalizing, massively interconnected world, we need to leverage, rather than resist, the interdependence between Living, Loving, and Leading. 

 

These turbulent and unpredictable times are calling forth a radically different way of being from us all. Which means we have to make a kind of evolutionary move to the next level of our capacity and fullness as women, bringing all of who we are into the world--and into the next level of co-creative relationship with men.

Now that’s R-evolutionary!

Our Project

After 12 years of research and field-testing with hundreds of women whose lives were profoundly changed by our deeply transformative leadership programs, we knew that in order to fulfill our mission, we must bring what we’ve learned out into the world in a book, so that it could benefit many more women.

We have done just that in writing the first draft! Now we are turning to Indiegogo—and to you---to fund the manuscript completion, editing, graphics and publishing so that this book can be a powerful catalyst of change for women--for the world!

We believe that this book can play a key role in bringing forth a startlingly new paradigm of leadership for women.  It is truly what our unprecedented times are calling forth. This book is not a tweak on the old, heroic industrial age model, but a magnetic and positive image of the future that can pull us all forward. 

This new paradigm will finally resonate with all of who we are as women, and who we are becoming.

Who Are We?

We are creative partners in an innovative, woman-owned social enterprise, Kore Evolution, dedicated to the mission of revolutionizing the way women live, love and lead so that they are able to dynamically shape these rapidly evolving times for future generations.  

In alliance with LIOS Graduate College of Leadership at Saybrook University, our women’s leadership certification combines an academically sound, rigorous, research-based curriculum with the ageless wisdom traditions, arts, and the deep practice of an urban mystery school.

The Timing

The right timing for this book to have maximum positive impact is soon after we collectively cross over that 2012 threshold--when we are all more open to a new worldview.

We want this book to be in the hands of women by early 2013--not in the 2 years that traditional publishing would take. We've discovered some counter-intuitive and potentially controversial things about this emerging new paradigm of leadership that will be especially suited to women. We want to be able to write it exactly as we see it!

Who's This Project For?

This book is for women who think it makes sense to 'be the change they want to see in the world', and it is for men who support the emergence of wise, loving and powerful women as agents of this creative change!

It will inspire and guide those who are determined to artfully navigate these wildly chaotic and creative times--no matter what life dishes up—while holding in their hearts a dream of co-creating a far better future for us all.  

Although women leaders will find this book life-changing, it is also intended for women who are not in traditional positions of authority and power, who have influence in other ways and are feeling a call to something more.  It may be you—or someone you know.

What's This Book About?

After more than a decade of designing, delivering, researching, and refining our highly successful suite of women’s leadership development programs, we began to notice a significant shift in our graduates.

They had access to the full spectrum of their beings – all of their Feminine and Masculine essences. They glowed with a radiant presence, their actions were aligned with their intentions, and they had a remarkable sense of self-confidence and true authority. They had unlocked a joyful creativity and an authentic way of being that was powerfully transformative.

We call this emerging woman...

Mysterial is a linguistic merging of the two words Mystery and Medial - two characteristics we saw consistently in these women. They had a remarkable ease with the unknown, chaotic and ambiguous – the Mystery, and they had developed the Medial capacity to bridge between differences, manage reactivity and find a creative middle way in challenging situations.

And when these two elements were integrally combined an inner alchemy occurred that led to a profound inner upgrade - revealing a radically new way of being, with many more creative options for action.

We call this of way of being in the world - The Way of the Mysterial Woman. 

An Inspiring Vision and a Guiding Pathway

There is a saying that goes, “If you can see it, you can be it.” Our book clearly articulates this new way of living, loving and leading so that you can see an alternative and inspiring vision of women's leadership. And it lays out the developmental pathway so that you can ‘be it’. 

We decoded an elegant developmental pathway, designed specifically for women, that consists of five distinct and sequential steps: The Mysterial Sequence™.  Through engaging case studies, drawn from our amazing graduates, our book describes the process for an individual woman in detail.  

Our book will also show that the Mysterial Sequence carries a very deep code, mapping directly to the major waves of cultural evolution from the very earliest days of our human family, to what is emerging now.

Here is a sneak preview of the outcomes of the deep work of transformation at each stage:

Step by step, The Mysterial Sequence opens an inner channel by unblocking and cultivating the natural healthy flow of our most primary Yin (Feminine) and Yang (Masculine) essences.  The final result is the emergence of a woman’s free flowing and natural Mysterial Leadership.

Why Women?

It’s so easy to take for granted all the powerful, capable women making things happen in the workplace and everywhere else. Yet this has been the case only within the last 50 years! It can be hard to appreciate the dramatic learning curve that women climbed in order to enter a world that for over five thousand years had been primarily organized by and for men (not wrong...just how it was).

Adapting to our hypermasculine environment wasn’t a mistake—it was a giant step for women. But squeezing into this ill-fitting suit leaves many of us today dissatisfied, unfulfilled, anxious, depressed, overweight, exhausted, and soul-deadened, to name just a few. Many women interpret these symptoms as their personal failure, yet our book will show that these are actually signs of their readiness for growth into Mysterial women.

By drawing upon futurists, scientists, developmental theorists, psychologists, and historians, our book shows clearly why women who have awakened to their full potential are going to be a rising force in the 21st century--and how they will partner in powerful co-creative ways with men.

Why Now?

Our world is poised at a critical tipping point, and history shows us that with similar inflections in the past, the world becomes very different, very quickly. Our research draws upon trends and insights into this fast approaching future that is, surprisingly, imbued with new and more complex feminine values and expressions - a dramatic break from our current cultural stereotypes.  

For example, our culture currently values endless, 24/7 growth. The steeper and straighter the incline, the better! Society admires the hero who pushes through and makes it happen.  Yet this eventually leads to crashes and tangles in our systems and our bodies. It’s unsustainable in the long run. In the coming future, we will recognize the importance of more complex restorative cycles in our systems, and in biological beings, and the value of allowing a creative project to gestate in right timing for the greatest benefit for all. We call this “unfolding the emergent”.   

As change continues to accelerate, we will value the capacity not only for rational analysis, but for multidimensional knowing-drawing upon our physical, emotional, cognitive, intuitive, and spiritual intelligences and using them skillfully together. That means greater wisdom and ease in relationship with one's self, with others, and the world.

And there’s lots more that we will share in our book about what it means in terms of very specific capacities for women to awaken their Mysterial Leadership capacity. 

Help us a Launch Mysterial Movement

We have learned that when women recognize themselves as Mysterials, they want to join with other Mysterial women. Our book can help them do that, as we will be offering ways for women to connect. We fully expect a Mysterial movement to materialize in the future, as these women join forces and hearts.

Come join us!

You can begin to co-create with us by helping us to get our book into the hands of the many women who need it and want it! Our book might just be that one flutter of a butterfly wing that sets in motion an amazing wave of change around the planet!

Here's how you can support our project and join our Mysterial Movement...

  1. Donate as soon as you can. This helps to generate interest and excitement in our project that will attract others. We have lots of great gifts on the right to match your generosity!
  2. Write a comment on the project site about why this book will make a difference. This affects the statistics of the project and helps raise our rankings (making us more visible).
  3. Make a referral - please send this email out to your networks - women and men you think will resonate with our message of hope and inspiration for a more positive future.
  4. Share the project on your Facebook page if you have one.
  5. Look for updates on the Indiegogo site and our Facebook page about our campaign and hold the intention with us that we reach our goal.

By getting our work out to a wider audience, you will be helping us fulfill our mission, and you will be acting as a R-evolutionary!

You might also check out our website www.koreevolution.com, and subscribe to our mailing list. We’d love to have you come along with us as we grow our Mysterial Movement!

What the Funds Will Make Possible

  • Manuscript completion: from our current first draft to fabulous final copy.
  • Editing: both developmental and copy editing
  • Layout and graphics (we love visual images!)
  • Indexing
  • Web page and social media set-up
  • Printing
  • eBook formatting and release

If we exceed our goal

  • Publicist: In order to fulfill our social mission, we need to spread our inspiring vision and guiding pathway to emerging Mysterial women everywhere. A couple months of publicist support with the book release can do wonders for making our book visible, and getting it into the hands of supporters who can help us build a following.
  • Speaking Tour: this will help us get out and give talks, meet women, and inspire them.
  • Create a non-profit Center for Mysterial Leadership that can be a gathering place for Mysterials worldwide.
  • Create a supportive network and online learning tools for women of the next generation, so that they can immediately get on the Mysterial path of development.

We are deeply grateful for the generosity of so many who have already contributed to this project:

  • Fabulous jazz musician Nora York and her Amazing Band.
  • Evocative artists A. Andrew Gonzalez and Lynda Lowe.
  • Our Mysterial sisters who have been with us on this journey.

       And we thank you for joining us and supporting this work!

We decoded an elegant developmental pathway, designed specifically for women, that consists of five distinct and sequential steps: The Mysterial Sequence™.  Through engaging case studies, drawn from our amazing graduates, our book describes the process for an individual woman in detail.  
Our book will also show that the Mysterial Sequence carries a very deep code, mapping directly to the major waves of cultural evolution from the very earliest days of our human family, to what is emerging now.
Here is a sneak preview of the outcomes of the deep work of transformation at each stage:

Step by step, The Mysterial Sequence opens an inner channel by unblocking and cultivating the natural healthy flow of our most primary Yin (Feminine) and Yang (Masculine) essences.  The final result is the emergence of a woman’s free flowing and natural Mysterial Leadership.
Why Women?
It’s so easy to take for granted all the powerful, capable women making things happen in the workplace and everywhere else. Yet this has been the case only within the last 50 years! It can be hard to appreciate the dramatic learning curve that women climbed in order to enter a world that for over five thousand years had been primarily organized by and for men (not wrong...just how it was).
Adapting to our hypermasculine environment wasn’t a mistake—it was a giant step for women. But squeezing into this ill-fitting suit leaves many of us today dissatisfied, unfulfilled, anxious, depressed, overweight, exhausted, and soul-deadened, to name just a few. Many women interpret these symptoms as their personal failure, yet our book will show that these are actually signs of their readiness for growth into Mysterial women.
By drawing upon futurists, scientists, developmental theorists, psychologists, and historians, our book shows clearly why women who have awakened to their full potential are going to be a rising force in the 21st century--and how they will partner in powerful co-creative ways with men.

Why Now?
Our world is poised at a critical tipping point, and history shows us that with similar inflections in the past, the world becomes very different, very quickly. Our research draws upon trends and insights into this fast approaching future that is, surprisingly, imbued with new and more complex feminine values and expressions - a dramatic break from our current cultural stereotypes.  
For example, our culture currently values endless, 24/7 growth. The steeper and straighter the incline, the better! Society admires the hero who pushes through and makes it happen.  Yet this eventually leads to crashes and tangles in our systems and our bodies. It’s unsustainable in the long run. In the coming future, we will recognize the importance of more complex restorative cycles in our systems, and in biological beings, and the value of allowing a creative project to gestate in right timing for the greatest benefit for all. We call this “unfolding the emergent”.   
As change continues to accelerate, we will value the capacity not only for rational analysis, but for multidimensional knowing-drawing upon our physical, emotional, cognitive, intuitive, and spiritual intelligences and using them skillfully together. That means greater wisdom and ease in relationship with one's self, with others, and the world.

And there’s lots more that we will share in our book about what it means in terms of very specific capacities for women to awaken their Mysterial Leadership capacity. 
Help us a Launch Mysterial Movement
We have learned that when women recognize themselves as Mysterials, they want to join with other Mysterial women. Our book can help them do that, as we will be offering ways for women to connect. We fully expect a Mysterial movement to materialize in the future, as these women join forces and hearts.
Come join us!
 
You can begin to co-create with us by helping us to get our book into the hands of the many women who need it and want it! Our book might just be that one flutter of a butterfly wing that sets in motion an amazing wave of change around the planet!
Here's how you can support our project and join our Mysterial Movement...


Donate as soon as you can. This helps to generate interest and excitement in our project that will attract others. We have lots of great gifts on the right to match your generosity!

Write a comment on the project site about why this book will make a difference. This affects the statistics of the project and helps raise our rankings (making us more visible).

Make a referral - please send this email out to your networks - women and men you think will resonate with our message of hope and inspiration for a more positive future.

Share the project on your Facebook page if you have one.

Look for updates on the Indiegogo site and our Facebook page about our campaign and hold the intention with us that we reach our goal.
By getting our work out to a wider audience, you will be helping us fulfill our mission, and you will be acting as a R-evolutionary!
You might also check out our website www.koreevolution.com, and subscribe to our mailing list. We’d love to have you come along with us as we grow our Mysterial Movement!
What the Funds Will Make Possible


Manuscript completion: from our current first draft to fabulous final copy.
Editing: both developmental and copy editing
Layout and graphics (we love visual images!)
Indexing
Web page and social media set-up
Printing
eBook formatting and release
If we exceed our goal

Publicist: In order to fulfill our social mission, we need to spread our inspiring vision and guiding pathway to emerging Mysterial women everywhere. A couple months of publicist support with the book release can do wonders for making our book visible, and getting it into the hands of supporters who can help us build a following.
Speaking Tour: this will help us get out and give talks, meet women, and inspire them.
Create a non-profit Center for Mysterial Leadership that can be a gathering place for Mysterials worldwide.
Create a supportive network and online learning tools for women of the next generation, so that they can immediately get on the Mysterial path of development.
We are deeply grateful for the generosity of so many who have already contributed to this project:

Fabulous jazz musician Nora York and her Amazing Band.
Evocative artists A. Andrew Gonzalez and Lynda Lowe.
Our Mysterial sisters who have been with us on this journey.
       And we thank you for joining us and supporting this work!

story:
What is Mighty Strong Girls and why should you care? 

Mighty Strong Girls is an alternative magazine, offering girls a realistic and positive perspective of their gender. It launched in November 2012 as an electronic magazine, but many moms and girls are asking for a printed version. How awesome would it be to see Mighty Strong Girls at grocery store checkout stands someday! 

Amy Denney, the publisher and founder of the ministry, has a background in journalism. She previously conceived and launched Springfield's Own magazine, a glossy, full-color lifestyle magazine affiliated with the State Journal-Register. 

She spent the past several years exploring programs for girls and working with teen girls at her church. Amy found many great programs but nothing that connected 100 percent with her vision to educate, empower, equip and encourage girls to discover their unique gifts and find their identity in Christ. 

With your help, we can get these important messages of TRUTH into the hands of more girls. We already know 75 percent of women and girls want to see more diversity and realistic body types in media. Now you can be a part of making that happen! This is an exciting opportunity for you to do something very tangible and super positive to help a generation of girls! 

 

What We Need & What You Get

It will cost $7,920, with printer expenses and fees, to get 2,000 copies of an 80-page magazine into circulation in central Illinois. We are seeking 80 individuals, businesses, churches or organizations who will become our PARTNERS IN PRINT. We set our goal lower than that because we've already collected a few and plan to seek partnerships in other venues, too! 

For $99, you can "buy a page." That's the cost of printing 2,000 copies of one magazine page. In turn, we will print 140-character messages from all of our partners on special pages in the magazine. This is a great way to send a love note to your own daughter or granddaughter, or to affirm beauty to all girls! Partners will also receive a complimentary copy of the magazine! 

The great part of this approach is that we won't have to rely on advertising dollars, and we can keep out the negative messages that are so prevalent in popular magazines.

If you can't afford it yourself, how about doing it with extended family or a group at your office or Sunday school class? Collect money for casual days, skip on a meal out every month or sell something you don't use or need anymore. 

If we don't reach our goal for our summer issue, we will use your donation with other fundraising projects to print our back-to-school issue in September. We would include your message in the first issue we are able to print. 

The Impact

Girls are already being moved to action by Mighty Strong Girls. In one case, a girl from Westside Christian Church in Springfield raised money to buy 230 Mighty Strong Girls T-shirts and recruited volunteers to write love notes to girls in Kenya, as reminder that they are valuable creations of God. She's delivering them on her mission trip this summer! Girls in Athens, Illinois, led a worship service to share the love of Christ with their congregation. 

They are contributors to the magazine. They are the stories. They are passionate about seeking and sharing a healthy, positive body image through Mighty Strong Girls. 

Take a look at the website at www.mightystronggirls.com. We already have a great start, plenty of experience and all tools we need. What we require now are the financial resources and prayers to lift off and let girls in central Illinois see what they want — realistic, diverse and faith-filled content in a magazine that covers everything from fashion and boys to faith and arts & crafts. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help with funding, that certainly doesn't mean you can't be a part of Mighty Strong Girls. We still desperately need you! 

You can: 

SHARE. Let everyone you know about this campaign, the magazine, the website, upcoming events. Become a Mighty Messenger for Mighty Strong Girls!

VOLUNTEER. We need writers, photographers and event volunteers. 

INVITE. We would love to come share our story with your group. 

Want to know more or let us know how you would like to help? Send an email to amydenney@mightystronggirls.com.

story:
Video Coming Soon!

What is Life.Data.Tech?

Your conceptions of life are backed by some serious data, whether you recognize it or not. We’re interested in the technology that brings this data to the forefront, and we’d like to share our findings with you in a long-form, transparent format that puts you closer to the source.

That means the best writers and the best minds producing long-form content that’s worth reading. From articles, to features, to editorials, interviews, infographics, and more, you can expect thoughtful, investigative literary pieces from Life.Data.Tech.

Writers are Life.Data.Tech’s rockstars. We give them flexible and fair licensing agreements, and they give the world stories worth reading. Fair trade? Fair trade. Not only that, but our writers are part of the story. How they found information, their process of writing, and the context of their interviews should be a part of their stories.

Of course, it’s not just about the writers… it’s about the readers too. The Life.Data.Tech golden rule is: Don’t waste our readers’ time. Don’t bullshit them. Make it easy for them to access our great content, and invite them to participate in every aspect of our operations.

The Data is the Story

Information is power. As often as possible, we will expose readers to the raw data. Full transcripts, the tables, the charts – as much data as they can handle, and in an accessible format. If you’ve ever read a story and found yourself wishing you could simply read the writer’s source material, you’re going to like us. We invite the readers to use the data to second guess us.

Backstage With Second Geek

Second Geek, as in, second opinion. Second Geek (2G) is our community website, where we take the readers backstage and invite them to participate in our editorial process. They can propose writers, stories, topics, and more. We want writers who will engage the reader, and continue the story with them after the story is published.

Alarmingly Transparent Operations

Nothing is off limits.

Our mission to provide the raw data doesn’t stop at the story. Virtually every aspect of Life.Data.Tech’s operations will be available on Second Geek. If you want to see our analytics, you can. If you want to see what stories are getting the page views, do it. We’ll even release entire packages of information, including communication between the editorial board members, as a sort of LDT “Quarterly Report.” If you’ve ever wondered whether a cozy relationship between a company and a publication resulted in favorable coverage, you’re going to like us; at LDT we encourage you to check our work.

Meet The Team

Raymond Angel Ray Angel currently spends the majority of his time at Founders in Fort Wayne, Indiana where he is co-Founder. Ray was previously the CEO of Startup Weekend, ThirdGeek and MOSH mobile. He also was the Managing Editor at XPreme Magazine and is a managing partner at Lion Fund.

James Fintel James Fintel is an I.T. administrator for a small business in Toledo, Ohio by day and a law student by night. He has also been involved with online media as a senior editor at ThirdGeek and XPreme Magazine. Jim takes a particular interest in the intersection of technology and law.

Katherine Whatley Kat has a history in communication and community engagement. She presently owns her own PR company, is launching a digital PR dashboard with Raymond Angel, and is working on a program that promotes local small businesses while teaching courses that benefit the local community.

Additionally, we have a team of developers, designers, authors, editors and more ready and excited to get to work on this project and turn it in to a company that is able to provide quality journalism.

Plan of Action

We want to live, eat, and breathe Life.Data.Tech to provide you with a fully complete, up-and-running website and community in three months. We’ll be putting aside everything else, including our day jobs, to make LDT a success.

What We Need

If our mission of quality, transparent journalism sounds as good to you as it does to us, then consider helping us succeed at it. The funding we raise on Indiegogo means we can focus on Life.Data.Tech, and hire writers who share our vision of what journalism could be.

We also need your help to get the word out about what we're trying to do. Make sure to tell your friends!

What You Get

Besides an entirely new take on journalism, you mean?

Anyone who contributes $5 will get early access to Second Geek. We’ll host regular chats with our team, live video feeds, and more. For those that contribute more, they can look forward to that access as well as other great rewards such as postcards, stickers, shirts, special badges on Second Geek, or even sponsorship of Life.Data.Tech.

story:
Who Am I

I am Abhishek Roy. A software engineer by profession, a writer and photographer by passion and a center of constant creative ideas would be the correct way to describe me as a person. I started writing stories and poems to unleash my feelings as I was not so good in expressing my feelings through verbal communication. That is how this hobby of writing started about 4 years back. My stories and poems are loosely based on people whom I encounter in my daily life. The stories I write are usually works of imagination marking a perfect blend of fantasy with reality while my poems portray lives of real people. Till date I have written quite a few stories (short, super short as well as long) and around 30 poems. I have published a few of them online through Amazon kindle bookstore and have received mixed reviews. (As expected for an amateur writer).

 My first success came at a short story competition for a leading newspaper in 2008 where my work was adjudicated as the Best Short Story Of the Season. I have also written reviews for movies and music albums in a few local newspapers and journals. I am often invited to write music reviews for the monthly newsletter at my workplace. (Check the media section for cover images of some of my works)

The Project

I have been planning on writing my next one which is currently my dream project (I have been planning the plot over the last two years). It will be a novel of epic proportion about Ourselves, Our Governments, God, Religions and our very existence itself. It will be a fiction but at the same time it will be based on facts with references to mythologies. I am working very hard researching the stuff in order to get my facts correct when I start writing it. I plan to begin around May 2014 and it should be completed by October 2014. 

I just completed my current story.This one deals with the adventures of a spy. It has lots of thrills and skills involved-  violence, drama, emotions and lots of twists and turns. The image of the Eye that you can see above is from the cover of that story.

Since I'll start working on the book around May and will take some time to complete it, as a perk for supporting the campaign, I wanted to introduce my social experiment on episode based reading. The experiment was already conducted on a group of friends when I wrote my first story Eleven Bullets back in 2008.

The basic process is to divide and write a story based on episodes (Just like in television series). As and when I complete an episode, I'll share the same with you. So in general, you will be receiving one episode at a time each week on your preferred reading medium. This will keep you on the edge of your seats and make you curious on how the story will proceed next week. As backers of my project, I'm offering you my first story Eleven Bullets for free in form of weekly episodes. Once you complete the same, you will receive weekly episodes of the story I am writing right now (It is still unnamed, but it is based on that Indian spy, terrorism, espionage and such cool stuff). And last but not the least, once you complete this, you will start receiving episodes of my actual project as I write along. You can even give me suggestions thereby making it a success one it is available to the market.

Hold on. It's not over yet. You will also get a digital version of the book before it is available for sale in the market.

Pretty good deal don't you think. It will keep you engaged for a year if you decide to pledge for me and my work today.

(Check the media section for cover images of some of my works)

What We Need

The novel that I am planning to write, will require detailed editing by a professional once it is complete. As per current estimates, it will require $300 for the first level of editing and then around $500 for the more detailed editing from a second level of editor. Apart from these, will need to go through Createspace to get hard copies of the book published through Amazon and amazon kindle if no other publishing companies show interest (As I am an amateur writer it is really difficult to find publishers unless you have access to big contacts or your work gets a lot of promotion). So to get a minimum of 200 copies to be printed through Createspace and then to send them over to me for distribution through other channels apart from Amazon will take around $700. The rest will be sold through Amazon. A kindle conversion fee will also be charged based on the actual volume of the book i.e. Total number of words.

Apart from these, a basic press release and setting up a dedicated website will take another $300. Based on the amount raised, I'll decide whether or not to go for a marketing package where the basic package is around $500 which includes printing of custom bookmarks promoting the book. I don't know as of now whether there will be any other costs as well.

So in total approximately at least $2500 will be required to make the project successful.

What You Get

As backers of my project, I'm offering you my first story Eleven Bullets for free in form of weekly episodes. Once you complete the same, you will receive weekly episodes of the story I just finished (It is still unnamed, but it is based on that Indian spy, terrorism, espionage and such cool stuff). And last but not the least, once you complete this, you will start receiving episodes of my actual project as I write along. You can even give me suggestions thereby making it a success one it is available to the market.

Hold on. It's not over yet. You will also get a digital version of the book before it is available for sale in the market.

And just when you thought it ended, the deal gets even bigger. All the backers will have their names listed on my book as contributors to the project.

Pretty good deal don't you think. It will also keep you engaged for a year if you decide to pledge for me and my work today.

The Impact

Any contribution you make will enable me to reach my dream of actually publishing my big work in form of Digital as well as Paperback editions. Also, your constant feedback will improve my writing in general and also improve the actual content of the story before it is out for the general public.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to pledge for my cause or are unsure about it, please help me in getting the word spread out to other people who may genuinely be interested. Use your social networks to help me rope people in. And who knows, maybe in future you will change your mind as well and support the cause. 

And last but not the least, I would like to thank you for visiting my campaign and reading through the information.

editing from a second level of editor. Apart from these, will need to go
through Createspace to get hard copies of the book published through Amazon and
amazon kindle if no other publishing companies show interest (As I am an
amateur writer it is really difficult to find publishers unless you have access
to big contacts or your work gets a lot of promotion). So to get a minimum of 200
copies to be printed through Createspace and then to send them over to
me for distribution through other channels apart from Amazon will take around $700.
The rest will be sold through Amazon. A kindle conversion fee will also be
charged based on the actual volume of the book i.e. Total number of words.
Apart from these, a basic press
release and setting up a dedicated website will take another $300.
Based on the amount raised, I'll decide whether or not to go for a marketing
package where the basic package is around $500 which includes
printing of custom bookmarks promoting the book. I don't know as of now whether
there will be any other costs as well.
So in total approximately at least $2500 will
be required to make the project successful.
What You Get
As backers of my project, I'm
offering you my first story Eleven Bullets for free in form of weekly episodes.
Once you complete the same, you will receive weekly episodes of the story I just finished (It is still unnamed, but it is based on that Indian spy,
terrorism, espionage and such cool stuff). And last but not the least, once you
complete this, you will start receiving episodes of my actual project as I
write along. You can even give me suggestions thereby making it a success one
it is available to the market.
Hold on. It's not over yet. You will
also get a digital version of the book before it is available for sale in the
market.
And just when you thought it ended,
the deal gets even bigger. All the backers will have their names listed on my
book as contributors to the project.
Pretty good deal don't you think. It
will also keep you engaged for a year if you decide to pledge for me and my
work today.
The Impact
Any contribution you make will enable
me to reach my dream of actually publishing my big work in form of Digital as
well as Paperback editions. Also, your constant feedback will improve my
writing in general and also improve the actual content of the story before it
is out for the general public.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you are unable to pledge for my
cause or are unsure about it, please help me in getting the word spread out to
other people who may genuinely be interested. Use your social networks to help
me rope people in. And who knows, maybe in future you will change your mind as
well and support the cause. 
And last but not the least, I would
like to thank you for visiting my campaign and reading through the information.

story:
Enter the Library (background)

Hi! I'm an artist, documentarian, preservationist, and Ingrid. I believe in archiving the amazing artistic movements and ideas represented by this unique time in history. I'm pro-resources, growth and innovation, paper, books, cookies, emergent media and libraries. I'm also part of the movement to revolutionize the library for our generation by making it a social space with convo and coffee. That's my long-term goal, creating Abacus Arts Library for thinkers and creatives like us. And some great pro-arts associates are helping me move this vision into reality.

The Important Stuff

To lead up to this arts library, I'll be cranking out a series of events. The first will be a story-collecting extravaganza that unifies Atlanta through words, called "abacus: art of storytelling". 

Like a photo captures a moment, we preserve moments in time by writing our stories. “Abacus: art of storytelling” seeks to present a time-capsule view of our shared history by allowing people to write a short story about a true event from their past that fits within the theme of "Mixed Media".

That means you can poke fun at Facebook, or talk about a television moment that transformed you. Divulge the artists’ secret you stumbled upon of using crumpled cans to create a masterpiece, or a trippy occurrence when you felt connected to the other side. Heck, if you want to stretch it really far, you can write on a mind-boggling medium coffee, medium rare steak, stretch the term as far as you can!

The stories collected will be used to varying degrees and bound into an anthology. The proceeds will fund Abacus Arts Library and future library events. The book will be released in March 2012 at a storytelling extravaganza at Room and Board. 


Ways people can share their story:

  1. Attend a write-in

          Write alongside friends during these nighttime social write-a-thons

          October 7    @ Bound to Be Read Books

          November 3 @ Charis Books

          more tba

     2. Drop it off at a local bookstore / arts organization 

        (boxes available October through December)

          Blue Elephant Bookshop 

          Bound to Be read Books

          Charis Books

          PushPush Theater

          WonderRoot

      3. Email it to Abacus

          submissions@artbooksculture.com

      4. Create a group story chat by chat on Facebook

          @ Murder We Twote

      5. Catch us out in the city

          We’ll be around Dragon Con, ACP, Atlanta Arts Festival

          look for Abacus: Art of Storytelling on Facebook or Twitter for updates


          Submissions open all fall! (til December 21st)

         Questions? Email info@artbooksculture.com


Why Stories?

Some things are classic, though we see signs of them slipping away. Talking to each other with our voices, visiting friends, writing a letter. Through stories, we preserve our own unique voices and all their quirks, our faulty grammar, our profane syntax, our misspellings. Imagine what would happen if we let Kindle dictate the size of our pages and Twitter dictate the length of our phrases. Let's stretch back into our grandest selves. Viva la palabra!

What a little moola can do...

Money raised will purchase collection boxes for bookstores, create promotional materials, keep business all nice and legit, print books and fund a stellar release party. Though there are 40 more days on this project, some funds are needed on the front end to get things going, and then at the back end to get the book into production, have it printed up, etc.


Other Ways You Can Help

1. Volunteer with this cause.


2. Donate books to the library from this Amazon wish list.


3. Share with your friends! Tweet, face, or whatever suits you. Thanks!


4. Write a letter and send it to a long-lost friend.


5. Recommend storytelling groups and lit-lovers that may want to be part of this project.


Many thanks!

Yours in art,

Ingrid

story:
What is Nightland Colouring Book?

Nightland Colouring Book follows a young child's journey through the night as Nightbird carries him between her wings across Nightland. There are many birds and beasts living in Nightforest, there are dragonboys and a witch with a thousand eyes. The child gets to see what happens to the Sun and the Moon at night. And he even finds out  what his parents are up to.

It is a book inspired by northern myth and folklore, visual traditions and landscapes. The cultural background and surroundings of my own childhood in South-Estonia, forests in every direction. 

Nightland Colouring Book reflects the understanding that there are things in the night that are best left alone but there are also hidden blessings. And help often comes unexpected. 

It is the kind of book I always wanted to experience. So I have created it.

I believe there is a need for an alternative to what is mostly offered and most easily accessible to very young children when it comes to books.

I believe young children deserve to be treated with respect. 

They deserve stories that are well written. 

They deserve questions that are left for them to answer. To be trusted to make up their own mind and at the same time to get to know the richness of where their cultural roots can reach. 


Nightland Colouring Book consists of twenty images (that can be coloured) and a story that goes with them. The originals of the illustrations are my ink drawings and I am also responsible for the concept of the book. The text has been co-written with Lemmit Kaplinski, a steampunk wizard and saviour of the art of printing. Translation assistance was given by Diana Norma Szokolyai, a poet and performance artist from NYC.

Nightland Colouring book has already been published in Estonian and has proven itself to work for many people of different age groups. Its Estonian version also already has a small international following.

Who am I?

I am Ellom, a writer and illustrator from Tartu, Estonia. My first passion is poetry and poetic collaboration but I have also worked with children's books for some time, published three books for young children in Estonia and illustrated a collection of Saami fairy-tales. I come from a literary background, have studied both folklore and linguistics and have years of experience working with the very young. And I am a mother. 

Why this way?

My publishers in Estonia have found their true passion and decided to become a printing museum. I fully support them in that endeavour (and recommend to visit them in Tartu!) but that means I am on my own when looking for a way to make Nightland Colouring Book available internationally. I have all the rights to my work (and agreements with collaborators) so I am also free to do what I want with it.

Making the book available in English is a natural development - as much as Nightland Colouring Book draws inspiration from traditional cultures and the place where I was born, my community of friends and work-partners is very much international. This book is for that community. For those I know and who are already fans of the book and for those out there whom I don't know but who have been longing for this kind of vision or feel they click with it. 

I feel crowdfunding is a very good way to reach the people whom this book might make happy. It is direct, flexible and personal. 

And exciting. 


How to support Nightland Colouring Book?

The idea of crowdfunding is simple and beautiful - if you want to see the book come to life, you can make it happen. 

By putting some money into it and by spreading the word to all you know who might be interested. 

You will also receive something, in addition to taking part in a book's creation - there are different perks, from a pdf to an original drawing. Some of them come signed and with handwritten inscriptions or are created specifically for this indiegogo project.

If you have no money to give but feel excited about the book and want to come on board, just spreading the word is really really helpful. Very much appreciated! 

Word of mouth, email, facebook, twitter . . . any environment where you like to share about this project is good. There is also the campaign video that you can link, on vimeo and on youtube.

Where will the money go?

The funds I receive will be used for the following: 

Paying to everyone involved in this project, which includes paying for a new layout for this edition.

Printing an initial run of 500 copies of Nightland Colouring Book and shipping the ordered copies.

Buying me some weeks off my day job to re-work a few of the images, organize the printing and shipping and possibly create new drawings for you. 

Indiegogo and Paypal fees.

If there should be extra funds (which would be wonderful), they will be put towards my next project - "The Book of Animalpeople". It will be a book comparable to Nightland Colouring Book in theme and style, but has less emphasis on colouring and more on detailed images. You can see some of the illustrations for that book, and some of my other work at ellom.net (direct link to Animalpeople illustrations here).

I have planned to get the books to you by early spring, there is reasonable hope that it will happen earlier but have to take into account possible delays at printers and, always, the unexpected. There will be updates and explanations if the schedule should change.

Thank you for stumbling here (or coming on purpose)! 

Here's to hoping we can make this happen!

ellom

story:
100% Funded! No wait...106% Funded

Are you serious!!!!????!!! Seriously??!!!!!

And wait...indiegogo has the campaign now on their home page?

I am floored!  All of you made this possible!  11 days remaining and this baby, this hope to get to DR for this conference...you did this!  All of you made this possible!  You got the word out, you donated what you could, you gave big and small and ya'll did this! 

Thanks to all of you who have contributed, passed it on to folks, sent encouragement via FB, phone, email and in prayer.  Ya'll are hella dope! 

On the topic of perks, I’m steady at work with the necklaces, finshed the juju mini chapbooks packs, will soon be gearing up for creating the sound and video pieces, but the chapbooks classics are gonna take some additional spending to produce.

What do I need? Roughly $150. The 9% indiegogo fee takes a portion of the monies raised and I forgot to factor that in.  So coming in a shy over $150 AND the projected goal would balance everything out.

This cost includes making two-side copies of 2, 5, 6, and 10 page chapbooks, cardstock for the covers plus printing the covers. This will also cover the cost of mailing envelops. It may also cover the cab fare to and from the airport in NYC and the Dominican Republic if I raise more than that!

11 days left, big or small, if I can make up some of the cost of materials, wonderful.  If I cannot, that does not stop the factory. Perks will be sent out regardless.  Just remember, the necklaces take a little longer than a zerox machine. 

Thank you everyone for getting me to this point.  I just sent the conference organizer the good news!

I'm going to the Transnational Black Feminist Conference in the Dominican Republic!  Thank you! Virtual hugs! Love to all. LaT

 

¿Que Eso?

Howdy, my name is LaTasha Diggs. I am a poet, a vocalist, a video artist, and an independent artistic director/curator.  I have been invited to participate in a weeklong, grassroots political/intellectual conference on Black Feminism in the Dominican Republic from March 10 - 17, 2013. An incredible group of people - artists, activists and scholars will all gather for dialogue, engagement, and reflection. Not only will it allow me the rare opportunity to meet with organizations like Mujeres de Descendencia Haitiana, Instituto Sociales de las Antillas, and Ile Iya Abbebe Oshun, it will help me continue developing a project I began in 2007 on women of African/Indigenous descent. I’ve launched this campaign to raise 2,023 dollars so I can attend this conference in the Dominican Republic and I cannot do it without you. 

 

I now have 15 days to raise the registration fee and book my plane ticket.

Your support is needed to help make this journey a reality!

Will you donate what you can and help me get there?

 

So a little more about this new journey

 

From the Transnational Black Feminist invitation letter:

     “The purpose of the retreat is to ask the question: what does it mean to conceptualize and enact a transnational black feminist praxis?  As part of the retreat, we will visit with local organizations and with local groups of black women and black feminist activists, artists and scholars to hold conversations about this question. In addition to being part of conversations with folks here, we will have a day to retreat and to reflect, process and develop work from our experiences.  We will then have the opportunity to share our insights/analyses with a larger audience at a one-day conference, to be held at INTEC-Center for Women and Gender Studies. As part of participating in the Retreat, we would collectively form a presentation shaped by our conversations and experiences from the week.  The idea is to assess the current dynamics of the playing field while also fostering intentional and deep conversation about black feminist praxis in and between the Global South and the Global North.”

 

¿el impacto?

I really cannot express how badly I want to attend this gathering. With this call I have the chance to reach out and expand my awareness of the African Diaspora in the Dominican Republic. I have an opportunity to work with other women whose work shares some commonality to my own. It will help me focus on the larger themes present in my project Un Momento; gender, race, identity, history, landscape.  Participating at the Black Feminism Retreat/Conference could also lead to additional engagements and creative collaborations. Above all, I desperately need to attend this conference. I want to be shaped by what I will learn in discussion with those invited. I want it to shape my project and my creative process in ways I can only imagine. I want to become a stronger woman, artist, and organizer. I simply don’t want to miss out on something that could help my understanding of feminist studies in the Americas.

 

lo que necesito & lo que usted conseguirá

My campaign goal is $2023 and here’s what I am hoping this campaign will cover a portion of:

  • 580.00 Registration Fee
  • 710.00 Airfare plus Travel Insurance and visa (this is Spring Break Week so airfare prices may change if I don't book soon)
  • 200.00 Food outside of the conference/retreat
  • 200.00 Incidental expenses
  • 200.00 Super Emergency
  • 143.00 Goes towards insuring that perks are shipped in a timely manner.

This would cover airfare and baggage fees from New York to Dominican Republic, breakfast (Lunch and Dinner are included in the registration fee), additional ground transportation, incidental /emergency expenses, and making sure all swag is sent to you without much delay.

 

Before the journey

In July of 2010, I traveled to Peru to do research for a series of poems, songs, and meditations entitled “Un Momentu.”  The project’s central figure is Micaela Bastidas, the revolutionary martyr and wife of rebel leader Tupac Amaru.  During my research, I have discovered a handful of documents that describe Bastidas as being of African and Andean mixture. This is what initially sparked my curiosity and how I came to spend six weeks traveling to various parts of Peru. The project looks at ethnic identity during Colonial Peru, the relationships between Africans, Free Blacks and Andeans. It takes into question, what life was for Bastidas as an Afro-Peruana and if she “passed” given the time. In this portion of the work, I am examining the imagined and the factual. The project also looks at identity within contemporary visual arts and how it is capitalized upon or not in the art world.


My six weeks in Peru was life changing and left me with a lot of material and the desire to return to continue my research so that I may tell Micaela’s story and that of the women of Peru who talked to me in the streets in Lima, in small local restaurants in Cuzco, in their homes in EL Carmen and Arequipa, and on a boat upon Lake Titicaca.  But while the date to return to Peru is pending, I now have once in a lifetime occasion to learn about women and the role of black feminism in the Dominican Republic.

¿por que?

You may be asking yourself, what does this have to do with Peru?   This event, the first of its kind in Dominican Republic will be held this year from March 10 to March 17.  It invites a small group of women from Latin America, the Caribbean and North America. I cannot explain how much I am honored to be one of the women invited.  I cannot explain how much this is a historical undertaking.  While the organizers cannot pay my airfare or provide a per diem, the registration fee (dirt cheap) covers all lodging, meals (lunch and dinner), ground transportation to and from workshops, talks, historical tours AND a translator.  This is not something to be taken for granted.  They understand the importance of making connections and not wanting the interference of US funding mechanisms.  They know that the women invited represent of range of artists, scholars, activists, and writers who in and outside of the academic field.  This is a grassroots effort.

 

comida buena y cariño

If you know me, I love creating artifacts/gifts/tokens that both represent my gratitude and desire to make folks warm and fuzzy.  Anything from cupcakes to flan to lemon tarts to posters.  For your contribution you’ll receive:

 

  • Postcards from the Dominican Republic (I will write you personally a little note about my week there),
  • Limited edition reprints of chapbooks published between 1996 and 2011
  • One of a kind, handmade single strand beaded necklaces (made with a combination of glass, seed and metal beads, and bone...no two are alike!)
  • A once in a lifetime music track (only three will be offered) created just for YOU!
  • If you’re a lover of words and moving image, a 3-minute text-video piece especially made for YOU (Limit 2). If you’re curious about the videos I've created in the past for performances at MoMA PS1 and Brooklyn Museum, you can check them out HERE. 

 

As a curator and artistic director, I’ve co-presented many events in New York City, largely focused on poetry and music. I’ve been very fortunate to co-present these events at venues like El Museo del Barrio, Lincoln Center Out of Doors, Bowery Poetry Club, the Schomburg Center for Black Culture and BAM Cafe.  One of the most rewarding things about the events, concerts, and readings I’ve presented is highlighting women artists, musicians, poets — young and old — in life and in craft. I find this kind of work is part of my role as a woman artist.  While I work hard to improve my own creative work, I must, when given the opportunity, support other women.  I also enjoy giving younger women the opportunity to learn the ins and outs of producing a show. For me, it’s just as important to know how to produce an event as it is to be a seasoned artist.  In the end, it makes me feel pretty darn good to see other women artists succeed, to be introduced to different audiences, to be given a chance. 

 

¿no dinero? ok you're broke

I understand that many folks simply don't have the funds and won't be able to contribute, that it's a seriously bad time and may want to help in other ways. One way you can is by getting the word out and channeling that wonderful shampoo commercial of the past.   Please share with folks you know who may share the same interests I have.  Share it with folks who just like supporting artists and their ventures.  Write a note to someone about my project. 

 

So there it is in a nutshell.  By helping me attend this conference in the Dominican Republic, you’re becoming a supporter, a benefactor, a long lost auntie, uncle, cousin, older sibling who believes in my work and its role in the larger conversation surrounding women in the arts.   Thank you all for checking out my campaign and I sincerely hope I’ll be able to bless your mailbox with goodies of thanks. 

Blessings.  LaTasha Diggs
story_txt:
100% Funded! No wait...106% Funded
Are you serious!!!!????!!! Seriously??!!!!! 
And wait...indiegogo has the campaign now on their home page?
I am floored!  All of you made this possible!  11 days remaining and this baby, this hope to get to DR for this conference...you did this!  All of you made this possible!  You got the word out, you donated what you could, you gave big and small and ya'll did this!  
Thanks to all of you who have contributed, passed it on to folks, sent encouragement via FB, phone, email and in prayer.  Ya'll are hella dope!  
On the topic of perks, I’m steady at work with the necklaces, finshed the juju mini chapbooks packs, will soon be gearing up for creating the sound and video pieces, but the chapbooks classics are gonna take some additional spending to produce. 
What do I need? Roughly $150. The 9% indiegogo fee takes a portion of the monies raised and I forgot to factor that in.  So coming in a shy over $150 AND the projected goal would balance everything out.
This cost includes making two-side copies of 2, 5, 6, and 10 page chapbooks, cardstock for the covers plus printing the covers. This will also cover the cost of mailing envelops. It may also cover the cab fare to and from the airport in NYC and the Dominican Republic if I raise more than that!
11 days left, big or small, if I can make up some of the cost of materials, wonderful.  If I cannot, that does not stop the factory. Perks will be sent out regardless.  Just remember, the necklaces take a little longer than a zerox machine.  
Thank you everyone for getting me to this point.  I just sent the conference organizer the good news! 
I'm going to the Transnational Black Feminist Conference in the Dominican Republic!  Thank you! Virtual hugs! Love to all. LaT
 
¿Que Eso?
Howdy, my name is LaTasha Diggs. I am a poet, a vocalist, a video artist, and an independent artistic director/curator.  I have been invited to participate in a weeklong, grassroots political/intellectual conference on Black Feminism in the Dominican Republic from March 10 - 17, 2013. An incredible group of people - artists, activists and scholars will all gather for dialogue, engagement, and reflection. Not only will it allow me the rare opportunity to meet with organizations like Mujeres de Descendencia Haitiana, Instituto Sociales de las Antillas, and Ile Iya Abbebe Oshun, it will help me continue developing a project I began in 2007 on women of African/Indigenous descent. I’ve launched this campaign to raise 2,023 dollars so I can attend this conference in the Dominican Republic and I cannot do it without you. 
 
I now have 15 days to raise the registration fee and book my plane ticket. 
Your support is needed to help make this journey a reality! 
Will you donate what you can and help me get there?
 

So a little more about this new journey

 
From the Transnational Black Feminist invitation letter:
     “The purpose of the retreat is to ask the question: what does it mean to conceptualize and enact a transnational black feminist praxis?  As part of the retreat, we will visit with local organizations and with local groups of black women and black feminist activists, artists and scholars to hold conversations about this question. In addition to being part of conversations with folks here, we will have a day to retreat and to reflect, process and develop work from our experiences.  We will then have the opportunity to share our insights/analyses with a larger audience at a one-day conference, to be held at INTEC-Center for Women and Gender Studies. As part of participating in the Retreat, we would collectively form a presentation shaped by our conversations and experiences from the week.  The idea is to assess the current dynamics of the playing field while also fostering intentional and deep conversation about black feminist praxis in and between the Global South and the Global North.”
 

¿el impacto?

I really cannot express how badly I want to attend this gathering. With this call I have the chance to reach out and expand my awareness of the African Diaspora in the Dominican Republic. I have an opportunity to work with other women whose work shares some commonality to my own. It will help me focus on the larger themes present in my project Un Momento; gender, race, identity, history, landscape.  Participating at the Black Feminism Retreat/Conference could also lead to additional engagements and creative collaborations. Above all, I desperately need to attend this conference. I want to be shaped by what I will learn in discussion with those invited. I want it to shape my project and my creative process in ways I can only imagine. I want to become a stronger woman, artist, and organizer. I simply don’t want to miss out on something that could help my understanding of feminist studies in the Americas.
 

lo que necesito & lo que usted conseguirá 

My campaign goal is $2023 and here’s what I am hoping this campaign will cover a portion of:

580.00 Registration Fee
710.00 Airfare plus Travel Insurance and visa (this is Spring Break Week so airfare prices may change if I don't book soon)
200.00 Food outside of the conference/retreat
200.00 Incidental expenses
200.00 Super Emergency
143.00 Goes towards insuring that perks are shipped in a timely manner.
This would cover airfare and baggage fees from New York to Dominican Republic, breakfast (Lunch and Dinner are included in the registration fee), additional ground transportation, incidental /emergency expenses, and making sure all swag is sent to you without much delay.
 
Before the journey 
In July of 2010, I traveled to Peru to do research for a series of poems, songs, and meditations entitled “Un Momentu.”  The project’s central figure is Micaela Bastidas, the revolutionary martyr and wife of rebel leader Tupac Amaru.  During my research, I have discovered a handful of documents that describe Bastidas as being of African and Andean mixture. This is what initially sparked my curiosity and how I came to spend six weeks traveling to various parts of Peru. The project looks at ethnic identity during Colonial Peru, the relationships between Africans, Free Blacks and Andeans. It takes into question, what life was for Bastidas as an Afro-Peruana and if she “passed” given the time. In this portion of the work, I am examining the imagined and the factual. The project also looks at identity within contemporary visual arts and how it is capitalized upon or not in the art world.
 My six weeks in Peru was life changing and left me with a lot of material and the desire to return to continue my research so that I may tell Micaela’s story and that of the women of Peru who talked to me in the streets in Lima, in small local restaurants in Cuzco, in their homes in EL Carmen and Arequipa, and on a boat upon Lake Titicaca.  But while the date to return to Peru is pending, I now have once in a lifetime occasion to learn about women and the role of black feminism in the Dominican Republic.
¿por que?
You may be asking yourself, what does this have to do with Peru?   This event, the first of its kind in Dominican Republic will be held this year from March 10 to March 17.  It invites a small group of women from Latin America, the Caribbean and North America. I cannot explain how much I am honored to be one of the women invited.  I cannot explain how much this is a historical undertaking.  While the organizers cannot pay my airfare or provide a per diem, the registration fee (dirt cheap) covers all lodging, meals (lunch and dinner), ground transportation to and from workshops, talks, historical tours AND a translator.  This is not something to be taken for granted.  They understand the importance of making connections and not wanting the interference of US funding mechanisms.  They know that the women invited represent of range of artists, scholars, activists, and writers who in and outside of the academic field.  This is a grassroots effort.
 
comida buena y cariño
If you know me, I love creating artifacts/gifts/tokens that both represent my gratitude and desire to make folks warm and fuzzy.  Anything from cupcakes to flan to lemon tarts to posters.  For your contribution you’ll receive:
 

Postcards from the Dominican Republic (I will write you personally a little note about my week there),
Limited edition reprints of chapbooks published between 1996 and 2011
One of a kind, handmade single strand beaded necklaces (made with a combination of glass, seed and metal beads, and bone...no two are alike!)
A once in a lifetime music track (only three will be offered) created just for YOU!
If you’re a lover of words and moving image, a 3-minute text-video piece especially made for YOU (Limit 2). If you’re curious about the videos I've created in the past for performances at MoMA PS1 and Brooklyn Museum, you can check them out HERE. 
 
As a curator and artistic director, I’ve co-presented many events in New York City, largely focused on poetry and music. I’ve been very fortunate to co-present these events at venues like El Museo del Barrio, Lincoln Center Out of Doors, Bowery Poetry Club, the Schomburg Center for Black Culture and BAM Cafe.  One of the most rewarding things about the events, concerts, and readings I’ve presented is highlighting women artists, musicians, poets — young and old — in life and in craft. I find this kind of work is part of my role as a woman artist.  While I work hard to improve my own creative work, I must, when given the opportunity, support other women.  I also enjoy giving younger women the opportunity to learn the ins and outs of producing a show. For me, it’s just as important to know how to produce an event as it is to be a seasoned artist.  In the end, it makes me feel pretty darn good to see other women artists succeed, to be introduced to different audiences, to be given a chance. 
 

¿no dinero? ok you're broke
I understand that many folks simply don't have the funds and won't be able to contribute, that it's a seriously bad time and may want to help in other ways. One way you can is by getting the word out and channeling that wonderful shampoo commercial of the past.   Please share with folks you know who may share the same interests I have.  Share it with folks who just like supporting artists and their ventures.  Write a note to someone about my project. 
 
So there it is in a nutshell.  By helping me attend this conference in the Dominican Republic, you’re becoming a supporter, a benefactor, a long lost auntie, uncle, cousin, older sibling who believes in my work and its role in the larger conversation surrounding women in the arts.   Thank you all for checking out my campaign and I sincerely hope I’ll be able to bless your mailbox with goodies of thanks. 
Blessings.  LaTasha Diggs

story:
A short synopsis on my book project.

In the winter of 2011, I decided to see a therapist about a childhood trauma that I had been dealing with for a long time. My husband Kyle referred me to therapist and three days later I was sitting on his couch. Like many people, I didn't think that therapy was for me, and so I was skeptical when I arrived. Five minutes into our meeting, I knew I had come to the right place, and would finally be getting the help that I had needed for thirty years. Dr. Harrison turned out to be the complete package. He was also an ordained minister which worked great for me. I needed spiritual healing as well.

I had about four or five more much needed sessions with Dr. Harrison. During our last session we spoke about forgiveness. Like many people who have been wronged, and have been carrying anger for a long time, I wasn't sure I was ready to deal with forgiveness. I am being honest when I say that this was probably the most difficult session I had with the good therapist. Up until that point, I was one of those people who thought that as long as I was harboring un-forgiveness in my heart, the person towards whom my anger was being directed was being punished. It gave me some sort of power over them that made me feel better- plain and simple. I was happy to carry that un-forgiveness for as long as I could .

He said that because I had told him that I was a practicing Christian, I had to recognize that God loves everyone, is in everyone and everything. One cannot say that they love God and not love their neighbor including those that hate and hurt us. I have to tell you this is one aspect of Christianity that has always been hard for me to swallow, and I shared that with him. How can I possibly love somebody who did something so vile to me?  I knew that he could tell what I was thinking, because he gave me that look as though to say-wait a minute, I am going somewhere with this. He said that as difficult as it may seem, I had to understand that everything that happens in our lives, is meant to prepare us to fulfill the true purpose of our lives. People come into our lives, regardless of their intentions to arm us with the tools to deal with life’s constant and never ending trials and tribulations. Everybody that touches our lives leaves an imprint and all these imprints form a tapestry of experience that requires both the good and bad to help us build strength, endurance, wisdom, empathy, Grace and ultimately character.

“Consider yourself fortunate when all kinds of trails come your way"he sais, for you know that when your faith succeeds in facing such trails, the result if the ability to endure”, he quoted from the bible book of James. ”You have to let it go”, he said.” “That anger is taking up space in your heart that you could replace with things that would allow you to live your best life. You are not the one that committed the crime, why are you the one serving the sentence?” This question was so profound; it rendered my stubborn mind silent and slowly my spirit was starting to receive the message.

The he shred with me  the Old Testament bible story of how Joseph had been sold into slavery by his brothers. As the story goes, after initially facing numerous hardship during his years of servitude, Joseph become governor of Egypt and in spite of everything invited his brothers and Father to live with him and share in his good fortune. When their father Jacob died, the brothers became afraid that Joseph would take revenge for what they had done to him. So they sent a message to him saying that it was their father's dying wish that he forgive them, for what they had done to him. What they didn't know is that Joseph bore no ill will and he said to them:

'You intended to harm me, but God intended it all for good. He brought me to this position so I could save the lives of many people.' Genesis 50.20

Everything stopped. My entire being and all my senses stood up at full attention. Then as though it had been hovering over me for a while, what I can only describe as the grace of realization and revelation softly landed and absorbed into my spirit and just like that everything made sense and for the first time in my life- I GOT IT.

I was born to a life of priviledge in the small East African Nation of Uganda.At the age of seven and for a year after that, I was sexually abused and molested by a relative-right under my parents' nose.The abuse changed the trajectory of my life and as a result,I lived in shame and darkness for than thirty years-basically all of my life.I maintained the appearance that everything was good, but I was slowly dying and did almost die at one point.Understanding for the first time that all was not lost and that I could choose to end my pain, by refusing to look at my experience as a Curse but as a Cause ; was life altering.After finding peace of mind for the first time in my life,I knew had to find a way to make the experience worthwhile for others going through similar situations. So I decided to write a Book about my life and hopefully start of movemnt of hope for the abused and wounded,to inspire others that the choice to end their suffering is in their hands , and no one elses.

Why an Indiegogo campaign?

The tenatative book release date for this book is September 10th ,2012 ,but before this release date there is still alot of strings that need to be tied up.To produce a quality product ,I need quality logistics that come with quality pricing.In order to get this book into the market place I need approximately $12,000:

  • I need to pay publishing costs
  • I need to hire an editor for final draft revision
  • I need to hire a PR firm to handle the marketing because this is an important  message that I intend to spread effecetively far and wide.

*What happens if I raise money over and above the goal? I will use that to fascilitate travel to speaking engagements and workshops that I intend to hold to further tell my story.

The Perks

$5 Bless your heart perk

I understand you want to help, but the economy isn't the best. At the $5 level you can support the campaign and share it with your friends and family on Facebook and Twitter and I will be sure to mention you in the acknowledgements on my Facebook page.Every little bit helps!

$25 High five perk

You have my eternal gratitude for believing in me and my message enough to donate and I will add your name in the acknowledgements on my Facebook page  and will give you a shout out every chance I get. Plus you will get an autographed 8x10 color poster of the project.

$50 That’s what am talking about perk

You have my eternal gratitude for believing in me and my message enough to donate and I will not only add your name in the acknowledgements on my Facebook page, I will also send you a CD compilation of my personal playlist of my all time favorite songs of inspiration and a free download of the eBook for kindle, Nook or iPad.

$100 Money bags perk

You have my eternal gratitude for believing in me and my message enough to donate and I will not only add your name in the acknowledgements on my Facebook page, I will also give you a free download of the eBook for kindle, Nook or iPad plus an Tag less cotton T-shirt with the phrase “you meant to harm me, but God meant it for good".

$250 High Roller level

You have my eternal gratitude for believing in me and my message enough to donate and I will not only add your name in the acknowledgements on my Facebook page, I will also give you a free download of the eBook for kindle, Nook or iPad plus a Tag less cotton T-shirt  with the phrase “you meant to harm me, but God meant it for good”, plus an autographed hard copy of the book  before the release date. I will also call and thank you personally over Skype or over the phone.

$500 Benefactor level

You will have my gratitude forever. Not only will you get all the other perks, but you will be acknowledged in the book and I will make a personal appearance at your book club, small group, church etc.

$1000 Wawi Kazawi Level!

You have gone above the call of duty by deeming me worthy of your hard earned money. I thank you eternally. You get all the perks above plus an honorable mention in the book and all my media pages. There is nothing I can do to ever repay you but all I can say is may all your dreams come true for making my dream come true.

My intention

The issue of child abuse and child molestion has become something that in many ways we have become numb to .We hear about these cases on the news and read about them in the paper all the time,and are affected only momentarily, because we think that some one else will deal with it.One of out every three women is a victim of some sort of sexual abuse as a child or adult and the number is quickly growing for boys and men.This book however,is not just about molestation-but the overall human experience with being stuck and unable to move on.Not every one can afford a therapist or proffesional help,but if we can help eachother along,in whatever way we can, we can make a difference.That is why we survive-to help others.My intention for this book is that it the lessons therein will help set someone else free.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you just can’t contribute financally.Trust me I know that things are not easy out there, but you can still help.

  • Please spread the word.Tell everybody you know that may be able to help about my project.
  • I make personal apperances and would love to come to your church ,community,organisation or instituition and tell my story.

About the Author

L.B Kelle is a Las Vegas based author,wife and mother of two that is basking in the dawn of a new day.Her first book will be released mid september .You can contact her at www.facebook.com?lillian.butelekelle or by email at lillian@lilliankelleproductions.com or follow me on twitter at lillian#lillybuts
