story:
The Proposal


The Word on the Street is a national outdoor literary festival that takes place in 6 Canadian cities. I would like to take part in the 17th annual Halifax The Word on the Street Festival on September 25th.  15,000 attendees are expected to visit the festival in Halifax this year. Having an exhibitor's table at this festival and doing a reading would be an incredible amount of professional exposure for me and would allow me to interact with a number of readers, which could increase my sales and fan base.


For more information about this great festival, click here.


The Impact

Going to festivals and literary conventions is imperative to my career. Regardless of the number of sales I make on these trips, making contact with literary publishers, fellow writers, and fans is priceless. These events fuel my creativity, keep me excited about what's happening in literature today and inspire me to keep writing.  As a writer in PEI, I earn well below the poverty level, so it's difficult for me to attend many festivals, especially the bigger, more popular ones, like The Word on the Street, that charge table fees.


What I Need & What You Get

A table at the convention - $300

Participation in Book Bag Treasure Hunt - $65

(this is a super promo tool that ensures that 250 attendees will visit my table to get a bonus literary gift from me)

2 nights hotel - 215

Gas and bridge fee to Halifax - 120

....Total cost of participation = $700 (I will cover my food and other expenses)


As a bonus and THANK YOU to you for contributing:

- Donors of $10 will receive either a Hide Your Life Away or A Study in Love magnet

- Donors of $15 will receive both a Hide Your Life Away and A Study in Love magnet

- Donors of $20 will receive an autographed copy of my award winning novel Hide Your Life Away

- Donors of $30 will receive an autographed copy of my award nominated poetry collection A Study in Love

- Donors of $45 will receive an autographed copy of both Hide Your Life Away and A Study in Love

- Donors of $60 will receive an autographed copy of both Hide Your Life Away and A Study in Love plus some bonus promo items


Sincere thanks for all contributions!! Every amount helps :)

that takes place in 6 Canadian cities. I would like to take part in the 
17th annual Halifax The Word on the Street Festival on September 25th.  
15,000 attendees are expected to visit the festival in Halifax this 
year. Having an exhibitor's table at this festival and doing a 
reading would be an incredible amount of professional exposure for me

For more information about this great festival, click here.

The Impact
Going to festivals and 
literary conventions is imperative to my career. Regardless of the 
number of sales I make on these trips, making contact with literary 
publishers, fellow writers, and fans is priceless. These events fuel my 
creativity, keep me excited about what's happening in literature today 
and inspire me to keep writing.  As a writer in PEI, I earn well below 
the poverty level, so it's difficult for me to attend many festivals, 
especially the bigger, more popular ones, like The Word on the Street, 
that charge table fees.

What I Need & What You GetA table at the convention - $300
Participation in Book Bag Treasure Hunt - $65
(this is a super promo tool that ensures that 250 attendees will visit my table to get a bonus literary gift from me)
2 nights hotel - 215
Gas and bridge fee to Halifax - 120
....Total cost of participation = $700 (I will cover my food and other expenses)

As a bonus and THANK YOU to you for contributing:- Donors of $10 will receive either a Hide Your Life Away or A Study in Love magnet- Donors of $15 will receive both a Hide Your Life Away and A Study in Love magnet
- Donors of $20 will receive an autographed copy of my award winning novel Hide Your Life Away
- Donors of $30 will receive an autographed copy of my award nominated poetry collection A Study in Love
- Donors of $45 will receive an autographed copy of both Hide Your Life Away and A Study in Love- Donors of $60 will receive an autographed copy of both Hide Your Life Away and   A Study in Love plus some bonus promo items
Sincere thanks for all contributions!! Every amount helps :)

story:
Short Summary

Mindfulness is defined as non-judgmental present moment awareness. Most people think that mindfulness meditation can only happen while seated in one position for extended periods of time in order to cultivate the inner quietude necessary for reducing stress and alleviating suffering.

I have discovered is that mindfulness meditation can be achieved in almost any activity that fully engages the senses and brings awareness to what is happening in the body. When we become aware of body sensations, we are brought into the present moment. The mind lives in the past and the present. The body is here, now. 

This project is dedicated to my exploration of unconventional paths to mindfulness by interviewing real people. What I have found, and continue to find, is that there are some pretty mindful people around here who didn't even know they were meditating.

About the author: Kristy Harvey is a Movement Educator from Charlottesville, VA. She is the former Administrative Director of the Mindfulness Center at the University of Virginia. She is a licensed Nia Instructor and a certified Yoga instructor. She is currently working on a clinical trial, for which she wrote the protocol, at UVA to study the effect of the Nia technique on the quality of life among women treated for breast cancer. She also offers free Restorative Yoga classes for women who have been treated for breast cancer at UVA. She has been an invited speaker for many presentations about Mindful Movement at UVA and around the Charlottesville Community. Recently, she was the keynote speaker at the Healthy Nurse Conference in Charleston, WV. Kristy will be relocating to Tucson, AZ this Fall where she will open a wellness center focusing on Mindful Movement.  When she is not teaching Nia or Yoga, she is writing and laughing (a lot).

What We Need & What You Get

After managing the Mindfulness Center at UVA for several years, Kristy observed that while many people desperately needed the life maintenance skills that mindfulness practice delivers, dozens did not enroll in the mindfulness classes because they were intimidated by the thought of having to sit still for extended periods of time.  Sometimes, even those who did enroll in the classes found it to be quite difficult because they were not ready to be still with their thoughts.  

So how do we reach those people?  How can we teach people how to connect with the present moment if they are not able to connect with their bodies?  Kristy believes that we must first help people identify how they might already be connecting with the present moment, but they may not be aware of it.  And so, Mindfulness On the Move was born!  

As a Movement Educator, Kristy has been teaching Mindful Movement for the past 6 years.  It is through dance that she became aware of her own body sensations and therefore has been able to cultivate the mindfulness skills that help her manage stress. She is currently studying the effect of Nia (dance, martial arts & yoga) on the quality of life among women who have been treated for breast cancer through a clinical trial at the University of Virginia.  Kristy is so passionate about helping others achieve healing awareness through movement that she quit her job at the UVA Mindfulness Center in order to connect with people on a more personal level.  

This project will help people connect with mindfulness in ways they did not even know were possible.  Kristy is meeting with people who have unique ways of cultivating mindfulness without having a formal meditation practice.  So far, she has talked with a distance runner, a musician, a yoga instructor, and an artist.  The goal is to tell the stories of how real people have found mindfulness practice and compile them into a book that will offer 52 unique paths to mindfulness.  The blog is up and running at www.mindfulnessonthemove.com. 

The funding for this project will go towards travel expenses, website maintenance, internet service fees, production assistance, advertising, and other expenses.  There are also plans to develop a radio show that will explore this topic in depth and give people an opportunity to tell their own stories and have the audience interact with them.

The Impact

Your contribution will help us reach even more people.  If you have ever experienced a stressful situation in your life, you know how difficult it can be to maintain clarity in order to make good decisions.  Mindfulness is a skill that can help train the brain to consciously respond to rather than react to stressful situations.  Kristy is on a mission to make mindfulness skills available to everyone.  You don't have to be a monk living in silence for years to experience peace.  You can experience peace in this moment, right here, right now.  We can help show you how.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help!  You are helping by simply spreading the word about this project.  

Send people to the website at www.mindfulnessonthemove.com.  

You can follow our progress by liking our Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/MindfulnessOnTheMove. 

And you can help by sharing your story!  If you have an unconventional way of cultivating mindfulness, please contact Kristy at bodymindjoy@gmail.com.

story:
My Story

My name is Renee Alexander Craft. In 2008, I watched breast cancer take the life of one of the bravest women I knew. As her time drew near, her thoughts were fixed on her two young daughters. I wrote "I Will Love You Everywhere Always" to help her daughters and other young people learn practical, everyday places (a sibling's smile, the smell of Sunday pancakes, the taste of snow cream, or a hug from grandpa) to feel the enduring presence of loved ones who have transitioned. 

 

In writing this book, I remembered how sad and confused I felt upon losing my grandmother when I was a child. My mouth knew to say that she lived up with God and not in her body, but my heart didn't really understand. As nice as heaven seemed, it sounded desperately far away. How would she hold my hand in the Big Star Grocery Store from way up there or kiss my boo boos to make them feel better? How could she still be mine to love and be loved by if she was no longer mine to touch? These are the types of questions that five-year-old Hope wrestles with in "I Will Love You Everywhere Always.” It is a book I would have appreciated receiving when my grandmom passed away and speaks to the places I learned to find her each time I missed her.

 

The Impact

I have teamed up with award-winning visual artist Cosmo Whyte (http://www.cosmowhyte.com) to create what I hope will be both a useful tool and a beautiful keepsake.  The completed book will be a 40 page full-color 8x8 picture book with text simple enough for young readers to comprehend.

 

It is intended not only as a comforting reminder that the ones we love never truly leave us, but also as a means to help children talk about their feelings and fears surrounding death. Likewise, it gives caregivers another resource to guide little people through the process of loss and healing.

 

I plan to distribute the book to schools, hospitals, hospice, counseling centers, and organizations that offer support services to those dealing with terminal illness as well as through traditional booksellers.  

 

What We Need 

The goal of the campaign is to raise $6,000 to pay for the illustrations as well as publish the book through a print-on-demand publisher capable of printing it, distributing it to major retail outlets, and making it available on-line. The funds will also cover the initial cost of marketing and publicity. If my team and I do not reach our entire fundraising goal through this campaign, all funds collected will be used to progress this project one step at a time and help acquire future investment in the project by showing how much support it has already garnered. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help my team and I spread the word. Email it, post it to your facebook page, tweet it, share it with your linkedin community, talk about it at the water cooler and the gym.  . . every dollar we collect brings this project one step closer to completion.  If you know of groups or organizations that might be interested in "I Will Love You Everywhere Always," BY ALL MEANS please share their information with us at  iwillloveyoueverywherealways@gmail.com. Sign up for our email list at http://eepurl.com/dIwqc  and "like" us on facebook at www/facebook.com/iwillloveyoueverywherealways to receive our "Hot Off the Press" announcements as well as learn about upcoming readings, signings, and events. THANK YOU!

story:
¿Qué?

La copia de Van Gogh destaca por su lenguaje sencillo, fresco, lleno de matices y directo, en una historia que nos permite vivir los acontecimientos casi como si fuésemos los protagonistas.

La Copia de Van Gogh es la historia de la amistad entre Miriam, una chica barcelonesa de clase media y familia católica tradicional, y Helena, una chica americana que emigra a España al principio de los años 80 con sus padres liberales y abiertos. La historia comienza cuando siendo las dos niñas, se conocen durante unas vacaciones en la isla de Mallorca. Sus orígenes y biografías tan distintas hacen que se sientan inmediatamente atraídas, forjando una estrecha relación que se fortalece en sucesivos veraneos. Sin embargo, cuando la desgracia se cierne sobre ellas, la amistad se rompe, y cada una sigue un camino diferente. Miriam llevará una existencia gris sometida a las expectativas familiares, mientras que Helena viaja a la India en busca de una hermana desaparecida. Años después, Helena desaparece también en Nueva York cuando volvía de la India, y Miriam decide ir en su busca. El rescate de la amiga, acaba convirtiéndose en un encuentro consigo misma que cambiará su vida definitivamente.

La novela  combina múltiples elementos: la nostalgia de la infancia perdida, el exotismo de la India y de los pueblos marineros de la costa de Nueva Jersey, la intriga de un sucio asunto de adopciones falsas, la aventura de la búsqueda de la amiga desaparecida, los amores románticos de sus protagonistas, la casi obsesiva atracción por el mar, y avanzando entre medio de todos esos temas, la constante evolución de la protagonista Miriam.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Mercedes Salvador.

Mujer aventurera, abogada que en los años 90 estaba bien establecida en Barcelona, lo dejó todo para ir a vivir a los Estados Unidos y llevar a cabo su sueño de ser escritora. Estudió un master en escritura creativa por la universidad Goddard College en Vermont, realizó crítica literaria en los diarios de habla hispana Elhecho y Nuevas Raíces, y dio clases de lengua española en diferentes universidades. En los últimos años ha publicado la biografía en inglés Monica's Dream  que relata la historia de Jil Van Eyl, el fundador del movimiento Teaming. También ha publicado un libro de escritos y poemas Viviendo campo a través, y una historia corta de ficción sobre la crisis en la antología El Crack del 2009.

La Copia de Van Gogh es su primera novela y, de nuevo afincada en Barcelona, actualmente trabaja en unas memorias sobre su experiencia americana.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 840€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de La copia de Van Gogh que saldría pocas semanas después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Mercedes Salvador vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
Let's inspire our kids to create ART!

Did you know many of the motions involved in making art, such as scribbling with a crayon are essential to the growth of fine motor skills in young children?

I wanted to create a book that inspired ART in children as well as teaching them to cherish being unique! And I believe this book accomplishes those two things!

The story behind the story

My son actually inspired the character for this book, he's still new to drawing and most of his drawings would be scribbles that he wasn't too excited about. Then one day he got the idea to put two googly eyes on his drawing and his eyes just lit up. And that's how scribble the character was created He started to make all his little scribbles into little creatures and he was so happy! It not only made him want to draw more but gave him confidence with his drawings.

A little about the book

It's a playful rhyming book about a scribble. This scribble looks different then the other drawings and because of that they don't want to play with him. In the end they overcome there differences and make beautiful art! This book's target audience is between ages 2-6

  

Stickers!

My son was still putting googly eyes on his scribbles so I thought, why not create stickers! My child just loved them!! So each book will include a sheet of stickers as well so your child can create their own "Scribble"

Create your own Scribble Story Activity Booklet plus MORE Stickers!

 
The Activity book this is a great addition to the book! After they are done reading the book they can begin to create their own story! Each page has some inspirational guidance using some phrases right from the book as well as teaching colors and places! The best part is this will ALSO come with Stickers! These will come with a new set of eye's and mouth expressions then what is provided with the book! 
 
 

The book's done! Now I need your help!

The book is finished and I've spent countless hours getting feedback on the design and story. Creating a rhyming book can have its challenges and I believe I've mastered the flow pretty well. The book is an 8'' x10'' hardcover, 32 pages with 100lb matte paper. It's durable and has an attractive print quality. With my previous experience in self-publishing, I already have a publisher sourced and now it's just ready to be printed

Why Indiegogo? 

There are a lot of upfront costs in publishing your own book. In order to make the book affordable, I need to buy in bulk and I felt it was the best platform to get exposure and earn the money to get the first run printed. 

Where is your money going? 

Printing bulk order, Design, Shipping,  label printer, packaging, postage and shipping to you 5% Indegogo fees, 5% Payment processing fees and a few cups of coffee for me and my husband to work through the night getting everything out! :)

Risks and challenges

The book has been written and I have experience working with a reliable publisher. As with any Indiegogo, if I am wildly successful there may be some delays with fulfillment. But our project doesn't rest on any other unknowns.

Creating a rhyming book can have its challenges and I believe I've mastered the flow pretty well. The book is an 8'' x10'' hardcover, 32 pages with 100lb matte paper. It's durable and has an attractive print quality. With my previous experience in self-publishing, I already have a publisher sourced and now it's just ready to be printedWhy Indiegogo? There are a lot of upfront costs in publishing your own book. In order to make the book affordable, I need to buy in bulk and I felt it was the best platform to get exposure and earn the money to get the first run printed. Where is your money going? Printing bulk order, Design, Shipping,  label printer, packaging, postage and shipping to you 5% Indegogo fees, 5% Payment processing fees and a few cups of coffee for me and my husband to work through the night getting everything out! :)Risks and challengesThe book has been written and I have experience working with a reliable publisher. As with any Indiegogo, if I am wildly successful there may be some delays with fulfillment. But our project doesn't rest on any other unknowns.

story:
Let me tell you how (français plus bas)

My name is Theodore Bauthier, and I am 19. Last year I was part of YIP (the Youth Initiative Program), an international study program based in Sweden, on social entrepreneurship, aiming to strengthen young people’s capacity to take initiative, in the face of the global and current challenges.

During that year, in December 2015, I went on a two month internship to Los Angeles, the city of angels. There I was introduced to a number of very inspiring social organisations and projects doing beautiful work in the city. I wanted to know more about the organisations and their work, but most of all I was really interested in the people behind them, wanting to understand and learn from the stories and experiences of those social entrepreneurs. And so I decided to go to those organisations and interview them, have a conversation, collect words and learn from those doers. 

My experience in L.A, just like this whole year, has been a very rich one for me, and part of why is because of meeting so many people that inspired me deeply. Those people committed to the "better", change makers that act on what they believe and do. I was and still am very interested in this amazing art that is taking initiative, in this beautiful energy that is doing. 

The depth of the experience and the words collected, quickly made the idea of sharing it and making a book of it emerge. And here we are now. AngelsWords, in a collection of conversations and photography from my dear friend Tom Schaefer, is a book/magazine which tells the stories and experiences of those people who DO.

My interest for journalism only grows, as I disagree more and more with our current way of using and spreading information. AngelsWord is a learning journey, a first fruit in just the very beginning of an exploration of what a better journalism could look like…

Where is AngelsWord at? 

I have been working on AngelsWord for a bit more then a year now. As it is the first time I am doing anything like it, I have been learning a lot on each step of the process, and it's been an amazing experience. And here we are on the very last steps of quite a journey. I am now part of an artist studio in Brussels, where I work together with a friend/graphic designer on the layout and the form of the book that AngelsWord is to become very soon. 

Fallow the project here : https://www.facebook.com/AngelsWord.Mag/?fref=ts

Order one : http://angelsword.be/

Your support :)

Our goal is to raise € 3.500,- to cover a good part of the printing cost. 

In supporting the project with € 20,- you get one copy of AngelsWord !!

AngelsWord will be printed for April, in 400 copies at Cassochrome, a Belgian offset printing house. We need your financial support and help to make AngelsWord possible. 

Who we are

 

Once it's printed?!

Once AngelsWord is printed, I will be going to the Connect Conference in Belgium (3-8 of April), and to the Initiative forum in Sweden (9-14 of April) to Share it right out of the oven. Then I will go on a library pilgrimage through the major cities of western Europe. Copies will be sent out to Los Angeles as well. 

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

En français?! 

Mon nom est Theodore Bauthier, et j’ai 19 ans. L’année passée, j’étudiais au YIP (The Youth Initiative Program), un programme international sur l’entreprenariat social, visant à fortifier et développer cette capacité qu’ont les jeunes à prendre des initiatives, face aux monde d’aujourd’hui.

Au cours de cette même année, en Décembre 2015, je suis parti pour un stage de deux mois à Los Angeles, la ville des anges. Là-bas, j’ai été amené à rencontrer une série d’organisations sociales et projets inspirants. Je voulais en savoir plus sur ces organisations, leur travail et leur manière de faire, mais au de-là de ça, je voulais en savoir plus sur les gens derrière elles. Je voulais comprendre et connaître les histoires et expériences de ces entrepreneurs. J’ai alors décidé d’aller voir chacune de ces organisations et de les interviewer, d’avoir une conversation, pour collecter leurs mots et apprendre de ces gens qui “font”, agissent.

Mon Stage à L.A, et cette dernière année, a été pour moi une expérience très riche, et une grande partie de cette richesse est due à la rencontre de beaucoup d’individus qui m’ont profondément inspiré. Ces gens qui semblent être entièrement dévoués à cette quête du meilleur, ces magiciens du changement qui vivent sur leurs idéaux, et agissent. Quelque chose en moi est fasciné, et fort intéressé par cet art magnifique qu’est la prise d’initiative, dans cette énergie puissante qu’est l’action.

L’expérience et la profondeur des mots collectés ont vite amené l’idée de le partager, et d’en faire un livre. Et nous voilà alors un an plus tard. AngelsWord, à travers une collection de conversations et un travail photographique de mon ami Tom Schaefer, est un livre/magazine qui nous raconte les histoires et les expériences de ces gens qui “font”.

Mon intérêt pour le journalisme ne fait que grandir alors que je désapprouve de plus en plus notre manière actuelle d’utiliser et de transmettre l’information. AngelsWord est pour moi un apprentissage, le premier fruit sur les premiers petits pas d’une exploration d’un journalisme plus pertinent et plus juste, d’un journalisme meilleur.

Ou en est AngelsWord?

Cela fait maintenant un peu plus d’un an que je travaille dessus. Ceci étant bien sûr la première fois que je fais quelque chose comme ça, j’apprends énormément sur chaque étape du processus. Et nous voilà face aux dernières étapes, probablement les plus excitantes d’un sacré voyage. Je suis dans un atelier d’artistes à Bruxelles, où je travaille avec un ami graphiste sur la mise en page, sur le livre que AngelsWord deviendra très bientôt.

Suivez le projet ici : https://www.facebook.com/AngelsWord.Mag/?fref=ts

votre soutien :)

Notre but est de soulever € 3.500,- pour couvrir une bonne partie des coûts d’imprimerie. 

En soutenant le projet de € 20,- vous obtenez un exemplaire de AngelsWord !!

AngelsWord sera imprimé en 400 exemplaires pour avril, chez l’imprimeur Cassochrome. Nous avons besoin de votre soutien pour nous aider à rendre AngelsWord possible, et bien réel, dans nos mains et sous nos yeux.

Une fois imprimé ?!

Une fois AngelsWord imprimé, j’irai le présenter a "Connect Conference" (3-8 avril), dans la ville de Lier en Belgique, et à "Initiative Forum" (9-14 avril), en Suède. Ensuite, un bâton de pèlerin à la main, je m’en irai sur la route des librairies des villes d’Europe. Des exemplaires seront également envoyé a Los Angeles.

story:
About Me

My name is Peggy Neuman. I am an artist, published poet, writer, storyteller, lyricist, art teacher, philosopher, connector, and observer and explorer of life!

I am an almost 67 year old (young!) single woman with a big Dream and a little Pug. I, like so many, have allowed my Dreams to be put on hold, having lived these past few changing years in financial challenges. I live on my small Social Security check and supplement that with babysitting some wonderful  children, but it is difficult, physically, for me most days. I pay the important bills, but the challenges limit my creative spirit.

I am now at another big crossroads in my life. I can continue to “stay” in this contained space, (no! no! no!) or be courageous, once again, and drive “off the cliff”, (no worry, my car, Ruby, has wings!) and my greatest “leap of faith”, by myself (of course, with my Pug-Love, Kobi), and break free of any fears, to embark on this next leg of the trip and live an inspired and fully creative Soul-life.

I intend to be on the road from 3-12 months.

I have been preparing for this for over a year (a lifetime actually!)…getting rid of and letting go of most of my stuff, moving to a very small attic apartment, and continuing this process, in preparation to travel and write and paint unencumbered.

I have made the commitment!

Like everyone, I have experienced the amazing joys of life and the extreme challenges along my journey.

I have graduated from survivor to thriver!

It is now time for me to pursue my dream of writing about this journey and to share it with my readers! And there is a deep knowing that this is not my last and only Story.

I have, since childhood, lived with Multiple Chemical Sensitivity, Environmental Illness, Auto-Immune Disorders, Early-Onset Arthritis, and severe feet problems. (thus, the difficulty keeping up with and lifting the little ones I babysit). This limits what I eat, where I go, where and how I live, as I spend time maneuvering this world!  I do so in consciousness. So my life, now, is very simply-lived. This being said, I create and focus on HOW I live…in daily gratitude, creativity, (when I can) and in joy, and sharing it with others. Where I feel my best is in my car, a controlled environment for me, and in Nature…breathing in good air and beauty.

My writing stems from the view of an artistic and sensitive Soul and spirit….how I feel comfort in the pain, see beauty in all, growth in the dark, and joy in the small places, that brings inspiration and Enlightenment.

My “roadmap” is unfolding…nothing more needed for the realization of my Vision now…except for the availability of Funds to make this happen!


 

My Vision (Plan):

1st & 2nd Leg     (approx. 3-12 months)

2 Books:  (1st 2 as a series)

#1  “My Life As a Roadtrip  (And Oh, What a Trip It Has Been!”)…(working title)

This covers my first 67 years, the first 4 Crossroads reached, maneuvered, with lessons learned, wisdom gained, lessons to share.

  #2  “My Life As a Roadtrip II  (Driving/Diving Into the Unknown)…(working title)

This book is a continuation, written, literally, along my 6 months to 1 year journey from this Crossroads at which I now stand, in 2015.  It is written from immediate experience, observing and implementing what I have learned and gained from the first 4 Crossroads.

 

  Each book will be my story, the detours, open roads, crossroads, signs, the circuitous routes, both in reality, and metaphorically and Spiritually. Each book will be filled with insight, humor, musings and philosophies, stories, prose, my poetry, my lyrics, my paintings, the music and others words that inspire me, sketches, and photos.The books will be Inspiration, uplifting reads that encourage and guide others to be their most magnificent selves, no matter at what age.

 

The 3rd Leg:

Because I believe so strongly in conscious and intentional living, and because of my own journey of chemical and toxin sensitivity, and love of Nature, one of my passions is being actively involved in Environmental and Ecological causes and solutions. Therefore, it is my intention, as part of my Plan, in this next year of being on the road, to explore, discover, connect with those who are already active in the Environmental arena, interview, and participate on a first-hand basis just where the greatest needs are here in the US, then globally.


That takes us into part 3 of my Plan.

4th Leg

Book 3: 

This book, based on the 3rd Leg of my journey, as envisioned at this point, will be about our Planet Earth, with information I have researched, experienced, and discovered, then guiding the readers to where the greatest needs are for help. I will be writing about correlations of the Earth to our human body, on levels of body, mind, spirit and soul. I will suggest some solutions and ideas on how to fully live in intention and consciousness as an individual and how, as a species, we must take on the responsibility that it entails, and hopefully inspire my readers in a call to action! We are all in this together!

To help make this happen, I need Funding to cover costs (up to a year):

 *Alloting TIME for traveling (coast to coast), writing, editing, interviewing

*Accomodations, as needed (will stay with friends and family when possible)

*Food

*Gas

*Storage-here in NC for the little I have remaining.

*A few monthly bills



This is the biggest Crossroads of my Life! I have an absolute need and desire to contribute to the world through my Vision, dreams, writing, art, and teaching in the biggest way possible, unlike anything I have ever done!


Please use the Indiegogo share tools or post this on FaceBook or email anyone who may be interested in my Plan! So much Gratitude for you all.

story:
¿Qué?

Triángulo equilátero es una de esas novelas que aportan un soplo de aire fresco a la narrativa de género... 

Un hombre acuciado por el pasado es incapaz de sobrevivir al presente. No duda para ello en inventar una vida que no es ni real ni mejor que la vivida años antes. Todo impostura. La huida a ninguna parte. Triángulo equilátero, la primera novela en solitario de Jesús Valbuena Blanco, es un thriller psicológico que transcurre en la mente atormentada del protagonista, obligado siempre a elegir entre el deseo y el deber, acosado por las dudas, la violencia, el amor y la nostalgia de un tiempo fallido.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de publicar obras poco convencionales pero de indudable calidad, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para promocionar cada título cuando esta todavía se encuentra en proceso de edición.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Jesús Valbuena.

Lleva ya casi dos décadas ejerciendo el periodismo en todos sus formatos: prensa escrita, agencias, radio y gabinetes. Su debut editorial se produjo con la publicación de El último duelo (2014), un libro de relatos que tuvo una excelente acogida entre el público y la crítica. Es coautor, junto con Luis M. Moreno, de otras dos novelas: Héroes de papel (Premio de Narrativa del IX Certamen de Creadores por la Libertad y la Paz en Sevilla) y Semillas de ceniza (Tandaia, 2016).  Triángulo equilátero es su primera novela en solitario.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«Afuera, en la calle, se advierte también el llanto del cielo. La lluvia golpea el asfalto y los cristales y provoca un tintineo inquietante cuando las gotas chocan contras la rejas metálicas de la ventana. El cielo parece desmoronarse sobre el asfalto. Como si el mundo que hemos conocido hasta ahora tocara a su fin. Y mucho me temo que será así. Noto tu respiración entrecortada y como tus mejillas humedecen mi hombro desnudo. Estamos desnudos, sí. Desnudos, abrazados y llorando. Una luz blanca nos ilumina, tanto que la estancia parece una habitación de hospital. Hace frío. Esta casa siempre ha sido fría. Fría y húmeda. Noto que me ahogo, que me falta el aire, y que por fin se abren los pulmones cuando un nuevo río de lágrimas logra desbordar mis ojos y arrecia con fuerza sobre tu piel desnuda, gélida, dócil. Una sombra de mujer cruza la ventana. Lleva paraguas y cazadora. La veo por encima de tu hombro, empañada por las lágrimas y las gotas que inundan el cristal de la ventana. Después pasa un taxi, veloz. Y un autobús urbano. Y luego un coche. Y luego otro. Extiendo por fin la mano y acaricio el sofá hasta que agarro el revólver. Está tan frío que logra erizarme la piel».

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 840€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Aviso para navegantes: La opción BACK IT es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Jesús Valbuena vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

Política de Privacidad
story_txt:
¿Qué?
Triángulo equilátero es una de esas novelas que aportan un soplo de aire fresco a la narrativa de género... 
Un hombre acuciado por el pasado es incapaz de sobrevivir al presente. No duda para ello en inventar una vida que no es ni real ni mejor que la vivida años antes. Todo impostura. La huida a ninguna parte. Triángulo equilátero, la primera novela en solitario de Jesús Valbuena Blanco, es un thriller psicológico que transcurre en la mente atormentada del protagonista, obligado siempre a elegir entre el deseo y el deber, acosado por las dudas, la violencia, el amor y la nostalgia de un tiempo fallido.
¿Quiénes?
Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de publicar obras poco convencionales pero de indudable calidad, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para promocionar cada título cuando esta todavía se encuentra en proceso de edición.
De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.
Hoy te presentamos a Jesús Valbuena.
Lleva ya casi dos décadas ejerciendo el periodismo en todos sus formatos: prensa escrita, agencias, radio y gabinetes. Su debut editorial se produjo con la publicación de El último duelo (2014), un libro de relatos que tuvo una excelente acogida entre el público y la crítica. Es coautor, junto con Luis M. Moreno, de otras dos novelas: Héroes de papel (Premio de Narrativa del IX Certamen de Creadores por la Libertad y la Paz en Sevilla) y Semillas de ceniza (Tandaia, 2016).  Triángulo equilátero es su primera novela en solitario.
¿Por qué?
Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:
«Afuera, en la calle, se advierte también el llanto del cielo. La lluvia golpea el asfalto y los cristales y provoca un tintineo inquietante cuando las gotas chocan contras la rejas metálicas de la ventana. El cielo parece desmoronarse sobre el asfalto. Como si el mundo que hemos conocido hasta ahora tocara a su fin. Y mucho me temo que será así. Noto tu respiración entrecortada y como tus mejillas humedecen mi hombro desnudo. Estamos desnudos, sí. Desnudos, abrazados y llorando. Una luz blanca nos ilumina, tanto que la estancia parece una habitación de hospital. Hace frío. Esta casa siempre ha sido fría. Fría y húmeda. Noto que me ahogo, que me falta el aire, y que por fin se abren los pulmones cuando un nuevo río de lágrimas logra desbordar mis ojos y arrecia con fuerza sobre tu piel desnuda, gélida, dócil. Una sombra de mujer cruza la ventana. Lleva paraguas y cazadora. La veo por encima de tu hombro, empañada por las lágrimas y las gotas que inundan el cristal de la ventana. Después pasa un taxi, veloz. Y un autobús urbano. Y luego un coche. Y luego otro. Extiendo por fin la mano y acaricio el sofá hasta que agarro el revólver. Está tan frío que logra erizarme la piel».
¿Cómo?
Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 840€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Aviso para navegantes: La opción BACK IT es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.
Además...
Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Jesús Valbuena vea publicada su obra.
Gracias por vuestro tiempo.
Política de Privacidad

story:
Story of My Book

LAME (Look at Me, Everyone) is a nonfiction book that speaks about branding and brand reputation in clothing industries, namely fashion and streetwear. It also explains why consumers may feel compelled to chase such contrived surfaces, like a brand name or a logo, in the first place.

My name is Thomas Edralin and I am the author of “Look at Me, Everyone”, or how I like to call it, LAME. I wrote this book because I wanted to explore my own questions and experiences when I initially engaged with streetwear and brand names. Being someone who has heard and experienced various sides of streetwear and clothing in general, I feel I can provide a unique and worthy perspective that invites you into the various stories and narratives found in LAME.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you can gain a unique perspective on clothing and more importantly, why a simple logo or design can be so important to many people in the end. I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for clothes themselves, something usually regarded for its functionality as opposed to luxury. Through this book, I want to help bridge the gap between those who are and those who are not interested in the streetwear industry. I believe that anyone can derive from these subcultures, whether it be drawing viable business practices or simply put, redefining a relationship with clothes themselves.

In this book, you'll learn about things such as authenticity, exclusivity, and much more! You'll hear stories and anecdotes such as...

  • How a 1980’s clothing wholesaler based in Harlem found outstanding success and failure through his opportunistic sampling of logos from high-end luxury brands
  • How a campaign shirt from a failed presidential candidate inexplicably went viral in South Korea thirty years later much to the confusion of said candidate himself
  • How two similar upstart streetwear brands managed to capitalize on their newfound successes (albeit in different ways) following a series of contrasting events and ambitions

 

You will love this book if you are interested in fashion and streetwear, compelling narratives, or, in a broader sense, the art of clothing. Really, the beauty behind streetwear and clothing is that the industry is predicated on the rich stories behind these brands themselves. Honestly, I’ve come to appreciate the deeper history and meanings by all of these printed logos and designs over the years, so I hope that maybe, you can too.

LAME (Look at Me, Everyone) is a nonfiction book that invites you to read a unique perspective regarding the rapidly growing culture known as streetwear and more importantly, why a simple logo or clothing design is so important to a lot of us in the end.
 

The Book - Look at Me, Everyone

The book is written in primarily 3 parts...

Part 1 focuses on the structural aspects. With the help of statistics, theories, and expert opinions, this part really sets the tone as well as the overall baseline of what streetwear and LAME is all about.

Part 2 focuses more on the conceptual side. The very principles that come to define streetwear in the first place. Really, the references of real world phenomena and everyday things in this chapter help show that maybe, these concepts integral to streetwear may not be so foreign after all.

Part 3 focuses on the insights. Interviews with professionals and industry leaders who are more than capable to give their two cents on the topic as well as give a deep-dive analysis on what goes down within the industry.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

 

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook.
When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Thomas Edralin is a Business Analytics and Information Technology major at Rutgers Business School. He is also studying Marketing because there he can best utilize his strengths: active communication, writing, and analytical skills from a quantitative lens. Through mastery of such topics, he wishes to understand and unify these disciplines not only for his personal success, but to also positively influence the surrounding community and hopefully, the world through productive business practices.

Oftentimes finding himself interested with streetwear’s changing trends, he believes that clothing can generally be best utilized as a creative outlet, potentially serving as an authentic expression of one's lifestyle whether through discrete motifs or branding. As a result, he found it appropriate to write this book as a means to act on such beliefs and learn more about the subculture which has fascinated him for so long.

During his free time, you can find him shopping for excessive amounts of clothing, winning the blind in poker, and shooting contested threes on the basketball court. In terms of his interests, Thomas is an avid fan of the Yankees, Jets, and Nets and enjoys hobbies such as running, skating, and most importantly, sleeping.

For more information, you can feel free to connect with Thomas at his email [thomas.edralin@gmail.com], his Instagram [@thomas_edralin], and his LinkedIn [https://www.linkedin.com/in/thomas-edralin/].
 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #LAME and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

 

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Thomas Edralin

story:
My name is John Kasey and I'm a Writer from Eastern, Kentucky and the creator of One Cool Hand. One Cool Hand is a web based company I plan to use for all releases of my current and future original content that includes novels, graphic novels, comic books, short stories, short films, original music and a podcast. The name One Cool Hand comes from my love of the 1967 classic film Cool Hand Luke. Luke Jackson, as played by Paul Newman, utters the classic line " Sometimes nothin' can be a real cool hand " after bluffing his way through a winning hand of Poker and telling his cellmates if you play it cool and if you believe in yourself then there's always hope. The line always stuck with me and became my own personal life motto in a lot of ways. You can have nothing, you can be on your own, you can doubt yourself and be unsure of your purpose, but no matter how many times life hits you and brings you down to your knees, as long as you keep getting up, then what did you really lose? As long as you have yourself then you're always in the fight, that being said, I've been doing all of this on my own for awhile now while living pay check to pay check and at times it can be a little overwhelming. Paying for illustrators to help with the comics and artists to design the covers for each book has caused me to take a bit of a financial hit. Don't get me wrong, I'll never give up on One Cool Hand and I'll never quit trying to make this dream a reality but I'm also smart enough to realize that I may not be able to do it all by myself, that's why I've started this campaign to humbly ask for a little push in the right direction to help fund One Cool Hand and the material I hope to release.

                   The Goal of my Campagin 

The amount of funding I am seeking for my Campaign is $5,000 which will be centered around hiring various artists to help design book covers as well as illustrate the comics and graphic novels I've written. This is very important to me because I believe my stories would be greatly enhanced with a visual element that will help capture each reader's imagination, helping the story as it needs to be told and to be experienced at full effect for the reader. Once this is complete I will also use the remaining contributions to this campaign to help purchase the proper equipment to begin working on the podcast as well as the short films I have in pre production. These funds will be used for cameras, recording equipment, and other miscellaneous content to help grow One Cool Hand as a company. Words cannot express how grateful I would be for any assistance in helping see my vision through to it's very end. Even if you are not able to help financially, simply sharing the website for One Cool Hand and helping spread the word about my company and my content would mean the world to me. This has always been my greatest dream and your generosity and belief in my books, my films, and my voice is something I would never, ever forget. You have my word that once my books are finished and everything is complete that your money will be paid back in full. I plan on personally reaching out to every backer to keep in touch with them about what exactly their contribution has gone to and to keep them updated on their perks and when their money will be returned.


Thank you for taking the time to read what I've had to say, we're all here for the same reasons, we're either creators or we wish to help creators and that alone gives us a bond.

With that, I leave you with the wise words of the great, Kevin Smith 
 

“Remember: It costs nothing to encourage an artist, and the potential benefits are staggering. A pat on the back to an artist now could one day result in your favorite film, or the cartoon you love to get stoned watching, or the song that saves your life. Discourage an artist, you get absolutely nothing in return, ever.”


― Kevin Smith, Tough Shit: Life Advice from a Fat, Lazy Slob Who Did Good

story:
You can still get The New Mindset Journal at newmindsetwhodis.com. Thank you!

(same day fulfilment if you order before 12pm CST) 

(4-7 business day and 2 day express shipping options available)

----------

Do you feel like you’re chasing the wrong things in your life? 

⚡ Transform how you think, act and feel in 60 days with the New Mindset Journal ⚡

The New Mindset Journal breaks down the barriers between you and your authentic-self by providing a series of simple, 10-minute journal prompts that guide you on a path to self-discovery in only 60 days.

✔️Discover what motivates and inspires you.

✔️Overcome your insecurities.

✔️Gain clarity on the path that is right for you.

✔️Learn to approach every day with optimism.

After 60 days you’ll be saying...

"... new mindset, who dis? "

⚡⚡

What is Different About The New Mindset Journal?

The New Mindset Journal provides you with questions you likely aren't asking yourself so you can discover the answers you want and need in your life.

This is not a daily planner, a goal setting checklist, or a productivity journal.

This is a journal designed to make you more self aware.

When you know who you are and what you want in your life, you become happier, healthier, more motivated and confident. 

No more feeling lost, frustrated or that you’re falling behind in life.

Over the course of 60 days, the journal provides simple questions and prompts designed to rewire your mindset to bring out your best-self.

Asking yourself the right questions = discovering the right answers.

Get out of your head and into your heart and find clarity by facing important questions that lead you to life-changing answers.

✔️ 10 minutes per day

✔️ 60 days worth of prompts and exercises

✔️ Can be done any time of day or night

✔️ Prompted and unprompted

⚡⚡

How a Podcast Led To A Life-Changing Mindset and Journal

The New Mindset Journal combines podcaster Case Kenny's years of mindfulness study, personal life experience and podcasting to millions of listeners to create a unique and powerful journaling experience.  

Case's podcast New Mindset, Who Dis (Apple Podcasts, Spotify) is an Apple Podcasts top 100 Health and Wellness Podcast and has received over 2,000 five-star reviews and countless accolades including Stitcher Editor's Choice, Ask Men Top 10 Mindfulness Podcasts, Castbox Editor's Choice, Deezer Editor's Choice, and iHeart Radio Top 10 Health.

The podcast has led Case to be featured in Forbes, Fortune, Entrepreneur, Chicago Tribune and more where he has shared his simple and relatable mindsets that create drastic life change.

The podcast and mindsets from it have completely changed Case's life and he's taken everything he's learned to create a simple, 10 minute per day guided journaling experience unlike any other.

⚡⚡

60 Days of Inspiring Journal Prompts and Reflections

The optimal amount of time for a new habit to stick is ~60 days and the same is true for self awareness. 60 days (only 10 minutes per day) is the ideal amount of question and answer repetition for your newfound clarity and purpose to become permanent.

Each day only takes ~10 minutes and can be done at any time - morning, afternoon or night.

Each day is cleanly broken into 3 pages and progresses intuitively from day to day.

⚡⚡

The Perfect Mix of Guided and Unguided Journaling

The problem with most journals is they are either just empty pages expecting you to intuitively fill them in or they are too prompted - checklists, boxes, essays, vision boards, etc. It's either too much or too little!

The New Mindset Journal provides the perfect mix of freedom and direction.

Repetition and introspection is key! Each day introduces both new & familiar questions/prompts.

Long form prompts and questions guide you to get deep, real and raw with yourself.

⚡⚡

Minimalist Design and Hardbound Cover

Most journals are flimsy, boring or something you hide in your backpack or under your bed.

The New Mindset Journal is coffee table worthy. It is designed to be something you are proud to see and admire - a testament to your growth.

Minimalist design but sturdy like a book - no more folded, falling out or bent journal pages.

6x9in design means the journal is perfect to travel with but also sized for your bookshelf.

⚡⚡

300+ pages 

Neither too much nor too little. Over 300 pages of prompts, questions and quotes means you'll never run out of inspiration but you also won't be overwhelmed by having too much to complete.

Uncrowded journaling space encourages you to intuitively react to and answer each prompt. 

Designs, quotes and drawings ensure the journaling experience is fun (as it should be!)

⚡⚡

Unique Real-World Exercises

Journaling is only as effective as your willingness to put it to use. The New Mindset Journal pushes you to discover more about yourself by journaling AND by getting out in the real world. Every 10 days, a simple exercise leads you to discover more about yourself while putting what you've already discovered about yourself to use.

Break up the repetition of journaling and put your self-awareness to the test.

Encourage yourself to find your clarity by journaling and challenge yourself to make it last.

⚡⚡

Powerful Quotes and Meditations

Purposeful and poignant quotes and meditations flow with the daily questions and prompts to provide you with the perspective you need to dig deep within yourself. 

Meditations and quotes enhance the journaling experience to inspire you to go deeper.

Journal alongside Case as he guides you through the 60 days with his own thoughts and quotes.

⚡⚡

Thought-Provoking Questions 

Over 60 days you'll face questions you've seen and maybe asked yourself before (good! ask them again) and you'll also be faced with questions you've been avoiding (great! time to get real).

Questions are designed to make you stop and think (something you might not do normally).

Prompts are clear and simple to complete - giving you momentum over 60 days of journaling.

⚡⚡

The Reviews Are In

See what early journal users and New Mindset, Who Dis podcast listeners are saying.

⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ Matt - The New Mindset Journal made me realize that I was chasing the wrong goals in life because I wasn't asking myself the right questions. 10 minutes a day over two months with this journal has completely changed my life and I feel like I have such amazing clarity now on what I should be doing. I can truly say that I have a much better idea of who I am now.

⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ Alexis  - I've listened to Case's podcast for over a year and I was so excited to hear he was releasing a journal. Boy did he deliver! I feel like I've overcome so many blocks in my life - ones I didn't even know were holding me back. I feel like I actually know myself now, what I want and what I need to do to get there. It's an amazing feeling. 

⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ Justin - The time I spent with this journal felt amazing. I feel like a weight has been lifted from my shoulders. I feel less pressure because I understand what it is I want out of my life. I know what goals to set and I feel so grateful and confident as I work towards them. 

⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ Sara - I LOVE this journal! It's unlike any journal I've ever used. It asks questions I never would've thought to ask myself and it's made me realize what I need to be doing to get to where I want to go.

⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ liz khalifa 33 - Truly my favorite podcast. There’s something for everything on here, and Case offers such a unique perspective! He brings an honest, spiritual, yet so lighthearted and funny twist to his messages. 10/10 podcast — I always recommend it to all my friends :) Appreciate ya dude bro!

⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ tparker1981 - Fresh discoveries!! This podcast has inspired me to fight to regain parts of myself that I’d lost over the past few years all the while helping me discover parts of myself that were hiding.

⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ Hyland Air-Bear - You’ll feel like a better human after listening to Case. Case Kenny will make you think, laugh, and contemplate change all at once. His topics are on point, there’s an effortless vulnerability & lack of ego as he shares relevant, bite sized wisdom and food for thought. Dude bro knows his stuff & his energy is inspiring! Growth mindset movement unite. 

⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ atx_jo - You won’t regret it!! If I could give it 10 stars I would! Case and this podcast have LITERALLY changed my life and I’ll forever be grateful. He’s relatable, cool af... I genuinely believe he is a good person just trying to help other people feel good. He’s inspiring and I seriously look forward to every single episode. Can’t say enough good things. Much love!!

(you can check out another 2,000 five-star podcast reviews here)

⚡⚡

Why Does Self Awareness Matter?

A note from Case:

Self awareness is the most important aspect of your life and your self development! The more self aware you are, the happier, more fulfilled, driven and confident you become. I firmly believe this to be true!

When you become self aware, you know yourself and you know your truth.

Your truth is so much more than living a normal life. Your truth is so much more than settling for familiar, ordinary or routine. Your truth is one where you are always pushing yourself to search for what lights you up inside — people, places, interests and passions.

The New Mindset Journal pushes you to discover your truth in a natural and progressive way.

- Case (@case.kenny)

⚡⚡

Video Tour of the Journal

Here's a quick video of Case taking you through the journal first-hand. Watch to learn what you can expect when you first receive your journal.

⚡⚡

How The Journal Came To Be

Even with the effectiveness and popularity of his podcast New Mindset, Who Dis... Case had spent many years feeling lost, uninspired and disconnected from who he really was.

He knew journaling had the potential to help, but he struggled to find a system that worked.

Case personally tried dozens of journals focused on productivity, goal setting, checklists and diary-like activities but none led him to the clarity he needed. He knew something was missing. 

The journal was born from a need -  a journaling experience that focuses on the real foundation to success, happiness, wealth and confidence - SELF AWARENESS.

Goal setting, daily gratitude and productivity tracking are great tools to enhance your life... but Case had learned that without self awareness, it's not very effective.

So, Case created a journal focused on one thing and one thing only: asking questions and providing prompts that lead to self-awareness.

Along the way, he partnered up with his business advisors and good friends - Adam Toren and Matthew Toren - to ensure he had an experienced team that could execute on the purposeful mission of creating a unique, well-manufactured and promptly shipped and delivered journal.

To bring the journal to life in a colorful, well-designed way Case also partnered with talented photographer, videographer and graphic designer Justin Kamstra.

Together, Case and team have created a unique, well-made and effective journal ready to ship and change your life.

    ⚡⚡

    The Team Behind The Journal

    Case Kenny

    Case lives in Chicago, IL and is the host of the New Mindset, Who Dis Podcast. He is also the founder of the PRSUIT mindfulness email series (Entrepreneur Magazine's Favorite Daily Email), and DJ/creator of The Meditation Mixtapes.

    Justin Kamstra

    Justin started to pursue portrait photography in 2017 and studied portraiture under John Reilly in the West Loop of Chicago. His portfolio and expertise includes behind-the-scenes stills, video marketing content, logo design, branding and copy positioning, as well as fully produced photo and video shoots. @justin_kamstra

    Adam Toren

    Adam Toren is an entrepreneurial ninja, a mindful advisor, and a proud family man who never skips his health & wellness routine. As a founder of BalanceWarriors.com and Kidpreneurs.org, he shares his passion for "Whole Life Balance" and encouraging youth in business endeavors. Adam has been instrumental in the growth strategy and successful exit of over ten thriving companies and is the author of three award-winning books.

    Matthew Toren

    Matthew Toren is a nimble entrepreneur who is hard-pressed to pass up a good investment and a good arm wrestling challenge. Known for his acute ability to see the big picture in business, Matthew has successfully advised in the scaling and exiting of over ten prosperous companies. As a best-selling author, Matthew also lends his expertise in his passion projects, which include: Kidpreneurs.org and BalanceWarriors.com.

    ⚡⚡

    Timeline and History

    WE NEED YOUR HELP!!

    The journal has been created, tested and is ready to ship. ✅ ✅ 

    Backing the New Mindset Journal allows us to place bulk orders with our manufacturer, fulfill and ship incredibly fast... and most importantly,  get the highest quality printed journal in your hands so you can begin to transform how you think, act, and feel in 60 days.

    Are you looking for a custom number of journals for friends, family or your business? Email case@newmindsetwhodis.com.

    ⚡⚡

    Are you ready to transform yourself?

    Are you ready to make 2020 your best year ever? A year where you come into your own? Where you have clarity on WHO you are, WHAT you want and where you have the CONFIDENCE to know that you can get it?

    Back The New Mindset Journal and make your transformation a reality.

    Questions? Email case@newmindsetwhodis.com or @case.kenny on Instagram.

story:
Update

The campaign has reached its goal 4 days before the dead-line. I've already created the first version of the Perl Maven eBook. You are still welcome to add more support. You'll be also mentioned on the Perl Tutorial page and in the eBook.

 

Perl Maven Tutorial
 

The Perl Maven Tutorial was written in the last 6 years or so as individual articles. The skeleton was based on my Perl training course, but the articles were written in a rather random order.

Since then Perl and the ecosystem around Perl went through some changes that are not reflected in the articles.

There were also plenty of comments on the articles that could be used to further improve the text.

In addition the articles could be better connected so one leads to the other. Almost like a book.

I'd like to set out on a project to go through the articles.

  • Update them to reflect the newer versions of Perl as well.
  • Incorporate the ideas from the comments.
  • Fill any holes.
  • Streamline the articles so they have a flow both as stand alone articles and as a series of articles that can be merged into a book.

It won't be a small task, but I think many people will benefit from it.
There are over 100,000 readers on the site every month.

The goal of the crowdfunding is to provide me some free time to update the articles. I know it won't cover all the time I am going to spend on it, but I'd like to have some justification.

All the updated material will remain freely available to the general public in HTML format.

I am also going to convert it to an eBook that will be sold via LeanPub, just as I am selling my other eBooks.

 

About the author

You might know me as the author of most of the 800 articles on the Perl Maven site and as the chief editor of the Perl Weekly newsletter. Some of you might also know me personally from YAPCs, Perl Workshops, FOSDEM, or from the 100s of Perl training courses I ran since 2000.

I am asking for your support now in order to help cover the time I am going to spend on this project.

Support and Perks

I set the goal of the campaign to be $4,000 and it is an all or nothing campaign. If we don't reach the goal every will get their money refunded.
As a supporter you can select Perks that include mentioning your name among the supporters on the Perl Maven site and in the eBook generated from the tutorial. If you pledge a higher amount of money you will receive copies of my eBooks:

  • Perl Dancer SPA
  • Collaborative Development with GitHub
  • Bailador - Web development in Perl 6

For details see the list of perks on the right hand side of the page.

 

Worried about your CC? Other forms of payment

You might be worried handing over your Credit Card information to Indiegogo. I don't think you need to. I have not heard any complains of cards being used improperly after my previous 2 campaigns. However if you still prefer to use PayPal you can send the amount directly to me (Indiegogo has stopped accepting PayPal). I'll then submit that amount to Indiegogo if it is necessary to reach the goal.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Regardless if you contribute money or not, you can help the campaign and the project in other ways too:

  • Reach out to your friends, co-workers and ask them to support the campaign. (Use the Indiegogo share tools for that so we can see your impact.)
  • Link to the Perl Tutorial on your web site or on social networks.
  • Go over the articles of the tutorial and comment where you think it needs improvement.
  • Send suggestions what else should be included in the tutorial.
