story:
Short Summary

Help us print & publish a book! It's already written - we just need your support & you get a copy in return for your support!

We want to publish poems created from testimony of people in & around Ground Zero during the 911 tragedy. Other topics of the poems include nature, community, aging, and more. 

Matthew Ferraro is a multimedia composer and has been involved in everything from video games such as "Medal of Honor", the TV series "Futurama" and films "The Insider" ," The Incredibles" and many more. The text that will be printed is from the libretto of the Tensions of Opposites, which was a large-scale multimedia work which opened to standing ovations at the Barbican in London in 2009. Matthew co-wrote the pieces with the poet Elin Ap Hywel and the writer Sabrina Tom. 

What is '13 Seconds and More' About?

We are publishing poems that were created using the testimony of people in and around Ground Zero during the 911 tragedy. Three years later and five years later, Matthew returned to track down those same people to understand how they coped with tragedy and loss. It took about 13 seconds for each building to fully collapse and compress and that is why the piece is entitled "13 Seconds."  All the text in that poem is verbatim.

Other topics that the poems touch on include building community, the inter-generational divide, issues of the wealthy and the poor, and the struggle between man and nature. There are many more interviews and statements from people who have experienced these situations, ranging from Hiroshima to the financial crisis, and the statements were interwoven into mosaics of poetry and prose. The text that we are using is from the libretto of the Tensions of Opposites, which was a large-scale multimedia work which opened to standing ovations at the Barbican in London in 2009. Matthew co-wrote the pieces with the poet Elin Ap Hywel and the writer Sabrina Tom. 

The funding will go to publishing copies of the book in printed and electronic formats, and shipping the book to us & then the readers, which we hope will include you if you choose to participate. If we receive our goal of $2000, we will donate 20% of money raised to Tuesday’s Children, which is a non-profit family service organization providing support and services for the children of 9/11 and others impacted by global terrorism. The overall mission of this project is to increase awareness of the more pertinent issues affecting our society. We believe in the importance of arts and education and taking it one step further by being a solution to the problem by servicing those who are affected by tragedy.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to publish the books, we have to meet a minimum order amount. It’s going to cost us at least $1000 for the absolute minimum order of printed paperback books, ISBN barcodes, and making it available online as an eBook for Kindle, Nook, etc. We plan on giving 20% of the proceeds to Tuesday’s Children. That’s $400 if we make only $2000. We estimate at least another $600 also to pay for the preparation of the graphic design cover & layout of the book, boxes and postage to ship that minimum order of books to you!

If you donate at least $10, you will get a copy of the eBook!

If you donate $20, you will get a copy of the book sent to you!

If you donate $30, you can get an autographed copy from Matthew Ferraro!

If you donate $100, you can get a limited edition broadside of the poem 13 Seconds!

See the broadside here: http://www.indiegogo.com/13seconds?c=gallery&am...

Delivered materials are contingent on the full funding of the project. 

If we don’t reach our goal, we will try to figure out another way to move forward using what funds were donated.  

If we make more than just $2000, we will be able to print more books and donate more money to Tuesday’s Children. If we receive a significant amount more than needed to cover all our costs, then we will use the money to prepare the Tension of Opposites for a premiere in the United States.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with your friends and family. Feel free to email, Twitter, Facebook. You can also use indiegogo's share tools to pass this along online!

Feel free to subscribe to or even add Matthew Ferraro as a friend on Facebook! Get more updates on his work at http://www.facebook.com/ferraromusic.

And thanks for just taking the time to read this!
story_txt:
Short Summary
Help us print & publish a book! It's already written - we just need your support & you get a copy in return for your support!
We want to publish poems created from testimony of people in & around Ground Zero during the 911 tragedy. Other topics of the poems include nature, community, aging, and more. 
Matthew Ferraro is a multimedia composer and has been involved in everything from video games such as "Medal of Honor", the TV series "Futurama" and films "The Insider" ," The Incredibles" and many more. The text that will be printed is from the libretto of the Tensions of Opposites, which was a large-scale multimedia work which opened to standing ovations at the Barbican in London in 2009. Matthew co-wrote the pieces with the poet Elin Ap Hywel and the writer Sabrina Tom. 
What is '13 Seconds and More' About?
We are publishing poems that were created using the testimony of people in and around Ground Zero during the 911 tragedy. Three years later and five years later, Matthew returned to track down those same people to understand how they coped with tragedy and loss. It took about 13 seconds for each building to fully collapse and compress and that is why the piece is entitled "13 Seconds."  All the text in that poem is verbatim.
Other topics that the poems touch on include building community, the inter-generational divide, issues of the wealthy and the poor, and the struggle between man and nature. There are many more interviews and statements from people who have experienced these situations, ranging from Hiroshima to the financial crisis, and the statements were interwoven into mosaics of poetry and prose. The text that we are using is from the libretto of the Tensions of Opposites, which was a large-scale multimedia work which opened to standing ovations at the Barbican in London in 2009. Matthew co-wrote the pieces with the poet Elin Ap Hywel and the writer Sabrina Tom. 
The funding will go to publishing copies of the book in printed and electronic formats, and shipping the book to us & then the readers, which we hope will include you if you choose to participate. If we receive our goal of $2000, we will donate 20% of money raised to Tuesday’s Children, which is a non-profit family service organization providing support and services for the children of 9/11 and others impacted by global terrorism. The overall mission of this project is to increase awareness of the more pertinent issues affecting our society. We believe in the importance of arts and education and taking it one step further by being a solution to the problem by servicing those who are affected by tragedy.
What We Need & What You Get
In order to publish the books, we have to meet a minimum order amount. It’s going to cost us at least $1000 for the absolute minimum order of printed paperback books, ISBN barcodes, and making it available online as an eBook for Kindle, Nook, etc. We plan on giving 20% of the proceeds to Tuesday’s Children. That’s $400 if we make only $2000. We estimate at least another $600 also to pay for the preparation of the graphic design cover & layout of the book, boxes and postage to ship that minimum order of books to you!
If you donate at least $10, you will get a copy of the eBook!
If you donate $20, you will get a copy of the book sent to you!
If you donate $30, you can get an autographed copy from Matthew Ferraro!
If you donate $100, you can get a limited edition broadside of the poem 13 Seconds!
See the broadside here: http://www.indiegogo.com/13seconds?c=gallery&am...
Delivered materials are contingent on the full funding of the project. 
If we don’t reach our goal, we will try to figure out another way to move forward using what funds were donated.  
If we make more than just $2000, we will be able to print more books and donate more money to Tuesday’s Children. If we receive a significant amount more than needed to cover all our costs, then we will use the money to prepare the Tension of Opposites for a premiere in the United States.
Other Ways You Can Help
Please share this campaign with your friends and family. Feel free to email, Twitter, Facebook. You can also use indiegogo's share tools to pass this along online!
Feel free to subscribe to or even add Matthew Ferraro as a friend on Facebook! Get more updates on his work at http://www.facebook.com/ferraromusic.
And thanks for just taking the time to read this!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
This is a book about the never before told story of how a young music producer overcomes the pitfalls of life in the streets of East Oakland and meets one of the most epic rappers in the history of the rap game on his way to making history.

Platinum producer Big Tru has his work cut out for him. All kinds of obstacles  present themselves as his path crosses the on the rise actor/ rapper 2pac.

The journey takes producer Big Tru to one of West Hollywood’s plushest hotel, The Le’ Montrose, then to Echo Sound Studios to record the song Representin ‘93 for the multi-platinum CD S.T.R.I.C.T.L.Y.4.M.Y.N.I.G.G.A.Z.

The book touches on the story of 2pac and the "Menace II Society" movie fiasco. It also touches on the reason behind why the album's title was changed from "Troublesome" to "S.T.R.I.C.T.L.Y.4.M.Y.N.I.G.G.A.Z." And it touches on what happened when a 5-year old boy was shot during a melee in which 2pac was blamed for!!!

What is this campaign for?

  • To cover the cost of editing, printing, and distributing Representin' '93: The Story Behind The Making Of  through major retailers around the country, and bring attention to one of the most epic artist in history -2pac-
  • To raise money for a national book tour and publicity campaign.
  • To honor and remember the late great artist /actor -2pac-

story:
Complete Our Family

My name is Jen and I'm 31, and on September 2, I married my soul mate, Steve, 36, and gained two amazing step-children, Stephen, 14, and Isabella, 10. The only problem is that ten years ago, Steve had a vasectomy and I have no children of my own.

At the time, he was married to his first wife (his kids' mother), and they had decided that two children was enough for them. Well, life goes on and they ended up divorcing. Two years later is when I met Steve. We knew right from the start that this was meant to be. We have so much in common and such similar senses of humor. I had never met anyone that I felt so much for and so comfortable with in such a short time. He was very up front with me about the vasectomy, especially given that I don't have kids. He always said that when the time comes, we have options.

So four years later we finally tie the knot and now we want to have a baby of our own. We have researched all of our options. We knew that having a vasectomy reversal or IVF (in vitro fertilization) was going to be very costly, and we talked to our insurance company only to find out that we don't have any kind of fertility coverage. They will cover a percentage of the office visits and that's about the extent of it. We even considered the option of artificial insemination with an annonymous donor. Steve said that he would be fine with that , that he wants me to experience being a mother and how could he expect me to love his kids the way I do and him not love another? (Not to mention, this method is substantially more affordable).

When we went to our initial consultation with the fertility specialist, we were let down to say the least. He said essentially, we have three options: vasectomy reversal, IVF or IUI with donor sperm. Option one, vasectomy reversal, is somewhat unrealistic. It's very expensive and given our ages and the amount of time since the vasectomy, chances are that he could be producing less healthy sperm or there could be complications or even birth defects. It could also take years for us to get pregnant, if we even do. Option two, IVF, is what he suggests. Of course it's even more expensive than we had anticipated, but it gives us about a 70% success rate, plus, the baby would be biologically both of ours. Option three, IUI, is significantly less expensive, but this also drops our success rate down to 10-15%. Also, Steve would not be the baby's biological father. And, with percentages that small, we would more than likely have to repeat this process a few times before we actually conceived.

IVF seemed like a no-brainer, until we started talking about prices. This method is going to cost $11,400 just for the procedure, plus $1,600 for office visits, hormone labs, medications and testing. My heart broke, it was all I could do not to break down right there in the office. I knew there was no way we could afford this right now or anytime in the forseeable future. We have less than mediocre credit and have been rejected two medical loans already. My husband and I are both in school part time and working full time. I also do cakes on the side, but we still can never seem to get ahead.

I always thought I was lucky in my twenties that I never had any "accidents," but now I'm at the point where I want a child so desperately and it's so hard to stay positive that it'll ever happen. Among my three closest friends, they have six children and one is trying for another. I find myself almost resenting that some women can get pregnant so easily and others have to work so hard for it. I think having a baby is something that every woman should experience at least once (provided she wants children) and I feel that I am more than ready and deserving of loving and caring for a child of my own. I love my step-children very much and they are great kids. We all have so much love in our hearts and we want more than anything to share it with another child.

Any contributions would be greatly appreciated. We will post pictures and constant updates throughout the process to let you all know how it's going. I also know that not everyone can contribute, but if you could just get the word out and share our story, we would appreciate that also. Thank you so much just for taking the time to read our story! :)

story:
Hi! My name is Jill and I'm making my first real zine! 

To start with, I'll tell you about the work you can donate to help produce:

I've written and designed it to feature full color pages representing my state of mind for the past few months. So far it has about ten or so pages. I added images to reflect what it is to be a young woman on the internet next to personal diary entries. All sorts of personal topics are included because I basically decided to share my diary with you!

Now for the reason why I'm choosing this method:

I have no income to put towards printing this up at all! It was recommended by a friend to try this so here I am. I'd like to raise as much money as I can to put towards printing this booklet up on the best quality paper and in full color! That's expensive but possible with your help!

story:
Me llamo Didier Valero, y soy el padre de Luana que acaba de cumplir 7 años, y que se clasifico por el mundial de golf Puma-Cobra FCG World Championship for junior players en La Quinta en Palm Springs, California, del 21 al 23 de julio 2014 (Mundial cobra puma). Este evento reúne cientos de los mejores niños del mundo acompañados de sus padres.

Como los costos del viaje para poder participar en el torneo son considerable, y como nuestros propios recursos son limitados y no permiten cubrir todos estos costos en su totalidad, con su ayuda podemos esperar lograr este sueño.

En Colombia Luana es primera del ranking de su categoría  de las dos competencias donde está actuando a saber en el smile series for kids de la AJGC  y recibió muchas felicitaciones en su último torneo en el Ruitoque de BUCARAMANGA (AJGC noticias). Primera también en el semillero de la federación colombiana de golf ganando sucesivamente las tres últimas paradas (noticias interclubesdegolf) y subcampeona en el USKIDS colombia.

La sola cosa que tienen que hacer es un clic en contribuir

Si no pueden prestar apoyo, estaríamos muy agradecidos si pudieran remitir esta solicitud a cualquiera de sus amigos de redes sociales que  podría apoyar la participación de Luana en el FCG Campeonato del Mundo de Puma-Cobra. 

Mon nom est Didier Valero , et  suis le père  de Luana qui vient d'avoir 7 ans , et qualifiee pour le mondial jeune Puma cobra Golf Championnat du Monde FCG   à La Quinta  Palm Springs, en Californie , du 21 au 23 Juillet 2014 (http://fcg.bluegolf.com/bluegolf/fcg14/event/fc... ) . Cet événement rassemble des centaines des meilleurs enfants du monde accompagnés de leurs parents .

Comme les frais de voyage pour participer au tournoi sont considérables et que nos ressources sont limitées et ne peuvent pas couvrir tous ces coûts , avec votre aide , nous pouvons espérer, réaliser ce rêve .

En Colombie Luana est première dans sa catégorie des deux compétitions de   l´AJGC et a reçu de nombreux compliments sur son dernier tournoi de BUCARAMANGA Ruitoque . Elle est aussi première dans les compétitions  de la Fédération de Golf colombien et à gagner les trois dernières compétitions . Les dons peuvent commencer a 10 dollars pour cela il suffit de cliquer sur CONTRIBUIR

Si vous ne pouvez pas nous soutenir financièrement , nous vous serions reconnaissants si vous pouviez transmettre cette demande à un de vos amis sur les réseaux sociaux qui pourraient soutenir la participation de Luana dans le FCG Championnat du Monde Puma - Cobra .

merci beaucoup...

story:
Hi, my name is Jennifer Pinkley and I'm finishing up a book about the discovery, exploration, and history of one of the most fantastic caves in the southeastern United States: Alabama's Fern Cave. Cavers from Huntsville, Alabama discovered Fern and the 437-foot-deep Surprise Pit in 1961 when the art of exploring deep vertical holes in the ground was in its infancy. Cavers used new and innovative techniques to plumb the depths of the deepest vertical pit yet discovered in the United States. For many years, Fern remained just a challenging vertical pit until 1968 and 1969 when  Huntsville cavers once again made two of the most significant discoveries in southeastern caving history. They discovered the Morgue Cave and New Fern Cave, setting off a flurry of exploration and cave mapping in an attempt to connect all three caves into one system. They would achieve that goal, but the amount of effort that went into exploring the new caves was far beyond what cavers first expected—and along the way, cavers discovered much more cave than they ever imagined. This book describes the entire history of Fern Cave, from its discovery in 1961 to today.

This book will be a quality paperback book, 8 inches tall by 6.5 inches wide with excellent quality paper. There are numerous photos inside the book and they will be printed in black and white. The book is not laid out yet, but it will likely be between 300 and 350 pages. The cover will be in color and will feature about 18 images of the cave and its explorers. Visit my website for sample chapters and much more information about the book.

If you don't like ordering online, please contact me at pinkleyj@gmail.com to pre-order a book via cash or check.

NOTE: For this campaign, I am not charging shipping fees because many people will be able to pick up the book at the NSS Convention, I can give the book to one of your friends to deliver to you, or I can deliver it to you personally. If I need to ship your book to you, please either add $5 to the total amount here, or I will ask that you send me $5 when the book is ready to ship to cover those costs. If you need to have the book shipped, I can let you know when the book is done how much your shipping fee will be (if applicable).

What I Need & What You Get

I want to sell enough advance copies of the book to cover the printing costs, which are substantial. An incredibly talented graphic designer is creating the layout and cover for the book, and I hired a professional editor to make sure the book doesn't have any errors, so it will look great and will be fun to read. I'm also designing an eBook if you prefer that format.

By accepting pre-orders for the book, I'll have seed money to cover the costs, plus I'll have a better idea of how much interest there is in this book so I can better estimate the total number to order. To thank you for supporting this project, you'll be able to choose from a number of great incentives (see the entire list below). The book and perks will be delivered on July 14 (except for online bonus materials: those will be available immediately).

A percentage of the profits for this book will be split between the National Speleological Society Library and the Southeastern Cave Conservancy.

What's So Special About Fern Cave?

Fern Cave is one of the most significant (and magnificent) caves in the southeastern US, and even the country. It's over 15 miles long, is three separate caves connected into one cave system, has fantastically beautiful formations, incredibly complicated passages, important deposits of ancient animal bones, one section of the cave is the winter home for over a million endangered gray bats, and the cave used to be one of the favorite destinations for experienced cave explorers (most of the cave is now closed to any caving--that story is included in the book). The story of how cavers discovered and explored this cave is incredible, especially since when cavers discovered Surprise Pit, modern vertical caving gear did not exist. This book also explains how the US Fish and Wildlife Service bought 4 entrances to the cave in 1981 and teamed up with cavers to responsibly manage the cave to protect both the massive cave itself and the bat colony. The story continues by explaining how that partnership has almost disappeared in the era of white-nose syndrome cave closures. This book is a tale of discovery, exploration, adventure, wonder, politics, nature, biology, science, and beauty. I hope you enjoy it.

The Perks

You can see all of the extras offered on the right, and here are the some of the images you can choose from as extras.

Map Prints:

This is an example of one of the map pages you can select as an perk. Steve Pitts (my husband and former Fern Cave Access Coordinator when there was access to manage) is drafting the surveyed portions of the cave from the remapping effort that started in the 1990s and has several sections at a stage that they can be distributed. Keep in mind that mapping the cave is not complete. The survey project was forced to stop in 2009 when US Fish and Wildlife Service closed the cave and we still have about 6 miles more to survey. But the 8.5 x 11 survey sections depict some of the most important areas in the cave and it's amazing to see how different passages levels overlap and intersect. The section below shows the  portions of the Gold Passage, Middle Cave, and Bottom Cave.

Photos by John Van Swearingen IV:

JV Van Swearingen IV loved Fern and he loved photography. He spent years photographing many areas of the cave and he left his entire photo collection to the National Speleological Society when he died in 2001. The NSS is allowing me to offer his prints as thank you gifts for this project. You'll receive a nice 8 x10 print if you choose one of the options with one of JV's photos. You'll be able to select from some of the photos below, plus some others that I will post later. After this campaign is over, I'll post a wide variety of JV's photos you can choose from. You can just let me know which one you want

The Little Morgue Pit:

Bottom Cave Stream Passage:

If you love bats, Jennifer has a collection of photos from bat inventory trips in the cave that you can also choose. After this campaign is over, I'll post a several photos you can choose from. Just let me know which one you want. This is a closeup of gray bats:

Bonus Materials:
I couldn't fit every great story and every fantastic photograph into the book so I'm creating a password-protected site on my website with lots of extra "bonus" materials. You'll find great stories written by original explorers, many wonderful color photos of people exploring Fern over the decades, and inside information from Jennifer and Steve about the history and current status of the cave. 

Lecture:
For $150 you will receive the book, two 8x10 photos by JV Van Swearingen IV, and two map segments. Jennifer (and Steve if he's available) will also come to your club or community event to give a lecture about the history of Fern Cave, or a lecture about Fern's bats (or really, any topic related to Fern that interests you). This option is limited to locations within a 4 hour drive of the Huntsville, AL area.

Guided Tour:
For $250 you will receive the book, two 8x10 photos by JV Van Swearingen IV, and two map segments. plus Jennifer and Steve will take you on a hike to the Surprise Pit entrance of Fern and describe the history of the cave and all of the entrances. This would be a perfect perk to schedule during the July NSS Convention.

Book Sponsor:
If you want to do more to help this book make it to print, you can sign up as a sponsor. You will receive any of the above perks that you want, plus your name and a personalized message thanking you for your support will appear in the front of the book.

About the Author

Jennifer started exploring caves when she was a 12-year-old Girl Scout. She first visited Fern in 1989 and loved it. She started going back to the cave with various friends to attempt to learn her way around the vast maze of interconnecting rooms, canyons, pits, and passages. Along the way, she met and married Steve Pitts, and Steve taught Jennifer a lot about the cave (Steve currently knows more about Fern than pretty much anyone). Over the years, Jennifer helped map the cave, discovered an animal bone in a remote section of the cave that turned out to be a massive deposit of Pleistocene fossils (around 13,000 years old), helped JV Van Swearingen IV on numerous photography trips, and used to love taking people to simply see the wonders of this fantastic cave. In recent years, Jennifer and Steve also coordinated and conducted winter trips into the heart of the cave to look for signs of white-nose syndrome in the bat colony on behalf of the US Fish and Wildlife Service. Jennifer works as a professional writer. This is her first book. Visit Jennifer's webpage for more information about this book project, including the Table of Contents and sample chapters: http://discoverhistorictravel.com/my-books/fern-cave/
story_txt:
Hi, my name is Jennifer Pinkley and I'm finishing up a book about the discovery, exploration, and history of one of the most fantastic caves in the southeastern United States: Alabama's Fern Cave. Cavers from Huntsville, Alabama discovered
Fern and the 437-foot-deep Surprise Pit in 1961 when the art of exploring
deep vertical holes in the ground was in its
infancy. Cavers used new and innovative techniques to plumb the depths of the
deepest vertical pit yet discovered in the United States. For many years, Fern
remained just a challenging vertical pit until 1968 and 1969 when 
Huntsville cavers once again made two of the most significant
discoveries in southeastern caving history. They discovered the Morgue Cave and
New Fern Cave, setting off a flurry of exploration and cave mapping in an
attempt to connect all three caves into one system. They would achieve that
goal, but the amount of effort that went into exploring the new caves was far
beyond what cavers first expected—and along the way, cavers discovered much
more cave than they ever imagined. This book describes the entire history of Fern Cave, from its discovery in 1961 to today.This book will be a quality paperback book, 8 inches tall by 6.5 inches wide with excellent quality paper. There are numerous photos inside the book and they will be printed in black and white. The book is not laid out yet, but it will likely be between 300 and 350 pages. The cover will be in color and will feature about 18 images of the cave and its explorers. Visit my website for sample chapters and much more information about the book. If you don't like ordering online, please contact me at pinkleyj@gmail.com to pre-order a book via cash or check. NOTE: For this campaign, I am not charging shipping fees because many people will be able to pick up the book at the NSS Convention, I can give the book to one of your friends to deliver to you, or I can deliver it to you personally. If I need to ship your book to you, please either add $5 to the total amount here, or I will ask that you send me $5 when the book is ready to ship to cover those costs. If you need to have the book shipped, I can let you know when the book is done how much your shipping fee will be (if applicable). What I Need & What You GetI want to sell enough advance copies of the book to cover the printing costs, which are substantial. An incredibly talented graphic designer is creating the layout and cover for the book, and I hired a professional editor to make sure the book doesn't have any errors, so it will look great and will be fun to read. I'm also designing an eBook if you prefer that format. By accepting pre-orders for the book, I'll have seed money to cover the costs, plus I'll have a better idea of how much interest there is in this book so I can better estimate the total number to order. To thank you for supporting this project, you'll be able to choose from a number of great incentives (see the entire list below). The book and perks will be delivered on July 14 (except for online bonus materials: those will be available immediately). A percentage of the profits for this book will be split between the National Speleological Society Library and the Southeastern Cave Conservancy. What's So Special About Fern Cave?
Fern Cave is one of the most significant (and magnificent) caves in the southeastern US, and even the country. It's over 15 miles long, is three separate caves connected into one cave system, has fantastically beautiful formations, incredibly complicated passages, important deposits of ancient animal bones, one section of the cave is the winter home for over a million endangered gray bats, and the cave used to be one of the favorite destinations for experienced cave explorers (most of the cave is now closed to any caving--that story is included in the book). The story of how cavers discovered and explored this cave is incredible, especially since when cavers discovered Surprise Pit, modern vertical caving gear did not exist. This book also explains how the US Fish and Wildlife Service bought 4 entrances to the cave in 1981 and teamed up with cavers to responsibly manage the cave to protect both the massive cave itself and the bat colony. The story continues by explaining how that partnership has almost disappeared in the era of white-nose syndrome cave closures. This book is a tale of discovery, exploration, adventure, wonder, politics, nature, biology, science, and beauty. I hope you enjoy it. The PerksYou can see all of the extras offered on the right, and here are the some of the images you can choose from as extras. Map Prints:This is an example of one of the map pages you can select as an perk. Steve Pitts (my husband and former Fern Cave Access Coordinator when there was access to manage) is drafting the surveyed portions of the cave from the remapping effort that started in the 1990s and has several sections at a stage that they can be distributed. Keep in mind that mapping the cave is not complete. The survey project was forced to stop in 2009 when US Fish and Wildlife Service closed the cave and we still have about 6 miles more to survey. But the 8.5 x 11 survey sections depict some of the most important areas in the cave and it's amazing to see how different passages levels overlap and intersect. The section below shows the  portions of the Gold Passage, Middle Cave, and Bottom Cave. Photos by John Van Swearingen IV: JV Van Swearingen IV loved Fern and he loved photography. He spent years photographing many areas of the cave and he left his entire photo collection to the National Speleological Society when he died in 2001. The NSS is allowing me to offer his prints as thank you gifts for this project. You'll receive a nice 8 x10 print if you choose one of the options with one of JV's photos. You'll be able to select from some of the photos below, plus some others that I will post later. After this campaign is over, I'll post a wide variety of JV's photos you can choose from. You can just let me know which one you wantThe Little Morgue Pit:Bottom Cave Stream Passage:If you love bats, Jennifer has a collection of photos from bat inventory trips in the cave that you can also choose. After this campaign is over, I'll post a several photos you can choose from. Just let me know which one you want. This is a closeup of gray bats: Bonus Materials:I couldn't fit every great story and every fantastic photograph into the book so I'm creating a password-protected site on my website with lots of extra "bonus" materials. Jennifer (and Steve if he's available) will also come to your club or community event to give a lecture about the history of Fern Cave, or a lecture about Fern's bats (or really, any topic related to Fern that interests you). This option is limited to locations within a 4 hour drive of the Huntsville, AL area. Guided Tour:For $250 you will receive the book, two 8x10 photos by JV Van Swearingen

story:
The Erotic Writing community faces many challenges.  Profits and readership have grown tremendously with the advent of sites such as Amazon and Smashwords, but the genre still lacks a consistent, unified voice.  In many circles, erotica is still "lumped in" as a subgenre of romance, a categorization which does justice to neither genre.


Businesses profit off of erotica, but often fail to give the genre its due recognition and respect.   Without a united voice for the Erotic Writing community, we could continue to be marginalized while big businesses make money off of our work.  This Indiegogo fundraising event is specifically to set up the Erotic Authors Guild, a non-profit to represent the best interest of the Erotic writing community.

Already, several hundred hours have been donated to getting this project off the ground, but we need a little help from those who write, read and support Erotica. This will be a non-profit group. 

This Fundraising event is to raise funds for four specific goals of the Erotic Authors Guild:

  1. Cover the costs of setting up the non-profit entity which includes a $850 application fee to the IRS, state fee to Incorporate, Federal Tax ID fee and costs for legal review of incorporation documents.
  2. Design and hosting  of a robust website offering a wide variety of resources to members of the Erotic Authors Guild including e-learning tools, author blog pages that allow monetization, reference resources such as Acronym Guides and an Erotica Specific Dictionary, Directory of Service Providers and many more tools and resources designed to assist members of the Erotic Authors Guild.
  3. Pay for the cost of an attorney to write disclaimers for use at the beginning of books that will reduce liability to authors which will be for use of guild members at no cost.  Additionally, crafting of cease and desist letters for copyright infringement, plagiarism and piracy for use by guild members.
  4. Start or acquire a not-for-profit Book Review web site exclusively for the erotica genre. As a guild non-profit site there will be no advertising on the site though the Guild will receive some funds through affiliate agreements for books purchased through the site.  This site will be unique in how it suggests books to readers and allows readers to filter out content that they are not interested in.  Additionally since users will have handles and we will not be automatically feeding any information to social networking sites, readers will have some anonymity that will encourage them to review books and share reading suggestions with other users on the site.

The goal we have set meets the bare minimum costs.  Exceeding the funding goal will mean that we are able to complete the project more quickly and offer more resources to guild members now instead of having to ramp up some of the services we plan to offer.

Our long term vision for the guild includes offering Medical, Dental and Life insurance plans to members at a reasonable cost using the size of the group to get group discounts.  Yearly awards event recognizing the many outstanding authors in the Erotic community and conventions.

The formation of the guild is currently being driven by Lillian Christansen (pen name) who started publishing in 2003 in magazines and on-line.  Though Lillian continued to write Erotica she became disillusioned with the publishing industry and focused on a career in business where she became familiar with accounting,  business and employment law in both the non-profit and for profit world.  In 2012 she left the corporate world (where she worked for one of the biggest e-publishing companies) to write full time.  Her mix of creative erotic writing, fund raising and business savvy will be helpful in the startup of the Erotic Authors Guild.

Dylan Cross (pen name) has started several widely popular groups on Facebook to assist authors with the technical challenges of publishing and to give a marketing outlet to erotic authors.  Dylan also brings in experience with website creation and maintenance, activism as well as many published works on several different publishing platforms.

Several others have stepped up to participate in vetting mission statements, vision, ideology, business plans and other key elements of developing the guild.

Our goal is to complete the legal process to be a non-profit and have a guild website ready to launch by November 1, 2013.  The book review site is more complex and has a planned launch date of January 1, 2014.

Larger companies employ restrictions which adversely affect erotica.  Facebook limits the ability of Erotic Authors to advertise their author pages and books.  Blogger.com limits advertising on Adult Content blogs. Although these companies have no problem using erotica to draw traffic, they nevertheless distance themselves from the genre and force us to use other more expensive marketing options (which these companies also happen to profit from.)

By creating a unified entity, we will have the power of numbers to have a voice which can influence company policies, and create more opportunities for Erotic Authors.

The Guild will be accountable to our membership.  As a non-profit, per the state and IRS rules, there will be a board of directors, meeting minutes will be provided to the membership and reports will be provided on income and expenses. We currently plan on incorporating the non-profit in Nevada.

The current planned cost for full membership in the Erotic Authors Guild is $49 per year.  We know that in the first few months as we gain membership and the resources to provide more benefits and resources, those who join early are stating that they believe in the Guild and we want them to know that we believe in them so for the first three months we will offer the first years dues at $30.

To be a full member of the guild you need to be a published author of erotica.  We will have additional membership options for aspiring authors and for those who provide services to the erotica community.

You don’t have to be an erotic author to donate.  If you love erotica and want to support erotic authors so you can keep reading the stories you love, we would love your support! If you want a credible site that reviews books and stories dedicated to erotica, please donate.

Below is the working draft of our mission statement and guiding principles.  We hope this gives a good idea of our goals and plans, unfortunately it would take novel to give all of the details for everything we are working on and planning. We do appreciate your support and our ultimate goal is to create and support Erotic Authors as a cohesive community.

Our Mission is to promote the advancement of the Erotic genre by supporting authors in various ways including: writing, networking, and marketing resources. Our Goals are not only to establish ourselves in the writing community but also to maintain relationships within the publishing industry. In doing so we strive to bring about the changes necessary to make Erotic Authors equal to that of any other genre.

Being an Erotic Author requires not only skills…

It’s an Art Form!

Take a moment to read through our Guiding Principles. The Erotic Authors Guild will use these guiding principles in deciding where to allocate resources and also to maintain the long term goals and direction necessary to fully benefit not only itself but ALL members of the Guild as well. As the industry changes and the needs of the Authors in our community change it will become necessary to periodically review and adjust these guiding principles as we see fit.

1. Promote the advancement of our genre elevating it above the stigma and generalization

2. Encourage collaboration amongst our community 

3. Provide encouragement, support, and resources to writers who are new to the genre and assist established writers in further development of their craft

4. Establish a benchmark of acceptable standards for our work, including but not limited to: writing, formatting, pricing and marketing

5. Define and maintain categorization of subgenres; propagate those subgenres into the various promoters, marketers and sellers of erotic writing

6. Create and maintain working relationships with other organizations including but not limited to review sites, marketers, and book publishing entities

7. Establish a network and directory of service providers that work with and are familiar with Erotic Writing

8. We will work to either change penalizing policies or find alternative companies that want to both have the profits and support the genre 

9. We will provide resources and support to fight censorship, laws and legislation that effect our genre including creating easier ways to fight and take legal action against plagiarism and piracy

10. We will work to provide Erotic Authors with legal protections for their work

With a clear knowledge and understanding take a moment to become a Member of the Erotic Authors Guild where your membership contribution along with your participation will not only benefit you, but will also benefit the Erotic Author Industry as well.

If you wish to help support the startup of the guild please share a link to this campaign with your readers, other authors and those who support the erotic community.  We can also use help with designing Word Press templates for Guild Author blogs as well as designing logo’s, badges and other guild images.
